f.d: [10. rnam par snang mdzad kyi le'u]
BOOK SIX. Vairocana
bam po bcu gnyis pa/

rigs kyi bu dag /sngon 'das pa'i bskal pa 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi pha rol de bas kyang pha snga'i dus de'i tshe de'i dus na 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho tshul dri ma med par phyogs kun tu snang ba zhes bya ba'i dbus su 'jig rten gyi khams dpal gyi sgra zhes bya ba byung ste/ 'jig rten gyi khams dpal gyi sgra zhes bya ba de ni/ rin po che'i pad+mo mang po'i rgya mtsho la rab tu gnas pa/ rnam par dag cing kun nas nyon mongs pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams ri rab kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi 'khor gyis bskor ba/ kun nas zlum pa'i dbyibs su 'dug pa/ gzhi rgyan mtha' yas pas brgyan pa; rin po che sna tshogs kyi shing gi khor yug brgya phrag gsum gyis kun nas bskor ba/ rin po che'i rgyan thams cad kyi sprin gyis kun nas yog pa/ ri rab dang / grong khyer dang / khang khyim dri ma med cing 'od rnam par snang bas brgyan pa/ zas dang / skom dang / gos kyi longs spyod yid kyis bsam pas 'byung ba/ rgyan gyi rnam pa brjod pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa zhig ste/

THEN THE ENLIGHTENING BEING Universally Good went on to say to the great assembly, “Children of Buddha, in the remote past, as many eons ago as atoms in a world—nay, even twice as long ago as that, there was an ocean of worlds called All-Sided Pure Light. In that ocean of worlds was a world called Supreme Sound, which rested on a sea of nets of crystal flowers, and had as many satellite worlds as atoms in the polar mountain. It was perfectly round in shape, and its ground was replete with innumerable adornments. It had around it three hundred circles of surrounding mountains, forested with trees of myriad precious substances. It was covered by clouds of all kinds of gems. It was illumined by pure shining light. Its cities and mansions were like great high mountains. Food and clothing appeared whenever thought of. The age then was called Variously Adorned.

'jig rten gyi khams dpal gyi sgra zhes bya ba de'i dbus na spos chu'i rgya mtsho 'od rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba yod de/ de las me tog gi ri rab me tog 'od 'phro ba'i rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba rin po che'i khri 'phang bcu'i 'khor gyis bskor cing brgyan pa zhig byung ste/ ri rab de'i steng na nags tshal chen po yal ga'i dkyil 'khor rin po che'i me tog rgyas pa zhes bya ba spos kyi rgyal mtshan stong phrag dpag tu med pa shin tu bsgreng ba'i rgyan can me tog gi khang pa brtsegs pa/ dpag tu med pa'i phreng ba rnam par bres pa/ nor bu'i khang pa brtsegs pa rnam par bkod pa/ rin po che'i rdo rje'i rgyan mtshan dpag tu med pas kun nas brgyan pa/ rin po che'i me tog puN+Da rI ka dpag tu med pa'i phreng gis kun nas bskor ba/ spos dang rin po che'i pad+mo mang po dpag tu med pa thams cad kyis rab tu brgyan pa/ rol mo sna tshogs kyi sgra yid du 'ong ba'i sprin dpag tu med pas kun nas rgyas pa/ spos dang bdug pa'i 'od 'phro ba'i sprin dpag tu med pas kun nas snang bar byas pa/

“In that world Supreme Sound was a sea of fragrant water called Pure Light. From the midst of that sea rose a great polar mountain of lotus flowers, called Banner Adorned All Over with Flowery Flames. It was surrounded by balustrades made of ten kinds of precious elements. On the mountain was a great forest, called Circle of Branches with Jewel Flowers. Arrayed all around it were innumerable flower towers and jewel terraces. Everywhere was richly embellished with innumerable banners of exquisite fragrances, jewel mountain pennants, and jewel lotus blossoms. Innumerable nets of aromatic crystal lotus blossoms were draped all around. There was music, harmonious and pleasing. Fragrant clouds shone. All of these were countless, impossible to fully record.

grong khyer bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag bcu sems can sna tshogs snang bas kun nas bskor ba ste/ 'di ltar nags tshal chen po'i yal ga'i dkyil 'khor rin po che'i me tog rgyas pa zhes bya ba de'i shar phyogs logs na grong khyer chen po 'od 'phro snang ba zhes bya ba/ mi'i rgyal po'i gnas grong khyer bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag bcu'i 'khor gyis bskor ba/ rin po che'i 'ba' zhig las byas pa/ mchu dang zheng du dpag tshad stong phrag bdun yod pa/ rin po che sna tshogs kyi shing thags dang phru ma'i ra ba bdun gyis brgyan cing kun nas bskor ba/ rin po che'i 'obs spos chus gang ba/ rin po che'i me tog ut+pa la dang / pad+mo dang / ku mu da dang / me tog puN+Da rI kas rnam par brgyan pa bdun gyis kun nas bskor ba/ shing ta la'i 'phreng ba rgyan sna tshogs kyi tshogs mang po 'byin pa bdun gyis kun nas bskor ba/ rin po che'i rgyan dang / khang pa brtsegs pas rab tu brgyan pa/ steng nas gser gyi dra ba dang / dril bu'i dra ba dang / me tog gi phreng ba'i dra ba dang / in+d+ra nI la'i dra ba dang / rdo rje'i pad+mo'i dra bas kun nas yog pa/ rin po che'i shing drung me tog gi dra ba dang / rol mo'i sgra mang po thams cad kyi sprin yid du 'ong bas kun tu khyab pa/ spos dang phreng ba rgyan sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa yod de/ de'i 'khor kun na sgo bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag bcu yod de/ sgo de dag thams cad kyang rin po che sna tshogs thams cad kyis byas pa ste/ sgo de dag re re'i mdun yang rin po che'i rdo'i rgyal mtshan rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa bdun bdun gyis brgyan pa'o/ / bza' shing gi ra ba bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag bcus kyang kun nas bskor ba ste/ bza' shing gi ra ba de dag thams cad kyang spos dang rin po che'i shing sna tshogs kun nas spos kyi dri kun tu 'byung ba/ bya sna tshogs thams cad yid du 'ong ba'i sgra 'byin pa'o/ /

“There were a million billion trillion cities all around the forest, with various beings living in them. East of this forest was a huge city called Flame Light, the capital city of a human king, surrounded by a million billion trillion cities, all made of pure, beautiful jewels, each one seventy leagues long and seventy leagues wide, with walls made of seven kinds of precious substances. The armory towers to repel attackers were all high and beautifully adorned, with moats made of jewels and precious metals filled with fragrant water, with blue, red, and white lotuses, all of jewels, spread here and there as ornaments. Seven layers of jewel trees also surrounded the city. The palaces and mansions were all adorned with jewels, draped with various beautiful nets, and graced within with perfumes and scattered flowers. There were a million billion trillion gates, all decorated with jewels, with forty-nine jewel banners in front of each gate, arrayed in ranks. There were also a million billion gardens and groves all around, with various mixed scents and the fragrances of crystal trees wafting through them and perfuming everything. Myriad birds sang in harmony, a delight to the hearer.

grong khyer chen po 'od 'phro ba'i sprin ces bya ba der mir skyes pa thams cad kyang las kyi rnam par smin pas rdzu 'phrul thob pa dag ste; nam mkha' las rgyu ba/ mi dang lha mnyam du spyod pa/ yid bzhin gyi yul la longs spyod pa sha stag go /

“The inhabitants of this great city had all perfected the bases of mystic power as a result of what they had done. They could travel through the sky like celestial beings. Whatever they wanted came to them when they thought of it.

de nas lho phyogs logs na lha'i grong khyer shing gi me tog sna tshogs zhes bya ba yod do/ / de nas lho phyogs logs na klu'i grong khyer kun tu rdzogs pa zhes bya ba yod do/ / de nas lho phyogs logs na gnod sbyin gyi grong khyer rdo rje'i dpal sna tshogs kyi rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba yod do/ / de nas lho phyogs logs na dri za'i grong khyer gzhal med khang bzang po zhes bya ba yod do/ / de dang 'dabs chags su lha ma yin gyi grong khyer 'khor lo'i tshon ces bya ba yod do/ / de dang 'dabs chags su 'dab ma bzang po'i grong khyer rin po che sna tshogs bzang po'i lte ba zhes bya ba yod do/ / de dang 'dabs chags su bram ze'i grong khyer rgyan bzang po sna tshogs zhes bya ba yod de/ de dag la sogs pa grong khyer bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag bcu'i 'khor gyis bskor ba'o; ;grong khyer de dag re re zhing yang rgyan mang po du mas brgyan pa nas grong khyer bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi 'khor gyis bskor ba'i bar du ste/

“Just south of that city was a celestial city called Adorned with Tree Blossoms. To the right of that was a great dragon city called Ultimate. Next to that was a yaksha city called Supreme Banner of Diamonds. Next was a gandharva city called Beautiful Palace. Next was a titan city called Jewel Wheel. Next was a garuda city called Array of Beautiful Jewels. Next was a royal Brahma heaven city called Various Wonderful Adornments. There were a million billion trillion such cities, each surrounded by a million billion trillion palaces, each with innumerable adornments.

nags tshal chen po yal ga'i dkyil 'khor rin po che'i me tog rgyas pa zhes bya ba de'i dbus na snying po byang chub rin po che'i me tog rnam par snang ba zhes bya ba rin po che thams cad kyi shing yal ga stug cing rgya che ba'i dkyil 'khor rab tu rgyas pas kun nas bskor ba/ rin po che'i me tog gzugs dang dbyibs rnam pa tha dad pa mang po shin tu rgyas pa/ spos dang / me mar rin po che thams cad kyi kha dog ltar 'dug pa'i phreng ba mang po rgya chen po'i sprin kun tu bkres pa/ rin po che'i 'od thur tu 'phro bas zhing kun tu khyab pa/ 'od kyi dkyil 'khor rnam par dag pa'i sprin gyis brgyan pa/ phyogs bcu 'od zer mang pos rnam par snang bar byas pa/ rgyan thams cad rin po che sna tshogs mang pos spras pa/ rol mo thams cad kyi sgra dbyangs shin tu 'byung ba/ nor bu'i rgyal po thams cad las byang chub sems dpa'i lus 'byung ba/ phyogs bcur me tog sna tshogs mang po rab tu 'byung ba yod de;

“In this great forest Circle of Branches with Jewel Flowers was a sanctuary called Jewel Flowers Illumining Everywhere, arrayed with many huge jewels, with wreaths of crystal flowers blooming everywhere, blazing with fragrant lamps, covered by flaming clouds containing the colors of all jewels, with webs of light shining everywhere. All the ornaments constantly produced exquisite jewels, and all kinds of music played with elegant sounds. Diamonds showed the bodies of enlightening beings. There were various exquisite flowers everywhere.

de'i mdun du pad+mo chen po me tog gi ze ba 'od 'phro ba'i dkyil 'khor ces bya ba/ rgyar dpag tshad bye ba phrag brgya yod pa/ rtsa ba spos dang / rin po che dang / rdo rje'i rgya mtsho la zug pa/ chu ba rin po che sna tshogs kyi tshon gyis rnam pa sna tshogs su gyur pa/ rin po che rnam pa tha dad pa tshad med pa'i 'dab ma can/ rin po che'i 'od 'phro ba dang / spos kyi ze ba'i dkyil 'khor gyis brgyan pa/ snying po la rin po che kha dog mtha' yas pa'i tshon bkye ba/ pad+mo'i dkyil 'khor brjod du med pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag bcu'i 'khor gyis bskor ba/ phyogs bcur 'od kyi dkyil 'khor rgya chen po rab tu 'gyed pa/ ze ba thams cad las yid du 'ong ba'i sgra 'byung ba mngon par byung ngo/ /

“In front of that sanctuary was an ocean called Fragrant Diamonds, which produced a huge lotus flower called Flaming Circle of Flower Pistils. That flower was a hundred billion leagues across; its stem, leaves, pistils, and base were all of wonderful jewels. It was surrounded by unspeakable hundreds of thousands of billions of trillions of lotuses, constantly radiating light and emanating beautiful sound filling all directions.

'jig rten gyi khams dpal gyi sgra zhes bya ba der de bzhin gshegs pa ri rab bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byung ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa ri rab bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed de dag las bskal pa'i thog ma pa thams cad kyi thog mar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa ni/ yon tan thams cad kyi ri bo ri rab kyi dbyangs zhes bya ste/ des 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i tshul dri ma med par phyogs kun tu snang ba zhes bya ba 'di yongs su sbyangs so/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /'jig rten gyi khams dpal gyi sgra zhes bya ba der lo brgyan de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ngo/ / zhes bya ba'i tshe nags tshal chen po yal ga'i dkyil 'khor rin po che'i me tog rgyas pa zhes bya ba de yang rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan par gyur te/ 'di ltar rin po che'i 'od 'phro'i sprin bsam gyis mi khyab pa rab tu gtong ba'i snying po can du gyur nas sangs rgyas kyi yon tan gyi dkyil 'khor gyi sgra yang rab tu 'byin/ phyogs bcu dag kyang 'od zer gyi dra bas rnam par snang bar byed/ gzhal med khang dang / khang khyim gyi rdul thams cad kyang rab tu snang bar byed/ rin po che'i me tog dang / 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gyi sprin yang rab tu 'gyed/ sems can thams cad kyi sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yangs pa'i sgra dang / dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mtshan gyi 'khor lo rab tu gtong ba'i sgra dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi smon lam dang / spyod pa dang / 'byung ba mngon par sgrub pa'i sgra dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi 'khor lo'i nges pa'i tshig sna tshogs rab tu bsgrags pa'i sgra dag kyang rab tu 'byin to/ /

“In the first eon of that world Supreme Sound as many Buddhas as atoms in ten mountains appeared in the world. The first Buddha was called Supreme Clouds on the Mountain of All Virtues. A hundred years before that Buddha was to appear in the world, all the adornments in the great forest Circle of Branches with Jewel Flowers all became pure. That is to say, they produced inconceivable numbers of clouds of jewel flames emanating voices praising the virtues of Buddhas; radiant nets of light intoning the voices of countless Buddhas covered all quarters; the palaces and mansions reflected each other in their glow; lights from jewel flowers clustered into clouds and produced sublime sounds telling of the extensive roots of goodness practiced by all living beings in past times, telling of the names of the Buddhas of past, present, and future, telling of the ultimate path of the vows and deeds carried out by all the enlightening beings, telling of the sublime teachings of the enlightened ones. The manifestation of such magnificent signs revealed that the Buddha was about to appear in the world.

de dag ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa skye ba'i ltas te/ rgyan de dag byung bas 'jig rten gyi khams der de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung bar 'jig rten gyi dbang po rnams kyis khong du chud do/ / de bzhin gshegs pa las mnyam pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa dang / sangs rgyas blta bar mos pa dang / snying po byang chub tu mngon par gzhol ba de dag thams cad kyang ltas sngon du byung bas yang dag par bskul to/ / bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa yon tan thams cad kyi ri bo ri rab kyi dpal zhes bya ba mnyam pa nyid kyis chos kyi dbyings kun tu khyab pa'i sku can/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du yongs su skye ba rab tu 'phros pa/ sku snying po byang chub thams cad la bzhugs pa/ gzugs kyi sku mtha' dang dbus med pa/ rnam par dag pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du mngon par 'phags shing zil gyis gnon pa/ mtshan rin po che'i me tog thams cad shin tu rgyas pa/ sems can thams cad kyi gnas su gzugs brnyan rab tu 'byung ba/ 'gro ba thams cad la mngon du ston pa/ sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa kha dog mtha' yas pa'i sprin gyi dra ba rab tu 'gyed pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gyi sprin gyis khyab par mdzad pa/ 'od zer gyi dra ba kha dog mtha' yas pa rab tu gtong ba de/ pad+mo chen po de la mngon par byung bar gyur to/ /

“Because the kings in that world all saw those signs, their roots of goodness became mature and they all came to the site of enlightenment desirous of seeing the Buddha. Then the Buddha Supreme Cloud on the Mountain of All Virtues suddenly appeared on a big lotus blossom in that sanctuary. His body was everywhere, equal to the cosmos, appearing to be born in all buddha-fields, going to all sites of enlightenment. His boundless pure form was thoroughly pure and could not be outshone by any being in any world, replete with all noble characteristics, each one distinctly clear. His image appeared in all palaces, and all living beings could witness it with their own eyes. Boundless phantom Buddhas emanated from his body, with auras of various colors filling the universe.

ji ltar spos chu'i rgya mtsho rnam par dag pa'i 'od la rab tu gnas pa'i ri rab me tog gi 'od 'phro bas brgyan pa'i rgyal mtshan gser shin tu 'bar ba'i rgyan ces bya ba'i rtse mo la nags tshal chen po yal ga'i dkyil 'khor rin po che'i me tog rgyas par sangs rgyas kyi gdan la bzhugs pa de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams dpal gyi sgra kun tu yang ri rab bye ba stong phrag drug cu rtsa brgyad kyi rtse mo la bzhugs par kun nas snang ngo/ / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho kun tu tshul rgya che ba kun gyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa dag gi gling bzhi pa thams cad na'ang snying po byang chub la bzhugs par snang ngo/ /

“As on the top of the mountain Banner Adorned with Flowery Flames in this sea of fragrant water Pure Light, in the midst of the great forest Circle of Branches with Jewel Flowers, that Buddha appeared bodily sitting there, so did he appear and sit atop every one of the sixty-eight trillion high mountains in the world Supreme Sound.

de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa yon tan thams cad kyi ri bo ri rab dpal gyi sprin gyi smin mtshams kyi mdzod spu nas 'od zer dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yongs su skyed pa zhes bya ba 'od zer sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi 'khor gyis bskor ba rab tu bkye ste/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad khyab par mdzad nas 'dul ba thams cad yang dag par bskul to/ / bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa yon tan thams cad kyi ri bo ri rab dpal gyi sprin gyis 'od zer de dag bkye ma thag tu de'i mod la sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa thams cad kyang rab tu zhi bar gyur/ sgrib pa'i dra ba thams cad kyang shin tu bsal/ sangs rgyas blta ba'i sgrib pa'i ri thams cad kyang rnam par bcom/ sems can thams cad kyi rnyog pa yang rnam par dag /dge ba'i rgya mtsho thams cad kyang rab tu byung / mos pa yangs pa'i dkyil 'khor yang yongs su dag /mi khom pa dang / ngan song dang / ngan 'gro'i g.yang sa dang / 'jigs pa thams cad kyang rnam par bsal/ lus dang sems kyi gnod pa thams cad kyang rab tu zhi/ sangs rgyas mthong bas dga' ba'i shugs kyang rnam par dag /thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la rab tu gzhol ba yang shin tu thob par gyur te/ de dag 'od zer des yang dag par bskul ba dang / 'jig rten gyi dbang po thams cad 'khor brgya stong du ma dag gis bskor cing bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der 'dong bar gyur to/ /

“At that point the Buddha emitted a great light beam from between his brows. That light beam was called Producing the Sounds of All Roots of Goodness, and was accompanied by as many light rays as atoms in ten buddha-fields. That light filled all lands in the ten directions, and if there were any sentient beings with the potential to be harmonized, that light touched them with its radiance and they immediately awoke on their own, ending all feverish confusion, sundering the web of obstruction, smashing the mountains of barriers, clearing away all pollution, developing great faith and resolution, producing excellent roots of goodness, forever leaving the fears of the various difficulties, annihilating all the miseries of mind and body, conceiving the will to see the Buddha and head for omniscience. At that time, all the world leaders and their retinues, countless hundreds of thousands, having been awakened by Buddha’s light, all went to the Buddha and prostrated themselves before him.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /de la grong khyer chen po 'od 'phro ba'i 'od ces bya ba der rgyal po blta na dga' ba shin tu gtsang ba'i blo gros zhes bya ba/ grong khyer bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag bcu'i bdag po byung ste/ de la bud med bsod nams kyi dpal la sogs pa stong phrag sum cu rtsa bdun yod do/ / de la bu gzi brjid chen po la sogs pa lnga brgya yod do/ / rgyal po'i bu gzi brjid chen po la yang bud med blta na bzang ba la sogs pa stong phrag bcu yod do/ / de nas rgyal bu gzhon nu gzi brjid chen pos sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa mthong nas sngon gyi dge ba'i rgyus chos bcu khong du chud par gyur to; ; bcu gang zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yon tan gyi dkyil 'khor ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin khong du chud do/ / 'di lta ste/ sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi dbyings la sgo kun nas rab tu 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin khong du chud do/ / 'di lta ste/ tshul yangs pa'i sprin gyi snying po zhes bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khong du chud do/ / 'di lta ste/ 'gro ba thams cad 'dul ba'i rgyan chen po zhes bya ba'i byams pa chen po khong du chud do/ / 'di lta ste/ sgra'i sprin gyis kun nas rgyas par byed pa zhes bya ba'i snying rje chen po khong du chud do/ / 'di lta ste/ yon tan mtha' dang dbus med pas yang dag par 'phags pa zhes bya ba'i dga' ba chen po khong du chud do/ / 'di lta ste/ chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i btang snyoms chen po khong du chud do/ / 'di lta ste/ tshul gyi gzhi rgya chen po rgya mtsho'i snying po zhes bya ba'i mngon par shes pa chen po khong du chud do/ / 'di lta ste/ mos pa rgya mtsho'i stobs dang shugs rnam par 'phel bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i smon lam gyi tshul gyi sgo chen po khong du chud do/ / 'di lta ste/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi 'od la yang dag par gzhol ba'i shugs zhes bya ba'i so so yang dag par rig pa'i ye shes chen po'i sgo khong du chud do/ /

“In the great city Flame Light was a king called Benevolent Mind a Joy to Behold. He reigned over a million billion trillion cities. He had thirty-seven thousand wives and concubines, the principal one being Auspicious Sign of Blessings. He had five hundred sons, the eldest being Light of Great Power, who himself had a thousand wives, the principle one being Exquisite Sight. At that time, the prince Light of Great Power, having seen the Buddha’s light, due to the power of the roots of goodness he had cultivated, immediately realized ten kinds of teachings: he realized the concentration of the spheres of the virtues of all Buddhas; he realized all-sided memory power of all Buddha teachings; he realized transcendent knowledge containing a vast store of skillful techniques; he realized the great culture of kindness harmonizing and pacifying all living beings; he realized great compassion whose reverberations are like clouds extending everywhere; he realized the great joy of the supreme mind which gives birth to boundless virtues; he realized the great equanimity which is aware of all things as they really are; he realized the great spiritual power of the impartial treasury of extensive skill in means of liberation; he realized the great aspiration which increases power of faith; he realized the gate of brilliant intellectual powers entering into omniscience.
de nas rgyal po gzhon nu gzi brjid chen po zhes bya ba de/ chos kyi snang ba chen po thob nas sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis 'khor gyi tshogs thams cad la tshigs su bcad de smras pa/
“Then Prince Light of Great Power, having attained illumination of these teachings, receiving mystic power from the Buddha, looked over the great masses and spoke some verses, saying,

nyi ma mang po stong gi rnams/ / mkha' la mngon par 'phags pa bzhin/ / snying po byang chub dri med la/ / sangs rgyas 'od ni shin tu snang / /
bskal pa bye ba stong dag gis/ / mgon po 'jig rten byung ba ni/ / sangs rgyas yang dag skyes pa rnams/ / rgyal ba kun ni rab tu snang / /
ltos shig sangs rgyas 'od zer la/ / sangs rgyas sprin ni bsam mi khyab/ / gnas rnams kun na kun kyang snang / / de bzhin gshegs pa mnyam par bzhag /
'od 'phro'i sprin rnams rab bkye ba/ / 'od zer sprin la zad mi shes/ / 'jig rten 'di dag snang bar byed/ / sangs rgyas rnam par 'phrul la ltos/ /
sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku dag las/ / 'od zer rnams ni dri med pa/ / sems can kun dang mnyam pa'i lus/ / phyogs dang phyogs mtshams rgyas 'gengs ltos/ /
sangs rgyas gsung ni yid 'ong ba/ / 'gro ba kun tu rab tu bsgrags/ / 'gro kun dbyangs kyi yan lag tu/ / sangs rgyas yon tan rnam par brjod/ /
sangs rgyas 'od kyis phog pa yis/ / sems can kun kyang bde bar gyur/ / sdug bsngal thams cad rab tu zhi/ / 'gro ba kun kyang dga' ba skyes/ /
byang chub sems dpa'i sprin gyi rnams/ / rin chen sprin rnams rab 'gyed cing / / bstod pa'i sprin gyis rgyal ba'i drung / / phyogs bcu kun nas mngon par 'ongs/ /
snying po byang chub 'di la yang / / sgra yi rgya mtsho zab mo grags/ / sems can thams cad sdug bsngal zhi/ / sangs rgyas rnam par 'phrul la ltos/ /
kun kyang sri zhu ldan gyur te/ / dga' zhing shin tu mos byas shing / / chos kyi rgyal po blta ba'i phyir/ / 'jig rten mgon gyi drung du 'dong / /

The Buddha sits on the site of enlightenment; Pure and clear is his great radiant light, Like a thousand suns emerging Illumining all over space.
After countless billions of ages Does the Guide appear; Now the Buddha’s come into the world, Beheld and attended by all.
Observe the Buddha’s light, Its inconceivable phantom Buddhas, In every single palace Reposed in true absorption.
See the Buddha’s mystic powers Producing clouds of flames from his pores, Illuminating the world With light that has no end.
Behold the Buddha’s body, With webs of light most pure, Manifesting forms equal in number to all beings, Filling the ten directions.
His wondrous voice pervades the world And all who hear rejoice; In the languages of all living beings They praise the Buddha’s virtues.
Illumined by Buddha’s light, All beings are peacefully happy; All pains of existence cleared away, Their minds are filled with joy.
See the hosts of enlightening beings Gathering from the ten directions, All emitting crystal clouds Extolling the praises of Buddha.
The enlightenment site produces wondrous sound, Extremely deep and far reaching, Able to eliminate the suffering of sentient beings; This is the Buddha’s spiritual power.
Everyone’s paying reverent respect, All greatly joyful at heart, Together before the World Honored One, Gazing at the King of Truth.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /rgyal bu gzhon nu gzi brjid chen pos tshigs su bcad pa 'di brjod pa'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis 'jig rten gyi khams dpal gyi sgra thams cad kyi sems can gyi gnas kun tu shin tu grags par gyur to/ /
“When the prince, Light of Great Power, spoke these verses, his voice pervaded the world Supreme Sound, by the mystic power of the Buddha.
de nas rgyal po blta na dga' ba shin tu gtsang ba'i blo gros kyis tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag thos nas dga' ba chen po skyes te/ rang gi 'khor de dag la tshigs su bcad de smras pa;
The king, Benevolent Mind a Joy to Behold, heard these verses and was greatly pleased; he looked at his retinue and said in verse,

zhang blon rnams dang gzhon nu dang / / rgyal po'i mi dang blon po dang / / tshong pa rnams dang de bzhin du/ / yul mi rnams kyang kun 'dus shig /
grong khyer rnams ni kun tu yang / / rnga sgra dag gis myur du sgrogs/ / kun kyang mthun par lhan cig tu/ / rgyal ba blta ba'i phyir dengs shig /
srang rnams thams cad kun tu yang / / dge ba'i dril gyi sgra sgrogs shig / bu dang chung ma 'khor bcas pa/ / rgyal ba blta ba'i phyir yang 'deng / /
grong khyer rnams kyang brgyan par gyis/ / rgyan rnams kun dang bla re bres/ / rgyal mtshan dam pa bzang po'i rnams/ / nor bu sna tshogs brgyan pa sgreng / /
rin chen dra ba'i bla re rnams/ / nam mkha'i dkyil du bres par gyis/ / nam mkha' 'di las thams cad du/ / sil snyan sprin gyi sgra dag phyung / /
lam gyi srang yang brgyan par gyis/ / rin chen char yang kun tu phob/ / bzhon pa rin chen bstad par gyis/ / rgyal ba blta ba'i phyir 'dong ngo/ /
rang rang so so'i 'khor rnams kyis/ / sna tshogs sprin gyi char phob cig / rgyan gyi sprin rnams thams cad kyis/ / nam mkha'i dbyings kyang dgab par gyis/ /
spos dang pad+mo'i 'od kyi sprin/ / me tog gdugs rnams bsam yas dang / / se mo do dang phreng sprin rnams/ / gos kyi sprin gyi char phob cig /
ri rab rnams dang spos kyi ri; ; nor bu'i 'khor los brgyan par gyis/ / dri med tsan+dan phye ma rnams/ / nam mkha'i dkyil la rab tu ston/ /
nor bu'i phreng dang me tog phreng / / rin chen phreng ba dri med dang / / rin chen sgron ma'i phreng ba rnams/ / nam mkha'i dbyings la sgrub par gyis/ /
thams cad sangs rgyas mngon gyis la/ / dga' zhing spro ba'i sems bskyed de/ / bu dang 'khor du bcas pa rnams/ / rgyal ba blta phyir kun 'dong ngo/ /

You should quickly assemble All the various kings, Their princes and great ministers, Their governors, and the rest.
Announce in all the cities They should beat the great drum Gathering all the people To go and see the Buddha.
At every single crossroad Jewel bells should be rung: Let wives, children, households, Together go to see the Buddha.
All the city castles Should be ordered cleaned: Raise beautiful banners everywhere Decorated with jewels.
Myriad skeins of jewel gauze, Music wafting like clouds, Beautifully arrayed in the sky: Let everywhere be filled.
Let the streets be cleaned, Showered with beautiful cloth; Adorn your jeweled chariots And see the Buddha with me.
Each, according to his power Shower ornaments everywhere, All like clouds spreading Filling the whole sky.
Lotus canopies of fragrant flames, Half-moon jewel necklaces, And countless fine garments: You should dispense them all.
Seas of the greatest perfumes, Discs of finest crystal, As well as purest sandalwood: All should fill the skies.
Garlands of many jewels, Ornaments pure and flawless, As well as crystal lamps: Set all of them in the air.
Bring them all to the Buddha With hearts full of joy; Wives, children, retinue, all Go see the World Honored One.

de nas rgyal bu blta na dga' ba shin tu gtsang ba'i bdag po bsod nams dpal la sogs pa bud med stong phrag sum cu rtsa bdun dang / gzi brjid chen po la sogs pa gzhon nu lnga brgya dang / blo gros kyi stobs la sogs pa blon po stong phrag drug cu dang / de dag la sogs pa 'khor bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong bdun cu rtsa bdun gyis bskor cing mdun du bdar te grong khyer chen po 'od 'phro snang ba nas byung nas sde'i 'khor dang bcas pa nam mkha'i dbyings su mngon par 'phags te/ rgyal po'i rdzu 'phrul chen po dang / rgyal po'i mthu chen pos nam mkha' thams cad rgyan gyi sprin thams cad kyis rnam par brgyan te bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der dong nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te phyogs gcig tu 'khod do/ /

“Then the king, together with his thirty-seven thousand wives and concubines, five hundred sons, and sixty thousand great ministers, of whom the chief was Power of Wisdom, as well as others, a company totalling seventy-seven million billion trillion, went out of the city of Flame Light, all of them traveling through the sky by the power of the king, their various offerings filling the sky. Coming to the Buddha’s place, they prostrated themselves at his feet, then sat to one side.

lha'i grong khyer shing gi me tog sna tshogs zhes bya ba nas kyang lha'i dbang po rab mtshe ma'i rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba lha bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong dang lhan cig tu bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der dong ste bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag 'tshal nas phyogs gcig tu 'khod do/ / klu'i grong khyer kun tu rdzogs pa nas kyang klu'i rgyal po bcu dri ma med pa'i 'od ces bya ba klu bye ba nyi shu rtsa lnga dang lhan cig /gnod sbyin gyi grong khyer rdo rje'i dpal rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba nas kyang gnod sbyin gyi bdag po dpa' bas rgyal ba zhes bya ba gnod sbyin bye ba bdun cu rtsa bdun dang lhan cig /dri za'i grong khyer gzhal med khang bzang po nas kyang dri za'i rgyal po blta na dga' ba zhes bya ba dri za bye ba dgu bcu rtsa bdun dang lhan cig /lha ma yin gyi grong khyer 'khor lo'i tshon nas kyang lha ma yin gyi dbang po gzugs rnam par dag pa las sems dpa' zhes bya ba lha ma yin bye ba stong phrag lnga brgya'i 'khor gyis bskor ba / nam mkha' lding gi grong khyer rin po che sna tshogs bzang po'i lte ba nas kyang nam mkha' lding gi bdag po stobs bcu spyod pa zhes bya ba nam mkha' lding gi 'khor dgu bcu rtsa dgu dang lhan cig /mi 'am ci'i grong khyer rtse ba'i dga' ba dang ldan pa nas kyang mi 'am ci'i dbang po rdo rje dpal zhes bya ba mi 'am ci bye ba phrag bco brgyad dang lhan cig /lto 'phye chen po'i grong khyer rin po che rdo rje sra ba'i rgyal mtshan nas kyang lto 'phye chen po'i dbang po rin po che grags pa'i rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba lto 'phye chen po bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag gsum dang lhan cig /tshangs pa'i grong khyer rgyan bzang po sna tshogs nas kyang tshangs pa'i dbang po gzhan gyis pham pa med pa zhes bya ba tshangs pa bye ba phrag bco brgyad kyi 'khor gyis bskor cing mdun du byas te bcom ldan 'das yon tan thams cad kyi ri bo ri rab kyi dpal de bzhin gshegs pa gang na ba der dong nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag 'tshal nas phyogs cig tu 'khod do/ / de dag la sogs pa grong khyer bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong grong khyer gyi 'khor dang bcas pa dag nas sems can gyi ris tha dad pa na gnas pa'i rgyal po mang po 'khor dang bcas te bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der dong ste bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal nas phyogs cig tu 'khod do/ /

“There was also the celestial king Banner of Good Influence from the city Beautiful Flowers, with a company of ten billion trillion. There was also the dragon king Pure Light from the city Ultimate Greatness, with a company of twenty-five billion. There was also the yaksha king Fierce Strength from the city Supreme Diamond Banner, with a company of seventy-seven billion. There was also the gandharva king Gladdening Sight from the city Undefiled, with a company of ninety-seven billion. There was also the titan king Contemplation of Pure Form from the city Beautiful Sphere, with a company of fifty-eight billion. There was also the garuda king Exercise of Ten Powers, from the city Exquisite Array, with a company of ninety-nine billion. There was also the kinnara king Indestructible Qualities from the city Playful Enjoyment, with a company of eighteen billion. There was also the mahoraga king Banner of Noble Repute from the city Diamond Banner, with a company of three billion hundred thousand trillion. There was also the brahma king Supreme from the city Pure Adornments, with a company of eighteen billion. The kings from a million billion trillion such cities, along with their retinues, all went together to the Buddha Supreme Cloud on the Mountain of All Virtues, prostrated themselves at his feet, then sat to one side.

de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa yon tan thams cad kyi ri bo ri rab kyi dpal gyis sems can de dag 'dul ba'i dbang nye bar bzung ste 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gyi rgya mtsho der dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas thams cad yang dag par 'byung ba'i chos rnam par 'phrul ba zhes bya ba'i mdo'i 'khor 'jig rten gyi khams rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang bcas ba bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can rnams la yongs su bstan to/ /

“Then that Buddha, in order to harmonize and pacify the sentient beings, expounded the scripture Universal Collection of Methods of Freedom of All Buddhas of Past, Present, and Future, along with subsidiary scriptures as numerous as atoms in the world, causing all beings to receive benefit according to their mentalities.

de nas byang chub sems dpa' gzi brjid chen pos chos kyi gzhung 'di bstan pa thos nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa yon tan thams cad kyi ri bo ri rab kyi dpal gyis sngon yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i chos rgya mtsho la chos kyi snang ba rab tu thob bo/ / 'di lta ste/ chos thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor mnyam pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo la ye shes kyi snang ba rab tu thob bo/ / 'di lta ste/ thog ma chos thams cad la yang dag par gzhol ba'i byang chub kyi sems la gnas pa'i ye shes snang ba rab tu thob bo/ / 'di lta ste/ chos kyi dbyings kyi phyogs rnam par snang ba'i snying po'i mig rnam par dag pa la ye shes snang ba rab tu thob bo/ / 'di lta ste/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi ye shes rgya mtsho rab tu snang zhing rnam par dbye ba'i smon lam rgya mtsho la ye shes snang ba rab tu thob bo/ / 'di lta ste/ yon tan chen po rgya mtsho mtha' dang dbus med pa rnam par dag pa la rab tu 'jug pa'i spyod pa'i dkyil 'khor la ye shes snang ba rab tu thob bo/ / 'di lta ste/ sgo yangs pa nas snang ba zab mo yang dag par 'byung ba rgya mtsho la ye shes snang ba rab tu thob bo/ / 'di lta ste/ phyir mi ldog pa'i stobs chen po'i shugs kyi snying po dang / mthu chen po'i rgya mtsho la ye shes snang ba rab tu thob bo/ / 'di lta ste/ chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang dbus med par sprul pas brgyan cing 'byung ba'i dkyil 'khor la ye shes snang ba rab tu thob bo/ / 'di lta ste/ yon tan gyi dkyil 'khor rgya mtsho tshad med par rab tu 'jug pa la mngon par sgrub pa rgya mtsho'i ye shes snang ba rab tu thob bo/ / 'di lta ste/ sangs rgyas thams cad rnam par dmigs shing mos pa rgya mtsho'i sprin gyi rgyan yang dag par sgrub pa rgya mtsho la ye shes snang ba rab tu thob bo/ / 'di lta ste/ chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang dbus med pa dang mnyam par de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par dmigs par bya ba dang / 'gro ba thams cad mngon du bstan pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul ba rgya mtsho la ye shes kyi snang ba rab tu thob bo/ / 'di lta ste/ sangs rgyas kyi chos stobs dang mi 'jigs pa thams cad la ye shes kyi snang ba rab tu thob bo/ /

“At that point the enlightening being Light of Great Power, having heard this teaching, attained the lights of the ocean of teachings collected in former ages by the Buddha Supreme Cloud on the Mountain of All Virtues. That is to say, he attained the light of knowledge of concentration on the equality of all groups of things; the light of knowledge of all truths entering and abiding in the mind in its initial determination for enlightenment; the light of knowledge of the pure eye of the repository of the omnipresent light of all the universes of the ten directions; the light of knowledge contemplating the ocean of great vows of all Buddhas; the light of knowledge of pure action entering the boundless sea of virtue; the light of knowledge of the storehouse of immensely powerful speed heading for the stage of nonregression; the light of knowledge of the sphere of emancipation with the power to appear in any form anywhere in the universe; the light of knowledge certainly entering the ocean of fulfillment of all virtuous qualities; the light of knowledge of the ocean of perfection of the adornment of certain understanding of all Buddhas; the light of knowledge of the ocean of spiritual power by which the boundless Buddhas of the cosmos appear before all sentient beings; the light of knowledge of the states of the powers and fearlessness of all Buddhas.

de nas byang chub sems dpa' gzi brjid chen pos de bzhin gshegs pa yon tan thams cad kyi ri bo ri rab kyi dpal gyi sngon gyi sbyor ba rgya mtsho la ye shes kyi snang ba rab tu thob nas sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
“Then the enlightening being Light of Great Power, having attained innumerable such lights of knowledge, imbued with power from the Buddha, spoke these verses:

rgyal ba'i chos nyid 'di thos nas/ / bdag gi ye shes snang ba skyes/ / des ni sangs rgyas sngon spyod pa/ / rgya mtsho rnams kyang rab tu mthong / /
sku tshe kun tu ji lta bur/ / phun sum tshogs gyur kun kyang mthong / / mtshan gyi rnam pa rnam dmigs dang / / gang gis sangs rgyas mchod pa'ang shes/ /
sngon chad sangs rgyas drung dag tu/ / bskal pa rgya mtshor spyod spyad de/ / sangs rgyas rgya mtsho mang mchod nas/ / zhing gi rgya mtsho yongs su sbyangs/ /
sku yi rgya mtsho mang po dag / rgyal chen yongs su kun btang zhing / / spyod pa'i dam pa rab spyad de/ / rgya mtsho'i zhing yang shin tu sbyangs/ /
snyan dang shangs mang rgya mtsho dang / / phyag zhabs dbu yang de bzhin te/ / rgyal srid btsun mo'i 'khor btang zhing / / zhing gi rgya mtsho yongs su sbyangs/ /
zhing rnams so so re re la/ / bskal pa bye ba bsam yas su/ / byang chub spyod pa rab spyad de/ / zhing gi rgya mtsho rab tu sbyangs/ /
kun tu bzang po'i smon lam gyi/ / spyod pa rgya mtsho kun spyad nas/ / sangs rgyas rgya mtsho kun drung du/ / zhing gi rgya mtsho rab tu sbyangs/ /
ji ltar nyi ma'i 'od snang bas/ / nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor mthong ba bzhin/ / sangs rgyas ye shes 'od snang pas/ / sngon gyi spyod pa rnams kyang mthong / /
byang chub 'tshang rgya zhi ba yi/ / chos kyi dbyings ni kun gang ba'i/ / zhing gi rgya mtsho dag pa'i rnams/ / dri med 'od can kun kyang mthong / /
sangs rgyas kun gyi byin rlabs kyis/ / byang chub spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe/ / zhing gi rgya mtsho yangs pa'i rnams/ / de ltar bdag gis spyad par bya/ /

I’ve heard the Buddha’s wondrous teachings And attained the light of knowledge, Whereby I see the World Honored One’s Deeds in days of yore.
All the places he was born, His different names and physical forms, And his offerings to the Buddhas: All of this I see.
In the past he served All the enlightened ones, Practicing for innumerable eons, Purifying oceans of worlds.
Giving up his body Without any bound or limit, Cultivating supreme action, He purified oceans of lands.
Ears, nose, head, and limbs, As well as his dwelling places: All he gave up, numberless, To purify all worlds.
Able in every land Through unthinkable eons To practice enlightening acts, He purified oceans of lands.
By the power of the vow of universal good In all oceans of Buddhas, He cultivated innumerable practices Purifying oceans of worlds.
As by the light of the sun We can see the solar orb, By the light of Buddha knowledge I see The path the Buddha traveled.
I see the great pure light Of Buddha’s ocean of worlds Calmly realizing enlightenment Pervading the whole cosmos.
I will, like the World Honored One, Purify oceans of lands, And by the Buddha’s spiritual power Practice enlightening ways.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' gzi brjid chen pos bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa yon tan thams cad kyi ri bo ri rab kyi dpal gyi sprin de mthong ba dang / bsnyen bkur ba dang / mchod pas de bzhin gshegs pa las mngon par khong du chud de/ 'jig rten thams cad ni/ snang bar byed/ sngon gyi sbyor ba rgya mtsho ni/ rab tu rjod; byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rgya mtsho'i tshul ni/ rab tu sgrog /sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yon tan rgya mtsho'i tshul ni/ shin tu rjod/ chos kyi dbyings thams cad la yang dag par gzhol ba'i ye shes kyi sgo yongs su sbyang ba ni/ shin tu ston/ snying po byang chub thams cad la mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i rnam par 'phrul pa ni/ rab tu rjod/ sangs rgyas kyi stobs dang / mi bsnyengs pa dang / ye shes tha mi dad pa ni/ shin tu rjod/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku sgo kun nas rnam par dmigs shing mthong ba ni/ rab tu rjod; sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni/ shin tu ston/ sangs rgyas kyi rnam par spyod pa mtha' dang dbus med pa'i rgyan ni; rab tu ston/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa dang / smon lam ni/ mngon par sgrub pa byed cing / sems can ri rab kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byang chub tu sems bskyed de sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa'ang yongs su 'dzin du btsud do/ /

“At that time the enlightening being Light of Great Power, because he saw the Buddha Supreme Clouds on the Mountain of All Virtues and had served him and provided him with offerings, was able to attain understanding there, and, for the sake of all beings, revealed the ocean of the Buddha’s past practices, revealed the techniques he employed in the past as an enlightening being, revealed the ocean of virtues of all Buddhas, revealed the independent power of attaining buddhahood at all sites of enlightenment, revealed the pure knowledge which enters into all phenomena, revealed the impartial knowledge of the power and fearlessness of Buddhas, revealed the universal manifestation of the Buddha, revealed the inconceivable mystical metamorphoses of the Buddha, revealed the adornment of innumerable buddha-lands, revealed all the practical vows of universally good enlightening beings, causing as many sentient beings as atoms in a mountain to awaken the determination for enlightenment, causing as many sentient beings as atoms in a buddha-field to perfect the pure land of the enlightened.
de nas de bzhin gshegs pa yon tan thams cad kyi ri bo ri rab dpal gyi sprin gyis byang chub sems dpa' gzi brjid chen po la tshigs su bcad de gsungs pa/
“Then the Buddha Supreme Clouds on the Mountain of All Virtues spoke these verses for the enlightening being Light of Great Power:

sems can kun la phan pa'i phyir/ / byang chub don du khyod zhugs pa/ / gzi brjid chen po legs so legs/ / bsod nams snying po grags pa che/ /
snang ba khyod kyis rab tu non/ / chos kyi dbyings ni khyab byas shing / / bsod nams chen po sprin ldan pa'i/ / sangs rgyas ye shes rgya mtshor 'gyur/ /
bskal pa zhing gi rdul snyed du/ / zhing gcig na yang spyod spyad cing / / nga yi ye shes ji lta bur/ / khyod kyis mthong ba de ltar 'gyur/ /
tshul 'di kun nas shes par ni/ / brtson 'grus chung ngus mi nus te/ / brtson 'grus stobs chen ldan pa'i rnams; ; rgya mtsho'i zhing rnams dag par byed/ /
thams cad rdul la 'jug tshul du/ / bskal pa rgya mtshor su spyod pa/ / rgya mtsho'i zhing gi rgyan gyi rnams/ / de la 'di 'drar rab tu 'gyur; ;
sems can rnams ni re re'i phyir/ / bskal pa rgya mtshor spyad spyod cing / / 'khor kyang skyo ba med pa'i rnams/ / de dag 'jig rten mgon por 'gyur/ /
bskal pa phyi ma'i mthar thug pas/ / rgyal ba re rer mchod byed kyang / / gang gi sems la skyo med pa/ / de dag de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur/ /
dus gsum gshegs pa'i mgon po kun/ / khyod kyi smon lam dbang gis gsal/ / sangs rgyas kun gyi 'khor rnams na/ / khyod kyi lus kyang rab tu gnas/ /
sangs rgyas kun gyi smon lam dag / mtha' dang dbus med rgya mtsho la/ / blo chen gang rnams 'jug pa ni/ / de dag tshul 'dir gnas par 'gyur/ /
nga la mchod pa byas pas kyang / / gzi brjid chen po'i stobs chen gyis/ / sems can ri rab rdul mnyam pa; ; byang chub yongs su smin par byas/ /
byang chub sems dpa' grags chen dag / kun tu bzang po dpa' ba'i rnams/ / chos kyi dbyings ni kun bkang zhing / / zhing gi rgya mtsho dag par byed/ /

Excellent, magnificent Light! Mine of blessings, of wide renown! For the purpose of aiding all beings You set forth on the road of enlightenment.
You’ve attained the light of knowledge Filling the universe; Your virtue and wisdom are both great, You shall attain the deep ocean of knowledge.
Cultivating practices in a land For as many eons as atoms: As you have seen me doing thus, So you’ll attain such knowledge.
It is not those of base deeds Who are able to know these techniques: Only by determined effort Can one purify an ocean of worlds.
In each and every atom Cultivating for countless eons, Only such a one is able To adorn the buddha-lands.
Spending eons in transmigration For the sake of every being Without weariness of mind, One will then become a guide of the world.
Offering support to every Buddha Until the end of time, Never getting tired of it, One will attain the highest path.
All Buddhas of all times Will together fulfill your hopes; You will attend in person The congregations of all Buddhas.
Boundless are the vows Of all the enlightened ones; Those who have great knowledge Are able to know their means.
Great Light, you’ve given me offerings And thereby attained great power, Causing beings as many as atoms To mature and turn toward enlightenment.
The great enlightening beings Who cultivate the practice of universal good Adorn the Buddhas’ oceans of worlds Throughout the universe.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /de la bskal pa rgya chen po rig pa zhes bya ba de la bskal pa bar ma chu klung gang+gA'i bye ma snyed cig byung ste/ de'i dus na mi rnams kyi tshe yang bskal pa bar ma gnyis thub par gyur te/ rgyal ba'i sras dag /de bzhin gshegs pa yon tan thams cad kyi ri bo ri rab dpal gyi sprin de'i sku tshe'i tshad ni/ lo bye ba phrag lnga bcur gyur to/ / de yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas de bzhin gshegs pa pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyan bzang po rgyan gyi rgyal po zhes bya ba 'jig rten du nags tshal chen po yal ga'i dkyil 'khor rin po che'i me tog rgyas pa de nyid la byung ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyan bzang po rgyan gyi rgyal po de mngon par sangs rgyas pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa rgyal bu gzhon nu gzi brjid chen pos mthong ngo/ / mthong nas kyang sgo rgya mtsho mtha' yas pa'i snying po zhes bya ba rab tu thob bo/ / ye shes rgya chen po'i byin gyi rlabs dang / chos kyi klong gi gzungs kyang rab tu thob bo/ / kun gyi rjes su song bar 'gro ba 'dul ba'i rnam par thar pa zhes bya ba'i byams pa chen po yang rab tu thob bo/ / dmigs pa'i sgo'i sprin thams cad kyis rgyas par byed pa zhes bya ba'i snying po yang rab tu thob bo/ / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yon tan rgya mtsho dang / byin gyi rlabs kyi mdzod ces bya ba'i dga' ba chen po yang rab tu thob bo/ / chos kyi rang bzhin nam mkha'i dbyings rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba'i btang snyoms chen po yang rab tu thob bo/ / rang bzhin dri ma med pa'i chos kyi dbyings yongs su dag pa'i lus zhes bya ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang rab tu thob bo// chags pa med pa'i dbyings rnam par snang ba'i rjes su song ba zhes bya ba'i mngon par shes pa yang rab tu thob bo/ / rab tu khong du chud pas dri ma med pa'i klong la yang dag par 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i so so yang dag par rig pa yang rab tu thob bo/ / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi dkyil 'khor yongs su dag par byed pa zhes bya ba'i ye shes kyi snang ba yang rab tu thob bo; ; de dag la sogs pa chos kyi sgo stong phrag bcu kun nas non par gyur te/

“In that eon of Great Adornment there were as many small eons as grains of sand in the Ganges River; the human life span was two small eons. That Buddha Supreme Clouds on the Mountain of All Virtues lived for fifty billion years; after he passed away, there appeared in the world another Buddha, named King of Adornments of the Good Eye of the Transcendent Ways, who also attained true awakening in that great forest Circle of Branches with Jewel Flowers. At that time, the youth Light of Great Power, seeing that Buddha attain perfect enlightenment and manifest the power of spiritual awareness, thereupon attained absorption in buddha-remembrance, called gate of the boundless oceanic treasury, attained a concentration formula spell called depths of truth of the power of great knowledge, attained great kindness called expediently pacifying and liberating all living beings, attained great compassion called cloud covering all realms, attained great joy called treasury of power of the ocean of virtues of all Buddhas, attained great equanimity called spacelike equality and purity of the real essence of all things, attained transcendent knowledge called pure body of the real cosmos inherently free from defilement, attained psychic power called unhindered light appearing anywhere, attained analytic power called entering the pure depths, and attained light of knowledge called pure treasury of all enlightening teachings. He comprehended a thousand gates of teaching like these.
de nas rgyal bu gzhon nu gzi brjid chen pos sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis 'khor gyi tshogs thams cad la tshigs su bcad de smras pa/
“Then the youth Light of Great Power, imbued with the power of the Buddha, spoke these verses for the benefit of his retinue:

bskal pa bye ba bsam gyis mi khyab tu/ / 'jig rten gtso bo'i dam pa shin tu dkon/ / sangs rgyas zhing 'di sems can thob rab thob/ / de dag sangs rgyas gnyis pa 'di yang mthong / /
sangs rgyas sku las 'od rnams rab bkye ba/ / kha dog mtha' yas rgya chen rnam par dag / 'od zer sprin gyis 'jig rten kun tu khyab/ / kun tu rgyal ba'i yon tan grags par byed/ /
'od kyis reg pa rmad kyi dga' ba skye/ / 'gro ba de dag kun gyi sdug bsngal zhi/ / phan tshun sri zhu byams pa'i sems gyur cing / / sangs rgyas rnam 'phrul 'di dag kun kyang mthong / /
sprul pa'i dra ba'i sprin rnams bsam mi khyab/ / rnam pa du ma'i 'od kyi dra ba 'gyed/ / phyogs bcu'i zhing rnams kun kyang gang byas shing / / sangs rgyas rnam par 'phrul pa rab tu ston/ /
rgyal ba rnams kyi spu rtse re re nas/ / dbyangs sprin bkye bas nam mkha' kun bkang zhing / / mun nag chen po kun nas snang bar byed/ / dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal kun kyang rnam par sel/ /
sangs rgyas dbyangs ni phyogs rnams bcu po na/ / sems can rnams kyi sngon dge rgya mtsho rnams/ / thams cad dbyangs kyis kun tu sgra yang sgrog / sangs rgyas rnam par 'phrul pa de dag ltos/ /
sangs rgyas 'khor rnams rgya mtsho rgya che ba/ / mtha' dang dbus med yang dag rab tu byung / / de na rgyal ba chos kyi 'khor lo bskor/ / sems can rgya mtsho mi zad rnams kyang 'dul/ /
tshad med rnam par 'phrul ba dag la ltos/ / zhing rnams kun na rgyal ba mngon par bzhugs/ / de ltar bde gshegs ye shes chags pa med/ / sems can don du rnam pa mngon sangs rgyas/ /
dga' zhing mos par kun kyang 'dong bar gyis/ / bde ba'i yid dang sri zhu spro ba yis/ / bde gshegs de ni blta ba'i phyir 'dong ngo/ / de mthong sdug bsngal thams cad zhi bar 'gyur/ /
byang chub sems ni yang dag bskyed byas shing / / 'gro ba kun la byams pa'i sems 'gyur te/ / kun tu bzang po'i smon lam kun btab cing / / chos rgyal ji bzhin bdag cag 'gyur bar bya/ /

Even in inconceivably many billions of eons An enlightened guide of the world is hard to meet; The beings of this land are very fortunate That now they can see their second Buddha.
The Buddha’s body emanates great light With physical forms boundless and totally pure, Filling all lands like clouds, Everywhere extolling the Buddha’s virtues.
All illumined by the light rejoice, Beings in distress are all relieved, All are induced to respect and kindness: This is the work of the Buddha’s power.
Producing inconceivable clouds of mystic displays, Emanating networks of lights of infinite colors Filling all lands in the ten directions: These are manifestations of Buddha’s psychic powers:
From each hair pore appear clouds of light Filling all space, emitting great sound: All dark places are illumined, Causing the pains of hells to disappear.
Buddha’s wondrous voice pervades everywhere, Fully producing all sounds of speech, According to the power of beings’ standing goodness: This is a function of the Teacher’s mystic power.
Measureless, boundless, the oceans of communities: Buddha appears within each one, Expounding the inexhaustible truth for all of them, Harmoniously pacifying all sentient beings.
Buddha’s mystic powers have no end, Appearing in every single land; Such is the Buddha’s knowledge, unimpeded: He attains enlightenment to benefit all beings.
You should all be joyful; Dance, delight, and pay respect. I will go with you there: If one sees the Buddha, all miseries will cease.
Arouse your minds to seek enlightenment, Kindly care for all living beings, Abide by the great vows of universal goodness, And you’ll attain freedom like the King of Truth.

sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis de'i sgra la thogs pa med pas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du khyab par gyur te/ de thos pa'i sems can tshad med pa rnams kyang byang chub tu smon lam btab par gyur to/ / de yang pha dang ma dang lhan cig tu 'khor thams cad dang / sems can bye ba phrag khrag khrig brgya stong de dag gis bskor cing mdun du byas te/ rin po che'i gdugs kyi sprin lngas nam mkha' thams cad du kun nas yog par byas te bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der dong ngo/ / 'ongs pa de dag la bcom ldan 'das pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyan bzang po rgyan gyi rgyal po de bzhin gshegs pas chos kyi dbyings rang bzhin dri ma med pa'i rgyan ces bya ba'i mdo/ 'jig rten khams kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi mdo'i 'khor can yang dag par bstan to/ /

“When the youth Light of Great Power spoke these verses, by the power of the Buddha his voice was unimpeded and could be heard in all worlds; innumerable sentient beings aroused the will for enlightenment. Then the prince Light of Great Power, together with his parents and their company, surrounded by countless millions of billions of trillions of beings, with jeweled canopies like clouds filling the skies, went together to the Buddha King of Adornments of the Good Eye of Transcendent Ways. That Buddha expounded for them the scripture The Pure Adornments of the Essential Nature of the Cosmos of Realities, with as many subsidiary scriptures as atoms in an ocean of worlds.

des de thos nas tshul thams cad rnam pa dag pa la 'jug pa 'byung bar rab tu skyes so/ / ye shes kyi rim pa rnam par dag cing dri ma med pa'i snang ba zhes bya ba yang non par gyur to/ / pha rol tu phyin pa'i dkyil 'khor 'gro ba thams cad dga' bar lta ba'i rgyan ces bya ba la yang zhugs par gyur to/ / zhing thams cad du yang dag par 'jug pa dang / snang ba mtha' yas pa mthong bas rnam par dag pa'i spyod pa'i dkyil 'khor la yang rab tu zhugs so/ / spyod pa'i dkyil 'khor bsod nams kyi sprin dri ma med pa'i 'od kyi rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba la yang rab tu zhugs par gyur to/ / rjes su rtogs pa'i dkyil 'khor chos rgya mtsho 'byams klas pa thams cad snang ba zhes bya ba yang rjes su rtogs par gyur to/ / 'jug pa'i dkyil 'khor ye shes chen po'i shugs kyi rgyan ces bya ba la yang rab tu zhugs so/ / rang byung du 'gyur ba shin tu mthong ba'i shugs kyis dbang bskur ba'i ye shes rgya mtsho la yang zhugs par gyur to/ / de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan rgya mtsho'i mtshan nyid kyi 'od rnam par snang ba'i snang ba chen pos kyang shin tu snang bar gyur to/ / smon lam gyi stobs tshad med pa la mos pa rgya mtsho'i snying po'i smon lam mngon par sgrub pa'i ye shes kyi stobs la yang rnam pa dag par gyur to/ /

“Having heard these scriptures, that great congregation attained pure knowledge called entry into all pure techniques of enlightenment, attained a stage called undefiled light, attained a sphere of transcendence called showing delightful adornments in all worlds, attained a sphere of expanding action called pure vision with boundless light entering all worlds, attained a sphere of purposeful activity called banner of light of clouds of pure virtue, attained a sphere of constant realization called vast light of the ocean of all verities, attained ever-deepening progressive practice called adornment of great knowledge, attained an ocean of knowledge of high initiates called extremely refined effortless vision, attained an obvious great light called universal shining of light characterized by the ocean of virtues of the enlightened, and attained pure knowledge productive of will power called treasury of faith and resolution of immeasurable will power.
de nas de bzhin gshegs pa pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyan bzang po rgyan gyi rgyal pos byang chub sems dpa' gzi brjid chen po la tshigs su bcad de gsungs pa/
“Then that Buddha spoke these verses for the enlightening being Light of Great Power:

legs so yon tan ye shes rgya mtsho can/ / sangs rgyas byang chub smon lam yang dag gnas/ / sems can kun gyi mgon dang gnas gyur pa'i/ / rgyal ba dam pa bsam gyi mi khyab 'gyur/ /
ye shes rgya mtsho chen por mngon par byung / / chos kyi dbyings su thams cad rgyas byas te/ / sangs rgyas spyod yul rgya chen mi zad pa'i/ / bsam gyis mi khyab tshul la 'jug par 'gyur/ /
sangs rgyas thams cad yon tan sprin mthong pa'i; ; ye shes sa yang mi zad non par gyur/ / pha rol phyin pa rgya mtsho kun gyi tshul/ / grags pa chen po yongs su rgyas par byed/ /
gzungs kyi tshul rnams rgya mtsho mang po dang / / so so yang dag rig tshul mi zad dang / / spyod pa smon lam khyod kyis mngon bsgrubs pas/ / gzhal med ye shes ldan par khyod 'gyur ro/ /
ting nge 'dzin gyi rgya mtshor 'jug par 'gyur/ / smon lam rgya mtsho'i nang du khyod skyes te/ / rnam 'phrul 'di la'ang shin tu 'byung bar 'gyur/ / 'di ni sangs rgyas chos nyid bsam mi khyab/ /
chos dbyings dam pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i/ / bsam pa rgya chen rnam par sbyangs byas te/ / sangs rgyas sprin la rnam pa blta bar gyis/ / rgya mtsho'i zhing rnams dri med rnam par sbyongs/ /
nga yi byang chub spyod la 'jug par gyis/ / sngon gyi sbyor tshul rgya mtsho mang po yi/ / spyod pa ngas ni ji ltar rnam sbyangs su/ / de 'dra'i tshul yang khyod kyis shes par gyis/ /
zhing rnams re re sangs rgyas mang po ngas/ / rgya mtsho brgya mang shin tu mchod pa byas/ / sngon spyod de yi 'bras bu 'di yin te/ / 'di 'dra dri ma med pa'i rgyan la ltos/ /
las kyi rgya mtsho mi zad rgya chen dang / / zhing rnams rgya mtsho dag bya'i spyod pa dang / / smon lam bsam yas go cha bgos pas na/ / 'di rnams 'di 'dra'i rnam par 'phrul bar 'gyur/ /
sangs rgyas rgya mtsho ma lus mchod byas shing / / zhing rnams rgya chen rgya mtsho sbyangs byas nas/ / bskal pa 'byams klas kun tu sbyangs byas shing / / rgyal pa'i yon tan 'od chen mnga' bar 'gyur; ;

Excellent, O sea of virtue and wisdom, Is your resolve for great enlightenment; You shall attain inconceivable buddhahood And be a reliance for all living beings.
You’ve produced a great ocean of knowledge Able to fully comprehend all things; With inconceivable subtle skills You’ll enter buddhahood’s endless realm.
Having seen the Buddhas’ clouds of virtues And entered the stage of infinite wisdom, The ocean of all transcendent means You will fulfill, o glorious one.
Having attained command of methods And inexhaustible expressive powers, Practicing various active vows You’ll realize the peerless knowledge.
Having produced a sea of vows And entered the ocean of concentration, You’ll fulfill great spiritual powers And all the inconceivable qualities of Buddhas.
The ultimate realm of truth is inconceivable; Your vast, deep faith is already pure; You see the oceans of lands, purely adorned, Of all the Buddhas in the ten directions.
You’ve entered into my enlightenment practices, The ocean of means I employed in the past; That which my practices purified, This sublime action, you understand.
I gave various offerings to oceans of Buddhas In countless individual lands; As the fruit realized by that practice Such adornments all you see.
Over an inexhaustible ocean of immense eons Cultivating pure practice in all lands With firm aspiration, inconceivable, You’ll attain this mystic power of Buddhas.
Giving offerings to all the Buddhas, Adorning the lands, all pure, Cultivating mystic practices in all ages, You’ll fulfill the great virtues of Buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /de bzhin gshegs pa pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyan bzang po rgyan gyi rgyal po de yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas blta na dga' ba shin tu gtsang ba'i bdag po de yang dus byas par gyur te/ rgyal bu gzhon nu gzi brjid chen pos 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal srid thob par gyur to/ / nags tshal chen po yal ga'i dkyil 'khor rin po che'i me tog rgyas pa zhes bya ba der yang de bzhin gshegs pa bsod nams rgya mtsho shin tu 'phags shing zil gyis mi non pa zhes bya ba gsum pa byung bar gyur te/ des de bzhin gshegs pa de mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i rnam par 'phrul pa mthong nas 'khor thams cad dang / dpung gi yan lag bzhi'i tshogs dang / rin po che bdun dang / grong gi mi dang / yul mir bcas te bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa bsod nams rgya mtsho shin tu 'phags shing zil gyis mi non pa gang na bzhugs pa der dong nas des bcom ldan 'das de la rin po che'i khang pa brtsegs pa spos dang nor bu thams cad kyi rgyan gyi snying po zhes bya ba phul lo/ / der de bzhin gshegs pa des kun tu lta ba'i spyod pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa snang ba zhes bya ba'i mdo/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi mdo'i 'khor dang bcas pa'ang yang dag par bshad par gyur to/ / de thos nas byang chub sems dpa' gzi brjid chen pos bsod nams chen po rnam par snang ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin rab thob bo/ / ting nge 'dzin de thob pas kyang dus gsum gyi byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi bsod nams rgya mtsho mngon du gyur to/ /

“When the Buddha King of Adornments of the Good Eye of Transcendent Ways had entered extinction, the king Benevolent Mind a Joy to Behold also subsequently passed away, and his son Light of Great Power inherited the position of great monarch, in that great forest Circle of Branches with Jewel Flowers a third Buddha appeared in the world, by the name of Ocean of Supreme Virtue. At that time, when the sovereign Light of Great Power saw the signs of that Buddha’s realization of enlightenment, he went, together with his family and courtiers, his armies, and the populace of the cities, towns, and villages, all carrying seven kinds of jewels and precious metals, to that Buddha and presented a great mansion adorned with all kinds of aromatic crystals. Then that Buddha, there in the forest, expounded the scripture The Illuminating Activity of the Enlightening Being with the Universal Eye, along with subsidiary scriptures as numerous as atoms in a world. Then the enlightening being Light of Great Power, having heard this teaching, attained a contemplative focus called universal light of great virtue. And because he had attained this state of mental focus, he was able to know the past, present, and future seas of good and evil of all enlightening beings and all sentient beings.

de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa bsod nams rgya mtsho shin tu 'phags shing zil gyis mi non pas 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad la rnam par gzigs te byang chub sems dpa' gzi brjid chen po la tshigs su bcad de gsungs pa/
“Then that Buddha spoke these verses for the enlightening being Light of Great Power:

yon tan bsod nams kun gyi gzi brjid can/ / byang chub mchog tu smon lam yid ldan pa/ / 'gro ba kun la snying rje rgya mtsho yis/ / nga yi drung du khyod 'ongs legs so legs/ /
snying rje'i snying po khyod ni sems can rnams/ / sdug bsngal gyur pa kun grol don zhugs pas; ; 'gro ba kun gyi mgon dang skyabs su 'gyur/ / byang chub spyod pa'i tshul yang de yin no/ /
byang chub sems dpa' shin tu brtan pa rnams/ / skyo med yid kyis spyod pa spyad pa dag / mchog tu gyur cing dam pa chags med pa'i/ / ye shes 'di 'dra shin tu thob par 'gyur/ /
de ltar khyod ni kun tu bzang po yi/ / mthu chen smon lam spyod par zhugs bas na; ; bsod nams 'od dang bsod nams dpal yin te/ / bsod nams 'byung gnas bsod nams mchog kyang yin/ /
bsam gyis mi khyab rgyal pa rgya mtsho dag / mtha' dang dbus med mang po khyod kyis shes/ / mtha' dang dbus med de dag mthong gyur nas/ / de dag bsod nams rgya mtsho rtogs par 'gyur/ /
khyod kyi phyogs bcu'i zhing rnams thams cad kyi/ / rgyal ba'i sprin rnams kun kyang shin tu mthong / / de dag spyod pa rgya mtsho thams cad kyang / / sngon chad ji ltar spyad pa bzhin du mthong / /
'di tshul rgya mtsho 'di la su zhugs shing / / ye shes sa la su dag gnas gyur pa/ / de dag sangs rgyas kun gyi rjes slob cing / / thams cad gzigs par gdon mi za bar 'gyur/ /
khyod ni zhing kun rgya mtsho'i rdul snyed kyi/ / bskal pa rgya mtsho'i spyod pa spyad byas nas/ / rgyal ba kun gyi sngon spyad rgya mtsho rnams/ / bslab nas rang byung nyid du 'gyur bar 'ong / /
zhing rnams rgya mtsho yongs su dag pa rnams/ / phyogs bcu dag tu ji ltar mthong ba bzhin/ / khyod kyi zhing yang rnam par dag 'gyur te/ / smon lam kun kyang shin tu sgrog par 'gyur/ /
'khor gyi rgya mtsho 'di dag thams cad kyang / / khyod kyi smon lam thos gyur rab tu dga'/ / kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa'i lam dag gis/ / byang chub mchog la rab tu 'jug par 'gyur/ /
mtha' dang dbus med zhing rnams 'byams klas bar/ / bskal pa rgya mtsho dag tu spyad pa spyod/ / kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa thams cad dang / / smon lam rnams kyang yongs su rdzogs par gyis/ /

Excellent, O virtuous Light of Great Power, That you all have come to me; With sympathy for all living beings You’ve conceived the supreme will for enlightenment.
For the sake of all suffering beings You exercise great compassion to liberate them. You’ll be a reliance for all who are lost; This is called the skillful enlightening work.
If enlightening beings can, with firm strength, Carry out supreme practices unflagging, The highest supreme unhindered understanding And subtle knowledge they will attain.
O light of virtue, banner of blessings, Abode of virtue, sea of blessings, All vows of universal good enlightening Your great light can enter.
With these great vows you can enter The inconceivable ocean of Buddhas. The sea of Buddhas’ blessings has no bounds: You can see all by sublime understanding.
In the lands of the ten directions You see infinite, boundless Buddhas; The ocean of past practices of those Buddhas You can see, all as they were.
Any who dwell in this ocean of means Can enter the stages of knowledge; This is following the Buddhas to learn, Surely leading to omniscience.
In all oceans of worlds you performed Various practices for oceans of eons; The ocean of practices of all enlightened ones You having learned, you’ll become a Buddha.
As you see in the ten directions All oceans of lands are extremely pure; Your land will also be pure like that, Attained by one with boundless vows.
The oceanic masses at this sanctuary, Having heard your vows, all rejoice; All enter the great vehicle of universal goodness, Inspired and dedicated to enlightenment.
In each of the boundless lands, All enter practice for oceans of eons, By the power of vows able to fulfill All the practices of the enlightening being Universally Good.

nags tshal chen po yal ga'i dkyil 'khor rin po che'i me tog rgyas pa de nyid du de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par grags pa'i spyan pad+mo'i dpal zhes bya ba byung bar gyur to; ; rgyal po gzi brjid chen po de yang de nas shi 'phos nas rgya mtsho'i steng na lha'i grong khyer rin po che zhi ba'i gnas zhes bya bar phyin te/ der bsod nams dri ma med pa'i dpal zhes bya ba'i lha'i rgyal po chen por gyur to/ / de nas de lha'i 'khor gyi tshogs chen po dang bcas te rin po che'i me tog gi sprin gyi char 'bebs shing / bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa grags pa rnam par grags pa'i spyan pad+mo'i dpal gang na bzhugs pa der dong ngo/ / der bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa grags pa rnam par grags pa'i spyan pad+mo'i dpal gyis tshul yangs pa'i sgo kun tu rnam par snang ba zhes bya ba'i mdo/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi mdo'i 'khor dang bcas pa yang dag par bstan to/ / des de dag thos nas dga' ba'i snying po kun nas sgo zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin rab tu thob bo/ / chos thams cad kyi tshul rgya mtsho'i dbyings su yang zhugs par gyur to/ /

“O Children of Buddha, in that great forest Circle of Branches with Jewel Flowers there appeared yet another Buddha, called Universally Renowned Lotus Eye Banner. At this time the life of Light of Great Power came to an end, and he was reborn in the celestial city Jewel Palace of Tranquility, atop the polar mountain, where he became a celestial king called Banner of Undefiled Virtue. He went with the heavenly hosts to see that Buddha, showering clouds of jewel flowers as offerings. Then the Buddha expounded for them the scripture Extensive Skill in Means of Liberation with All-Sided Approaches Universally Illuminating, along with subsidiary scriptures as numerous as atoms in an ocean of worlds. The celestial king and his company, having heard these scriptures, attained a state of contemplation called all-sided treasury of joy, and by the power of this contemplation were able to enter the ocean of the real character of all things. Having attained this benefit, they left the sanctuary and went back to their place.”
End of the first assembly.
shin tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo/ sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba las/ rnam par snang mdzad kyi le'u zhes bya ste; bcu pa'o// //
[11. de bzhin gshegs pa phal po che'i le'u]
bam po bcu gsum pa/

bcom ldan 'das/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa ye shes gang chen mtsho rnam par snang mdzad kyi phyag gi mthil gyi snying po la rab tu gnas pa/ sangs rgyas kyi sku'i dbyibs ltar 'dug pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams ri rab ni/ kun tu bzang po tshangs pa'i lha'i lus kyi dbyibs ltar 'dug pa/ stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams ni/ yongs su 'dzin pa/ gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha'i lus kyi dbyibs ltar 'dug pa/ stong gnyis kyi 'jig rten gyi khams ni/ lhan cig spyod pa/ 'phrul dga'i lha'i lus kyi dbyibs ltar 'dug pa/ stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams kun tu spyod pa/
