snyed kyi 'khor dang ldan pa de bzhin du lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang mi ma yin pa 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i 'khor rnam pa tha dad pa rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi 'khor dang / de ltar 'khor dang / 'khor gyi 'khor gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa yang 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed du shes par bya'o/ / byang chub sems dpa' rgya mtsho de dag nas mi dang mi ma yin pa'i bar rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed po de dag las byang chub sems dpa' re re dang / mi dang mi ma yin pa'i bar re re dag kyang lus rnam pa tha dad pa 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang ldan pa sha stag ste/ lus rnam pa tha dad pa rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed po de dag las lus re re la yang mgo rnam pa tha dad pa rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed yod do/ / mgo rnam pa tha dad pa rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed po de dag las mgo ra re la yang mig gi dbang po rnam pa tha dad pa rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed yod do/ / de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi dbang po rnam pa tha dad pa rgya mtsho'i bar du yang 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed yod de/ mig gi dbang po rnam pa tha dad pa rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed nas yid kyi dbang po rnam pa tha dad pa rgya mtsho'i bar 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed po de dag la dbang po ji snyed cig yod pa de dag re re la yang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed yod do/ / de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa rgya mtsho'i bar du 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed yod do/ / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa rgya mtsho nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnam pa tha dad pa rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed po de dag la rnam par shes pa ji snyed cig yod pa de dag las rnam par shes pa re re la yang ye shes rnam pa tha dad pa rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed yod do/ / ye shes rnam pa tha dad pa rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed po de dag la ye shes ji snyed cig yod pa de dag las ye shes re res kyang 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho mang po'i sangs rgyas tha dad pa rgya mtsho'i ye shes rnam pa tha dad pa rgya mtsho'i tshul du chos kyi 'khor lo rnam pa tha dad pa rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed rab tu bskor bar byed do/ / byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ji lta ba de bzhin du rang sangs rgyas dang / de bzhin du nyan thos dang / de bzhin du lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang mi ma yin pa rnams la yang shes par bya ste/ ye shes la ji lta ba de bzhin du chos thams cad la yang shes par bya'o/ / byang chub sems dpa' de dag dang / mi dang mi ma yin pa'i bar de dag gi gnas kyi yon tan rnam par phye pa rgya mtsho ji snyed cig yod pa dang / stan gyi yon tan rnam par phye ba ji snyed cig yod pa dang / mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po'i yon tan rnam par phye ba ji snyed cig yod pa dang / rgyan gyi yon tan rnam par phye ba rgya mtsho ji snyed cig yod pa dang / gos kyi yon tan rnam par phye ba rgya mtsho ji snyed cig yod pa de dag dang / byang chub sems dpa' nas mi dang mi ma yin pa'i bar de dag gi mig gi rdul shin tu phra ba re re nas lus kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed re re zhing 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du rgyas par 'gengs pa de dag ni/ sangs rgyas rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis bskal pa rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed du bstan cing brjod kyang zad par mi rung ngo; /
bam po bcu bzhi pa/

de nas bcom ldan 'das ye shes gang chen mtsho rnam par snang mdzad kyis sku'i ba spu'i bu ga re re nas kyang 'od zer rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed bkye'o/ / 'od zer rgya mtsho de dag re re las kyang sangs rgyas rgya mtsho pad+mo rgya mtsho la bzhugs pa 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed mngon par byung ste/ sangs rgyas re re'i sku'i ba spu'i sgo re re nas kyang yang dag par skul ba'i tshigs su bcad pa rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed mngon par thon to/ / de dag las yang dag par skul pa'i tshigs su bcad pa rgya mtsho re re zhing shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams ji snyed pa dang / rdul shin tu phra ba ji snyed pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams re re dang / rdul shin tu phra ba re re la'ang byang chub sems dpa' rgya mtsho ji snyad cig yod pa dang / rang sangs rgyas rgya mtsho dang / nyan thos rgya mtsho ji snyed cig yod pa dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod spyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang mi ma yin pa rgya mtsho ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad la yongs su skul ba byed do/ / shar phyogs dang 'dra bar phyogs rgya mtsho thams cad du'ang de bzhin te/
de nas byang chub sems dpa' rgya mtsho de dag dang / mi dang mi ma yin pa rgya mtsho ji snyed pa de dag bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa ye shes gang chen mtsho rnam par snang mdzad kyi 'od zer gyis yang dag par bskul nas rang rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing rgya mtsho dag na sangs rgyas rgya mtsho gang bzhugs pa de dag la zhus te gnang nas byang chub sems dpa' rgya mtsho re re dang / mi dang mi ma yin pa rgya mtsho'i bar de dag re re zhing byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor rgya mtsho nas mi dang mi ma yin pa'i 'khor rgya mtsho'i bar dang ldan par 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcom ldan 'das kyi phyag gi mthil gyi snying po la rab tu gnas pa gang na ba der 'dong bar gyur te/ byang chub sems dpa' rgya mtsho de dag dang / mi dang mi ma yin pa rgya mtsho'i bar de dag la byang chub sems dpa' ji snyed cig yod pa de dang / mi dang mi ma yin pa ji snyed cig yod pa de dag las byang chub sems dpa' re re dang / mi dang mi ma yin pa'i bar de dag re re zhing yang lus rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang ldan pa sha stag ste/ lus re re la yang lag pa rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed yod pa/ lus re re la yang mgo rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed yod pa/ mgo re re la yang kha'i sgo rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed yod pa/ kha'i sgo re re la yang lce rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed yod pa sha stag go /de nas byang chub sems dpa' rgya mtsho de dag dang / mi dang mi ma yin pa'i bar rgya mtsho de dag gis bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes gang chen mtsho rnam par snang mdzad la lus re res kyang g.yas phyogs su bskor ba rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis bskor ba byas te; lag pa re re nas kyang me tog rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis mchod nas de bzhin du mar me dang / spos dang / bdug spos dang byug pa dang / phye ma dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis mchod de; lce re re zhing yang bstod pa rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis mngon par bstod nas rang rang gi stobs dang / rdzu 'phrul gyis sprul pa'i stan rgya mtsho dag la 'khod par gyur to/ / 'khod nas kyang lce re re zhing zhu ba rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed yongs su zhu pa byed do/ / bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa ye shes gang chen mtsho rnam par snang mdzad des zhus pa de dag re re la shin tu bstan pa rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis shin tu bstan pa mdzad de/ byang chub sems dpa' rgya mtsho dang / mi dang mi ma yin pa rgya mtsho'i bar rnam pa de ltar 'dus pa de dag thams cad la chos rgya mtsho mang po rnam grangs du mar rnam par phye'o/ / rnam par bkrol lo/ / gsal par mdzad do/ / yang dag par bstan to/ / de nas shar phyogs su 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho 'jig rten khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed 'das pa na 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho thams cad kyi gnas kyi snying po zhes bya ba yod de/ de na de bzhin gshegs pa sems can thams cad kyi don rgya mtsho rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba bzhugs shing 'tsho gzhes te/ thog mar yang dge /bar du yang dge /tha mar yang dge ba'i chos/ don bzang po/ yi ge bzang po/ dag pa/ yongs su gsal ba/ yongs su byang ba/ tshangs pa'i spyod pa yang dag par ston cing / byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed la rab tu ston pa mdzad de/ de bzhin gshegs pa sems can thams cad kyi don gang chen mtsho rnam par snang mdzad de'i gnas kyi yon tan rnam par phye ba rgya mtsho ji snyed cig mnga' ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan rnam par phye ba rgya mtsho ji snyed cig mnga' ba dang / sku tshe'i yon tan rnam par phye ba rgya mtsho ji snyed cig mnga' ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa'i yon tan rgya mtsho ji snyed cig mnga' ba dang / sku yongs su bstan pa'i yon tan rnam par phye ba rgya mtsho ji snyed cig mnga' ba dang / chos bstan pa'i yon tan rnam par phye ba rgya mtsho ji snyed cig mnga' ba de dag ni/ sangs rgyas rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis dus gsum rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed du gsungs te bstan kyang zad par mi rung ngo/ / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho thams cad kyi gnas kyi snying po zhes bya ba de ni 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po rin chen mang po zhes bya ba 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i bdag po lha dang mi'i dbang po yod de/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho de dag re re zhing yang 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i 'khor dang ldan pa sha stag go/ 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po rin po che mang po de'i 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho re re na yang rin po che rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed yod de/ 'di ltar sangs rgyas kyi spyan rin po che rgya mtsho dang / de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi snyan dang / shangs dang / ljags dang / sku dang / thugs rin po che rgya mtsho dang / sangs rgyas kyi gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rin po che rgya mtsho dang / thams cad kyis blta na yid du 'ong ba'i bud med rin po che rgya mtsho dang / don thams cad sgrub pa'i khyim bdag rin po che rgya mtsho dang / kun tu rnam par phye ba'i blon po rin po che rgya mtsho dang / nam mkha'i mtha' klas pa'i rta rin po che rgya mtsho dang / yid bzhin du 'gro ba'i glang po rin po che rgya mtsho dang / chos kyi dbyings rdo rje'i lte ba can gyi 'khor lo rin po che rgya mtsho dang / kun tu snang bar byed pa'i yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che rgya mtsho dang / nam mkha' rgyan gyis 'gengs pa'i gdugs rin po che rgya mtsho dang / rang bzhin gyis dri ma med pa'i gos rin po che rgya mtsho dang / zla ba'i 'od zer lta bu'i rdul yab rin po che rgya mtsho dang / shes rab kyi lam gyi rin po che rgya mtsho dang / 'jig rten thams cad kyis bltar mi mthong ba'i spyi gtsug bsgribs pa med pa rin po che rgya mtsho dang / thams cad du 'gro ba'i lha ma rin po che rgya mtsho dang / ting nge 'dzin dang mnyam par bzhag pa thams cad kyi mdzod du gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin rin po che rgya mtsho dang / chos gang chen mtsho thams cad kyi klong dang ldan pa'i gzungs rin po che rgya mtsho dang / de ltar de dag la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho re re na yang rin po che rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed yod de/ rin po che rgya mtsho de dag la rin po che ji snyed cig yod pa de dag las rin po che re re zhing yang las 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byed pa sha stag go/ 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po rin chen mang po de la bu rgya mtsho kun kyang mi chen po'i mtshan rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang ldan pa/ 'od chen po'i rgyan rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang ldan pa/ lus dpe byad bzang po rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis rab tu gsal bar brgyan pa/ phas kyi rgol ba'i sde 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed rab tu 'joms pa/ sa bcu rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed la rab tu gnas pa/ dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed rab tu thob pa; snying po byang chub kyi rgyan rnam par phye ba'i ting nge 'dzin rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed yongs su gnon pa la mkhas pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed yod do/ / 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po rin chen mang po de la bu mo rgya mtsho kun kyang byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis sprul pa'i bud med rin po che dang 'dra bar yid kyi lus 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang ldan pa/ srid pa'i lam gyi rgyud kyi 'khor lo sna tshogs rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang ldan pa/ byang chub kyi sems bla na med pa rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi mgo dang ldan pa/ chos kyi dbyings nam mkha' rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi 'phral ba dang ldan pa/ bsam pa dang lhag pa'i bsam pa 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi smin tshugs can/ shes rab dang ye shes yangs pa rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi mig dang ldan pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad las thos pa 'dzin pa 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi rna ba yid du 'ong ba dang ldan pa/ sdom pa chen po yang dag par blangs pa rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi sna legs pa dang ldan pa/ chos rgya mtsho rab tu sgrog pa rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi lce dang ldan pa/ chos kyi dbyings mtha' gnyis yongs su spangs pas 'dzum par dgod pa rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang ldan pa/ byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi lag pa dang ldan pa/ sems can thams cad kyi don yongs su sgrub pas mi ngoms pa rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi snying dang ldan pa/ bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi nu ma legs pa dang ldan pa/ chos zab mo sna tshogs rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi lte ba dang ldan pa/ dmigs pa thams cad yongs su gsal ba'i mthar thug pa rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed rjes su rtogs pa dang ldan pa/ rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin yangs shing mi shigs la brtan pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi sta zur dang ldan pa/ 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad rim gyis legs par 'brel ba rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi rkang pa dang ldan pa/ byang chub kyi yan lag gi me tog sna tshogs kyi dra ba dang / phreng ba rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed mdzes par thogs pa/ sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rnam par thar pa'i gos rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed shin tu bzang par gyon pa/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi rgyan rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis legs par brgyan pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul khrims dri zhim pa rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi spos kyis lus shin tu byugs pa/ dga' ba'i rgyan dang / thabs mkhas pa rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mchog thob pa 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed yod de/ de dag gi kha nas ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i chos rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed 'byung ngo/ / de dag gi lus kyi ba spu'i bu ga thams cad nas kyang snying rje'i rjes su 'brang ba'i tsan+dan gyi spos rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed 'byung ngo/ / spos rgya mtsho de dag gi dri zhim pos kyang 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho mang po yongs su rgyas par 'gengs te/ de dag gi dga' ba'i rgyan dang thabs mkhas pa rgya mtshos 'dul ba'i sems can rgya mtsho gang ji snyed cig yod pas dri zhim po rgya mtsho de dag tshor bar gyur pa de dag thams cad kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul khrims dri zhim po rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed rab tu 'thob bo/ / sems can gang dga' ba'i rgyan dang / thabs mkhas pa rgya mtshos 'dul ba de dag gis gzugs kyi yon tan rnam par phye ba rgya mtsho de dag mthong ba de thams cad kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i shes rab dang / ye shes kyi sku rnam par dag pa yongs su ston pa rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi nas bcom ldan 'das de'i zhabs gnyis la mgo rgya mtsho'i spyi bos btud de phyag 'tshal nas chos kyi dbyings rab tu sgrog pa'i lce'i dbang po rgya mtshos zhu ba yongs su zhus pa/ bcom ldan 'das de ltar bdag cag kyang 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyag gi mthil gyi snying po la rab tu gnas pa der de bzhin gshegs pa ye shes gang chen mtsho rnam par snang mdzad de'i zhal blta ba mtsho bsnyen bkur ba ni/ don du mi gnyer/ sangs rgyas kyi byang chub rgya mtsho mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba ni/ tshol bar mi byed/ rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub rgya mtsho mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba ni/ don du mi gnyer/ nyan thos kyi byang chub rgya mtsho mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba ni/ don du mi gnyer/ yul rgya mtsho 'di nas ni/ 'gro bar 'dod pa med/ yul rgya mtsho gzhan du ni/ 'gro bar 'dod pa med la/ gal te khyed sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang / chos kyi dbyings la gnas par gyur te/ 'dod chags dang bcas pa'am/ 'dod chags dang bral ba la yang mi gnas/ sems can thams cad gsod phod kyang zhe sdang ngam/ byams pa la mi gnas/ mu stegs can thams cad kyi lta ba rgya mtsho la 'jug cing spyod kyang log pa'i ye shes sam/ yang dag pa'i ye shes la mi gnas/ chos thams cad kyi tshig rab tu dbye ba bstan pa yang ston la/ chos kyi dbyings las kyang mi g.yo zhe na/ deng la rag go/ 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po rin chen mang po des bstan pa 'di shin tu bstan pa'i tshe chung ma'i 'khor rgya mtsho de dag dang / bu mo rgya mtsho de dag las chung ma re re dang / bu mo re res kyang mig gi khams re res chos kyi dbyings thams cad la dbang bsgyur ba'i sangs rgyas kyi sa rgya mtsho la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi sa rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed rab tu thob par gyur to/ / rna ba'i khams re res kyang nam mkha' khong du chud pa'i sa rgya mtsho la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed rab tu thob par gyur to/ / sna'i khams re res kyang gcig la brten pa'i sa rgya mtsho la sogs pa rang sangs rgyas kyi sa 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed rab tu thob par gyur to/ / lce'i khams re res kyang sgra'i rjes su 'gro ba'i sa rgya mtsho la sogs pa nyan thos kyi sa 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed rab tu thob bo/ / lus kyi khams re res kyang pha rol tu phyin pa dri ma med pa rgya mtsho la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed rab tu thob bo/ / yid kyi khams re res kyang sa'i dbang po'i stobs rgya mtsho la sogs pa stobs rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed rab tu thob bo/ / de nas rgyal po rin chen mang po'i chung ma rgya mtsho de dag dang / bu mo rgya mtsho de dag gis theg pa chen po'i tshul rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi gting rnyed nas spyod pa rgya mtsho 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed la gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog par byas te/ rgyal po rin chen mang po la tshigs su bcad de smras pa/
bdag cag kun gyis sangs rgyas rgya mtsho mthong / / yongs su mchod de bsnyen bkur zhu ba bgyis/ / 'on kyang 'di 'dra rgya mtsho'i chos ma thos; ; sa mang rgya mtsho 'di dag thob ma gyur/ /
da ni sangs rgyas 'phrin las sgrub pa yi/ / sa mang rgya mtsho'i mig kyang thob par gyur/ / byang chub don du phyogs rnams kun dbyings su/ / rna bas spyod pa dam pa spyad par bgyi/ /
sna yi khams kyis rang rgyal sa thob ste/ / rten 'brel 'byung ba'i chos rnams rtogs par gyur/ / lces kyang nyan thos sa mang rgya mtsho thob/ / des ni zhi ba'i bde ba tshor bar gyur/ /
lus kyis sa mang rgya mtsho thob pas na/ / sgrub pa sna tshogs rab tu bsgrub par bgyi/ / yid kyis dus gsum chos mang rgya mtsho rnams/ / 'tshal bar gyur pas gzhan la bstan par bgyi/ /
shin tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo/ sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba las/ de bzhin gshegs pa phal po che'i le'u ste/ bcu gcig go / //
[12. sangs rgyas kyi mtshan shin tu bstan pa'i le'u]
BOOK SEVEN. Names of the Buddha

bcom ldan 'das thog ma mngon par sangs rgyas pa ma ga d+ha'i chos kyi dgon pa'i snying po byang chub na bzhugs te/ blo shin tu rnam par dag pa mi gnyis pas yang dag par spyod pa/ chos mtshan nyid med pa la shin tu gzhol ba/ sangs rgyas kyi rnam par spyod pas sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid brnyes pa/ bsgribs pa med pas rtogs par thugs su chud pa/ phyir mi ldog pa'i chos can spyod yul 'phrog pa med pa; rnam par dgod pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dus gsum mnyam pa nyid la shin tu byung ba/ pho brang kun tu 'od na seng+ge'i khri pad+mo'i snying po can la bzhugs te/

AT THAT TIME the World Honored One had just attained true awakening in a forest sanctuary in the country of Magadha. Sitting on a lotus bank lion throne in the hall of universal light, he fulfilled ineffable enlightenment, forever cutting off mundane ideas of transmigration and extinction; arriving at truth without form, he dwelt in the abode of buddhahood, attained the equanimity of the enlightened, reached the state of immutability, in the realm where there are no barriers; unhindered in action, he established the inconceivable, perceiving all in the past, present, and future.

byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kun kyang skye ba gcig gis thogs pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan nas 'dus pa/ sems can gyi khams la dpyod pa/ chos kyi dbyings la dpyod pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams la dpyod pa/ mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings la dpyod pa/ las kyi rnam par smin pa la dpyod pa/ bsam pa'i rgyud la dpyod pa/ don dang yi ge la dpyod pa/ 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa la dpyod pa/ 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa la dpyod pa/ 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba la dpyod pa sha stag dang thabs cig go /

He was together with as many enlightening beings as atoms in ten buddha-fields, all of whom were qualified to attain buddhahood in their next lifetime. They had all gathered here from different regions. They skillfully observed the realms of sentient beings, the realm of the elemental cosmos, the realm of extinction, the consequences of all actions, the processes of mental behavior, the meanings of all statements, the mundane and the transmundane, the compounded and the uncompounded, the past, the present, and the future.

de nas byang chub sems dpa' de dag 'di snyam du sems te/ bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag cag la thugs brtse bar dgongs te byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su bstan kyang rung / sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa yongs su bstan kyang rung / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan yongs su bstan kyang rung / sangs rgyas kyi chos nyid yongs su bstan kyang rung / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa bstan kyang rung / sangs rgyas kyi chos bshad pa yongs su bstan kyang rung / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rang bzhin yongs su bstan kyang rung / sangs rgyas kyi mthu yongs su bstan kyang rung / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan yongs su bstan kyang rung / sangs rgyas kyi byang chub yongs su bstan kyang rung / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams su sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par bkod pa bcu ji ltar rnam par bkod pa de dag yongs su bstan kyang rung / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa bcu yongs su bstan kyang rung / byang chub sems dpa'i tshad med pa bcu yongs su bstan kyang rung / byang chub sems dpa'i gter rnams yongs su bstan kyang rung / byang chub sems dpa'i sa rnams yongs su bstan kyang rung / byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam rnams yongs su bstan kyang rung / byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin bcu rnams yongs su bstan kyang rung / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par 'phrul pa bcu yongs su bstan kyang rung / byang chub sems dpa'i mgo bcu yongs su bstan kyang rung / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad yang dag par 'byung ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdung mi gcad pa dang / sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad nye bar nyon mongs pa med par bya ba dang / 'du byed thams cad yongs su shes par bya ba dang / chos thams cad yang dag par bstan par bya ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad rnam par dag par bya ba dang / the tshom thams cad yongs su gcad pa dang / nem nur thams cad shin tu gsal ba dang / gnas thams cad rab tu gzhom par bya ba'i phyir gong du de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa bstan kyang rung / gong du de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul bstan kyang rung / gong du de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs bstan kyang rung / gong du de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul bstan kyang rung / gong du de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bstan kyang rung / gong du de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi bsnyengs pa bstan kyang rung / gong du de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin bstan kyang rung / gong du de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdzu 'phrul bstan kyang rung / gong du de bzhin gshegs pa'i mnga' chen po bstan kyang rung / gong du de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'phrog pa bstan kyang rung / gong du de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan bstan kyang rung / gong du de bzhin gshegs pa'i snyan bstan kyang rung / gong du de bzhin gshegs pa'i shangs bstan kyang rung / gong du de bzhin gshegs pa'i ljags bstan kyang rung / gong du de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku bstan kyang rung / gong du de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs bstan kyang rung / gong du de bzhin gshegs pa'i spobs pa bstan kyang rung / gong du de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes bstan kyang rung / gong du de bzhin gshegs pa'i khyu mchog gi mthu bstan kyang rung snyam pa dang /

At that time the enlightening beings formulated these thoughts: “If the World Honored One looks upon us with compassion, may he, in accord with our inclinations, reveal to us the buddha-fields, the Buddhas’ abodes, the adornments of the buddha-fields, the nature of buddhahood, the purity of buddha-lands, the teachings expounded by the Buddhas, the substances and natures of the buddha-lands, the powers and qualities of the Buddhas, the formation of the buddha-fields, the great enlightenment of the Buddhas. Just as the Buddhas of all worlds in the ten directions, in order to develop all enlightening beings, to cause the family of the enlightened ones to continue uninterrupted, to rescue all sentient beings, to cause all living beings to be forever free from all afflictions, to comprehend all actions, to expound all truths, to clear away all defilements, and to forever cut through all webs of doubt, explain the enlightening beings’ ten abodes, ten practices, ten dedications, ten treasuries, ten stages, ten vows, ten concentrations, ten powers, and ten peaks, and explain the sphere of buddhahood, the mystic forces of Buddhas, the actions of Buddhas, the powers of Buddhas, the fearlessness of Buddhas, the meditations of Buddhas, the psychic abilities of Buddhas, the freedom of Buddhas, the nonobstruction of Buddhas, the sense faculties of Buddhas, the powers of analysis and articulation of Buddhas, the knowledge and wisdom of Buddhas, and the transcendence of Buddhas, so also may the Buddha, the World Honored One, explain this for us.”

de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi sems kyi yongs su rnam par rtog pa thugs kyis thugs su chud nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba mngon par 'du mdzad do/ / rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam pa de dag mngon par 'du mdzad pas shar phyogs logs su 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed 'das pa'i pha rol gyi 'jig rten gyi khams gser gyi mdog ces bya ba/ de bzhin gshegs pa rig byed mi g.yo pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang lhan cig tu bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der dong ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal te/ shar phyogs su brten nas seng+ge'i khri pad+mo'i snying po can dag mngon par sprul te skyel mo krung bcas nas 'khod do/ /

Then the Buddha, knowing what the enlightening beings were thinking, manifested mystic powers to them, according to their particular types. When he had done that, there came, from a world called Golden, whose Buddha was called Immutable Knowledge, which was to the East, past as many worlds as atoms in ten buddha-fields an enlightening being of that world, named Manjushri, along with as many enlightening beings as atoms in ten buddha-lands. When they arrived, they bowed, and then produced lotus bank lion seats to the east and sat crosslegged on them.

lho phyogs logs su 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed 'das pa'i pha rol gyi 'jig rten gyi khams kha dog yid du 'ong ba zhes bya ba/ de bzhin gshegs pa rig byed mi bskyod pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas dpal byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang lhan cig tu bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der dong ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal te/ lho phyogs su brten nas seng+ge'i khri pad+mo'i snying po can dag mngon par sprul te skyil mo krung bcas nas 'khod do/ /

In the South, past as many worlds as atoms in ten buddha-lands, was a world called Sublime Color, with a Buddha called Unhindered Knowledge. There was an enlightening being there named Chief of the Awakened, who, together with as many enlightening beings as atoms in ten buddha-lands, came to the Buddha, bowed, and the to the south produced lotus bank lion seats and sat crosslegged on them.

nub phyogs logs su 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed 'das pa'i pha rol gyi 'jig rten gyi khams pad+mo'i mdog ces bya ba/ de bzhin gshegs pa rig byed bcings med kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas byang chub sems dpa' nor dpal byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang lhan cig tu bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der dong ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal te/ nub phyogs su brten nas seng+ge'i khri pad+mo'i snying po can dag mngon par sprul te skyil mo krung bcas nas 'khod do/ /

In the West, past as many worlds as atoms in ten buddha-lands, was a world called Lotus Blossom Color, with a Buddha called Darkness-Destroying Knowledge. There was an enlightening being there, named Chief in Riches of Truth, who, along with as many enlightening beings as atoms in ten buddha-lands, came to the Buddha, bowed, produced lotus bank lion seats to the west and sat crosslegged on them.

byang phyogs logs su 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed 'das pa'i pha rol gyi 'jig rten gyi khams tsam pa ka'i mdog ces bya ba/ de bzhin gshegs pa rig byed kun spyod kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas byang chub sems dpa' rin chen dpal byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang lhan cig tu bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der dong ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal te/ byang phyogs su brten nas seng+ge'i khri pad+mo'i snying po can dag mngon par sprul te skyil mo krung bcas nas 'khod do/ /

In the North, past as many worlds as atoms in ten buddha-lands, was a world called Golden Flower Color, with a Buddha called Knowledge of Dignified Conduct. There was an enlightening being there, named Chief of the Precious, who, with as many enlightening beings as atoms in ten buddha-lands, came to the Buddha, bowed, produced lotus bank lion seats to the north and sat crosslegged on them.

byang shar gyi phyogs mtshams su 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed 'das pa'i pha rol gyi 'jig rten gyi khams ut+pa la'i mdog ces bya ba/ de bzhin gshegs pa rig byed nyi ma'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas byang chub sems dpa' yon tan dpal byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang lhan cig tu bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der dong ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal te/ byang shar gyi phyogs mtshams su brten nas seng+ge'i khri pad+mo'i snying po can dag mngon par sprul te skyil mo krung bcas nas 'khod do/ /

In the northeast, past as many worlds as atoms in ten buddha-lands, was a world called Blue Lotus Color, with a Buddha called Knowledge of Characteristics. There was an enlightening being there, called Chief of the Virtuous, who, with as many enlightening beings as atoms in ten buddha-lands, came to the Buddha, bowed, produced lotus bank lion seats to the northeast and sat crosslegged on them.

shar lho'i phyogs mtshams su 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed 'das pa'i pha rol gyi 'jig rten gyi khams gser gyi mdog ces bya ba/ de bzhin gshegs pa rig byed mtha' rgal gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas byang chub sems dpa' mig gi dpal byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang lhan cig tu bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der dong ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal te/ shar lho'i phyogs mtshams su brten nas seng+ge'i khri pad+mo'i snying po can dag mngon par sprul te/ skyil mo krung bcas nas 'khod do/ /

In the southeast, past as many worlds as atoms in ten buddha-lands, was a world called Gold Color, with a Buddha called Ultimate Knowledge. There was an enlightening being there called Chief in Vision, who, with as many enlightening beings as atoms in ten buddha-lands, came to the Buddha, bowed, produced lotus bank lion seats to the southeast and sat crosslegged on them.

lho nub kyi phyogs mtshams logs su 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed 'das pa'i pha rol gyi 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che'i mdog ces bya ba/ de bzhin gshegs pa rig byed dam pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas byang chub sems dpa' brtson 'grus dpal byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang lhan cig tu bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der dong ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal te/ lho nub kyi phyogs mtshams su brten nas seng+ge'i khri pad+mo'i snying po can dag mngon par sprul te skyil mo krung bcas nas 'khod do/ /

In the southwest, past as many worlds as atoms in ten buddha-lands, was a world called Jewel Color, with a Buddha called Supreme Knowledge. There was an enlightening being there called Chief in Effort, who, with as many enlightening beings as atoms in ten buddha-lands, came to the Buddha, bowed, produced lotus bank lion seats to the southwest and sat crosslegged on them.

nub byang gi phyogs mtshams su 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed 'das pa'i pha rol gyi 'jig rten gyi khams rdo rje'i mdog ces bya ba/ de bzhin gshegs pa rig byed dbang phyug gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi dpal zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang lhan cig tu bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal te/ nub byang gi phyogs mtshams su brten nas seng+ge'i khri pad+mo'i snying po can dag mngon par sprul te skyil mo krung bcas nas 'khod do/ /

In the northwest, past as many worlds as atoms in ten buddha-lands, was a world called Diamond Color, with a Buddha called Independent Knowledge. There was an enlightening being there called Chief in Doctrine, who, with as many enlightening beings as atoms in ten buddha-lands, came to the Buddha, bowed, produced lotus bank lion seats to the northwest and sat crosslegged on them.

'og gi phyogs logs su 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed 'das pa'i pha rol gyi 'jig rten gyi khams shel gyi mdog ces bya ba/ de bzhin gshegs pa rig byed tshangs pa'i dbang po'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas byang chub sems dpa' ye shes dpal byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang lhan cig tu bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der dong ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal te/ 'og gi phyogs su brten nas seng+ge'i khri pad+mo'i snying po can dag mngon par sprul te skyil mo krung bcas nas 'khod do; ;

In the nadir, past as many worlds as atoms in ten buddha-lands, was a world called Crystal Color, with a Buddha called Pure Knowledge. There was an enlightening being there called Chief in Knowledge, who, with as many enlightening beings as atoms in ten buddha-lands, came to the Buddha, bowed, produced lotus bank lion seats in the nadir and sat crosslegged on them.

steng gi phyogs logs su 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed 'das pa'i pha rol gyi 'jig rten gyi khams 'dra ba'i mdog ces bya ba; de bzhin gshegs pa rig byed sna tshogs kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas byang chub sems dpa' bzang po'i dpal byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang lhan cig tu bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der dong ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal te/ steng gi phyogs su brten nas seng+ge'i khri pad+mo'i snying po can dag mngon par sprul te skyil mo krung bcas nas 'khod do/ /

In the zenith, past as many worlds as atoms in ten buddha-lands, was a world called Equal Color, with a Buddha called Observing Knowledge. There was an enlightening being there called Chief in Goodness, who, with as many enlightening beings as atoms in ten buddha-lands, came to the Buddha, bowed, produced lotus bank lion seats in the zenith and sat crosslegged on them.

de nas byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal gyis sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun thams cad la bltas te 'di skad ces smras so/ / byang chub sems dpa' 'dus pa 'di dag ni/ ngo mtshar thob pa sha stag ste/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing ni/ bsam gyis mi khyab bo/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi rnam par spyod pa ni/ bsam gyis mi khyab bo/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan ni/ bsam gyis mi khyab bo/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos nyid ni/ bsam gyis mi khyab bo/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa ni/ bsam gyis mi khyab bo/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos bstan pa ni/ bsam gyis mi khyab bo/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi 'byung ba ni/ bsam gyis mi khyab bo/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing kun tu rgyu ba ni/ bsam gyis mi khyab bo/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni/ bsam gyis mi khyab ste/ de ci'i phyir zhe na/ 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dag tu sems can 'dul ba rnams kyi bsam pa thugs su chud cing / nam mkha'i dbyings kyi mthas gtugs pa chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa dag tu chos ston te/

Then the great enlightening being Manjushri, empowered by the Buddha, looked over all the congregations of enlightening beings, and spoke these words: “These enlightening beings are most rare. O Children of Buddhas! The Buddhas’ lands are inconceivable. The Buddhas’ abodes, the adornments of their fields, the nature of buddhahood, the purity of buddha-lands, the teachings of the Buddhas, the manifestation of the Buddhas, the formation of the buddha-lands, and the complete perfect enlightenment of the Buddhas are all inconceivable. Why? Because all the Buddhas in the worlds in the ten directions know that the inclinations of sentient beings are not the same, and so they teach and train them according to their needs and capacities. The extent of this activity is equal to the realm of space of the cosmos.

de ci'i phyir zhe na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'di nyid dang / de ma yin pa'i gling bzhi pa gzhan dag na'ang sku gzhan dang gzhan/ mtshan gzhan dang gzhan/ kha dog dang dbyibs gzhan dang gzhan/ chu zheng gzhan dang gzhan; sku tshe'i tshad gzhan dang gzhan/ skye mched brnyes pa gzhan dang gzhan/ dbang po brnyes pa gzhan dang gzhan/ 'byung ba'i skye mched gzhan dang gzhan/ sku gzugs gzhan dang gzhan du de bzhin gshegs pa sems can rnams kyis rab tu shes so/ / de ci'i phyir zhe na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ 'jig rten gyi khams gling bzhi pa bcom pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'di nyid na'ang de bzhin gshegs pa la don thams cad grub pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / zla ba'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / seng+ge'i nga ro can zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / shAkya thub pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / drang srong dam pa'i mchog ces bya bar rab tu shes so/ / rnam par snang mdzad ces bya bar rab tu shes so/ / go'u ta ma'i rigs zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / dge sbyong chen po zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / rgyal ba dam pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / mu stegs byed ces bya bar rab tu shes te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ de dag la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi khams gling bzhi pa bcom pa dang ldan pa na mtshan stong phrag bcur de bzhin gshegs pa sems can rnams kyis rab tu shes so/ /

“Children of Buddhas, in the four quarters of this world Endurance, the Buddha, with various bodies, names, forms, sizes, life spans, situations, faculties, birth places, languages, and observations causes all living beings to individually perceive and know differently. In these four quarters, the Buddha is sometimes called Fulfiller of All Aims, sometimes called The Full Moon, sometimes called The Lion Roarer, sometimes called Shakyamuni, sometimes called The Seventh Sage, sometimes called Vairocana, sometimes called Gautama, sometimes called The Great Mendicant, sometimes called The Supreme, sometimes called The Guide; there are ten thousand such names, individually letting beings know and see in various ways.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ gling bzhi pa 'di dang 'dabs chags su shar phyogs logs na gling bzhi pa shin tu bsrungs pa zhes bya ba yod de/ de na de bzhin gshegs pa la rdo rje zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / dbang phyug ces bya bar rab tu shes so/ / blo gros mnga' ba zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / thub par dka' ba zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / sprin gyi rgyal po zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / nyon mongs pa med pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / skyabs mdzad pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / thugs dgyes pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / mtshungs pa med pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / tshig gcod pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ de dag la sogs pa gling bzhi pa shin tu bsrungs pa zhes bya ba na de bzhin gshegs pa la mtshan stong phrag bcur sems can rnams kyis rab tu shes so; ;

“East of this region is a world called Good Protection: there the Buddha may be called Adamantine, or Free, or Possessor of Knowledge and Wisdom, or Invincible, or King of Sages, or Noncontention, or Capable Leader, or Joyful Heart, or Incomparable, or Beyond Philosophy; there are ten thousand such names, individually letting sentient beings know and see in various ways.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ gling bzhi pa 'di dang 'dabs chags su lho phyogs logs na gling bzhi pa bzod par dka' ba zhes bya ba yod de/ de na de bzhin gshegs pa la dbang po zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / nor grags zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / dri ma med pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / yang dag par gsung ba zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / 'dul ba zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / dgyes pa mnga' ba zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / rnam par grags pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / don mdzad pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so; ; mtha' yas pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / dpal dang ldan pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ de dag la sogs pa gling bzhi pa bzod par dka' ba na mtshan stong phrag bcur de bzhin gshegs pa sems can rnams kyis rab tu shes so/ /

“South of this region is a world called Difficult to Endure: there the Buddha may be called King of the Gods, or Precious Name, or Undefiled, or Truth Teller, or Tamer, or Joyful, or Great Renown, or Giver of Aid, or Infinite, or Supreme; there are ten thousand such names, individually letting people know and see in various ways.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ gling bzhi pa 'di dang 'dabs chags su nub phyogs logs na gling bzhi pa gnyen dang ldan pa zhes bya ba yod de/ de na de bzhin gshegs pa la chu'i lha zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / blta na dga' ba zhes bya bar rab tu shes so; ; rgyal po dam pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / seng+ge 'dul ba zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / bden pa'i blo gros zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / mtha' las 'das par gshegs pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / dgyes pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / chos kyi blo gros zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / 'phrin las grub pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / mkhas pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ de dag la sogs pa gling bzhi pa gnyen dang ldan pa zhes bya ba de na mtshan stong phrag bcur de bzhin gshegs pa sems can rnams kyis rab tu shes so/ /

“West of this region is a world called Personal Wisdom: there the Buddha may be called God of Waters, or Gladdening Sight, or Supreme Monarch, or Celestial Tamer, or Real True Wisdom, or Arrived at the Ultimate, or Joyous, or Objective Knowledge, or Done with All Tasks, or Abiding in Goodness; there are ten thousand such names, letting beings know and see in various ways.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /gling bzhi pa 'di dang 'dabs chags su byang phyogs logs na gling bzhi pa seng+ge yod pa zhes bya ba yod de/ de na de bzhin gshegs pa la thub pa chen po zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / dka' thub kyis bsgrubs pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / zhing la dpa' ba zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / thams cad thugs su chud pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / yid bzang po zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / yongs su dag pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / shugs 'dzin zhes bya bar rab tu shes so; ; lda ldi bzang po zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / brtul zhugs brnyes pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ de dag la sogs pa gling bzhi pa seng+ge yod pa na mtshan stong phrag bcur de bzhin gshegs pa sems can rnams kyis rab tu shes so/ /

“North of this region is a world called Lion of Existence: there the Buddha may be called Great Sage, or Ascetic, or World Honored One, or Supreme Field, or Omniscient, or Good Mind, or Pure, or Master of Universal Sound, or Supreme Giver, or Attained by Difficult Practice; there are ten thousand such names, individually letting beings know and see in various ways.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ gling bzhi pa 'di dang 'dabs chags su byang shar gyi phyogs mtshams na gling bzhi pa rnam par brtsegs pa zhes bya ba yod de/ de na de bzhin gshegs pa la bdud rnam par 'joms pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / yang dag par 'byung ba zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / zhi ba zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / bzang po lha zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / 'dod chags dang bral pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / blo gros mchog ces bya bar rab tu shes so/ / thugs mnyam pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / gzhan gyis mi thub pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so; ; blo gros kyi dbyangs zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / ring du bzhud pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /de dag la sogs pa gling bzhi pa rnam par brtsegs pa zhes bya ba na mtshan stong phrag bcur de bzhin gshegs pa sems can rnams kyis rab tu shes so/ /

“Northeast of this region is a world called Subtle Observation: there the Buddha may be called Demon Queller, or Completed, or Dispassionate, or Celestial Virtue, or Free from Greed, or Supreme Wisdom, or Equanimity of Mind, or Unconquerable, or Sound of Wisdom, or Rarely Appearing; there are ten thousand such names, letting beings know and see in various ways.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /gling bzhi pa 'di dang 'dabs chags su shar lho'i phyogs mtshams na gling bzhi pa dga' ba zhes bya ba yod de/ de na de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jigs pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / me'i phung po zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / thugs su chud pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / khyab pa dang ldan pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / mi ldan pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / rang bzhin 'dzin pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / rigs par spyod pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / mig gi rgyal po zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / shin tu 'phags pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / stobs kyi brtson 'grus zhes bya bar rab tu shes te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ de dag la sogs pa gling bzhi pa dga' ba na mtshan stong phrag bcur de bzhin gshegs pa sems can rnams kyis rab tu shes so/ /

“Southeast of this region is a world called Joy and Happiness: there the Buddha may be called Ultimate Dignity, or Mass of Light Flames, or Universal Knower, or Secret Mystery, or Liberation, or Inherently Secure, or Acting According to Truth, or King of Pure Eyes, or Great Courage, or Energetic Power; there are ten thousand such names, causing beings to individually know and see in various ways.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ gling bzhi pa 'di dang 'dabs chags su lho nub kyi phyogs mtshams na gling bzhi pa snying po dam pa zhes bya ba yod de/ de na de bzhin gshegs pa la mi g.yo ba zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / mkhas pa'i rgyal po zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / yongs su rgyas pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / mi bskyod pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / mdzes pa'i spyan can zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / rgyal po'i mchog ces bya bar rab tu shes so/ / dbyangs kyi dbang phyug ces bya bar rab tu shes so/ / thams cad gtong ba zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / drang srong 'dzin pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / ri rab dpal zhes bya bar rab tu shes te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ gling bzhi pa snying po dam pa na mtshan stong phrag bcur de bzhin gshegs pa sems can rnams kyis rab tu shes so/ /

“Southwest of this region is a world called Extremely Solid and Firm: there the Buddha may be called Peaceful Abiding, or King of Knowledge, or Complete, or Immutable, or Subtle Eye, or Supreme Monarch, or Sound of Freedom, or Giver of All, or Sages of the Masses, or Supreme Mountain; there are ten thousand such names, letting beings know and see in various ways.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ gling bzhi pa 'di dang 'dabs chags su nub byang gi phyogs mtshams na gling bzhi pa sa bzang po zhes bya ba yod de/ de na de bzhin gshegs pa la yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / 'od 'phro ba dang ldan pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / rin po che'i gtsug phud ces bya bar rab tu shes so/ / dran par bya ba zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / don gyi mchog ces bya bar rab tu shes so/ / shin tu bzhad pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / rigs gtsang ma zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / 'od kyi dkyil 'khor ces bya bar rab tu shes so/ / phyag shin tu 'phyang ba zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / thog mar rab tu gnas pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ de dag la sogs pa gling bzhi pa sa bzang po na mtshan stong phrag bcur de bzhin gshegs pa sems can rnams kyis rab tu shes so/ /

“Northwest of this region is a world called Wonderful Ground; there the Buddha may be called Universal, or Flames of Light, or Jewel Topknot, or Worthy of Remembrance, or Unexcelled Meaning, or Always Joyful, or Inherently Pure, or Sphere of Light, or Long Arms, or Abiding in the Fundamental; there are ten thousand such names, letting beings know and see in various ways.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ gling bzhi pa 'di dang 'dabs chags su 'og logs na gling bzhi pa 'od 'phro ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba yod de/ de na de bzhin gshegs pa la shin tu grub pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / seng+ge'i kha dog ces bya bar rab tu shes so/ / rno ba zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / gser gyi 'od 'phro ba zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / thams cad kyi bshes gnyen zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / gsung mthar thug pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / phan pa mdzad pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / mthar thug pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / lha ma nor ba zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / sbyin pa snyoms pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ de dag la sogs pa gling bzhi pa 'od 'phro ba dang ldan pa na mtshan stong phrag bcur de bzhin gshegs pa sems can rnams kyis rab tu shes so/ /

“Below this region is a world called Radiant Wisdom: the Buddha there may be called Collecting Roots of Goodness, or Lionlike, or Razorlike Intellect, or Golden Flames, or All-Knower, or Ultimate Sound, or Benefactor, or Arrived at the Ultimate, or God of Truth, or Universal Conqueror; there are ten thousand such names, letting beings know and see in various ways.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ gling bzhi pa 'di dang 'dabs chags su steng logs na gling bzhi pa nor 'dzin ces bya ba yod de/ de na de bzhin gshegs pa la blo gros dang ldan pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / zhal dag pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / bshes gnyen dang ldan pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / thog mar gshegs pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / byin rnam par bkod pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / dga' bar mdzad pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / dgongs pa grub pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / me zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / tshul khrims dang ldan pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / gcig la brten pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes te; kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de dag la sogs pa gling bzhi pa nor 'dzin na mtshan stong phrag bcur de bzhin gshegs pa sems can rnams kyis rab tu shes so/ /

“Above this region is a world called Holding the Ground: there the Buddha may be called Possessor of Knowledge and Wisdom, or Pure Face, or Conscious Wisdom, or Leader, or Adorned by Conduct, or Gladdener, or Wish Fulfilled, or Blazelike, or Ethical, or The One Path; there are ten thousand such names, letting beings know and see in various ways.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ de ltar de dag la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'di na gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams bye ba phrag brgya yod de/ de dag kun na yang de bzhin gshegs pa la mtshan gzhan dang gzhan gyis brjod de/ mtshan bye ba brgya stong phrag bcur de bzhin gshegs pa sems can rnams kyis rab tu shes so; ;
“In this world Endurance there are a hundred billion regions, wherein the Buddha has a million billion various names, letting all sentient beings know and see in various ways.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'di dang 'dabs chags su shar phyogs logs na 'jig rten gyi khams khebs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba yod de/ de na de bzhin gshegs pa la mnyam pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / 'phags pa lhag pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / dbugs phyin pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / bsam pa grol ba zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / nyan pa'i bdag po zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / khyab par bzhugs pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / dbang du gyur pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / sA la'i lhun zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / rtsal chen po zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / blo 'dra ba med pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ de dag la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi khams khebs pa dang ldan pa na mtshan bye ba brgya stong phrag bcur de bzhin gshegs pa sems can rnams kyi rab tu shes so/ /

“East of this world Endurance is another world, called Secret Teaching: there the Buddha may be called Impartial, or Excellent, or Soother, or Enlightening Mind, or Speaker of Truth, or Attainer of Freedom, or Supreme Body, or Great Courage, or Peerless Knowledge; there are a million billion such diverse names, letting beings know and see in various ways.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'di dang 'dabs chags su lho phyogs logs na 'jig rten gyi khams lhag pa zhes bya ba yod de/ de na de bzhin gshegs pa la rang bzhin thugs su chud ces bya bar rab tu shes so/ / bsam pa grol ba zhes bya bar rab tu shes te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ de dag la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi khams lhag pa na mtshan bye ba brgya stong phrag bcur de bzhin gshegs pa sems can rnams kyis rab tu shes so/ /

“South of this world Endurance is another world, called Abundance: there the Buddha may be called Original Nature, or Diligent Intellect, or Unexcelled Honored One, or Great Torch of Knowledge, or Nonreliant, or Treasury of Light, or Treasury of Wisdom, or Treasury of Virtue, or God of Gods, or Great Independent One; there are a million billion such names, letting beings know and see in various ways.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'di dang 'dabs chags su nub phyogs logs na 'jig rten gyi khams rdul bsal ba zhes bya ba yod de/ de na de bzhin gshegs pa la dgongs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / lam rnam par bsgoms pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / brtan pa'i gzhi zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / khyab cing grol ba zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / don mkhyen pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / bye brag la dgyes pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / gzigs pa dam pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / 'dul ba thugs su chud pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / kun tu snyoms pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / dgyes pa dang ldan pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /de dag la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi khams rdul bsal ba na mtshan bye ba brgya stong phrag bcur de bzhin gshegs pa sems can rnams kyis rab tu shes so/ /

“West of this world Endurance is a world called Undefiled: there the Buddha may be called Wish Fulfilled, or Knower of the Way, or Resting in the Fundamental, or Able to Untie Bonds, or Comprehending Truth, or Easily Discerning, or Supreme Insight, or Pacifying Action, or Ascetic Practicer, or Replete with Power; there are a million billion such various names, letting beings know and see in varous ways.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'di dang 'dabs chags su byang phyogs logs na 'jig rten gyi khams rnam par byung ba zhes bya ba yod de/ de na de bzhin gshegs pa la tsam pa ka'i kha dog ces bya bar rab tu shes so; ; nyi ma'i snying po zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / mthu shin tu gnas pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / byin gyi rlabs yang dag par 'byung ba zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / rang bzhin dam pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / blo gros kyi nyi ma zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / thogs pa med pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / zla ba shar ba zhes bya bar rab tu shes so; ; rlung gi shugs zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / sgra shin tu gsal ba zhes bya bar rab tu shes te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ de dag la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi khams rnam par byung ba na mtshan bye ba brgya stong phrag bcur de bzhin gshegs pa sems can rnams kyis rab tu shes so/ /

“North of this world Endurance is a world called Inclusion: there the Buddha may be called Forever Free from Suffering, or Universal Liberation, or Great Hidden Treasury, or Knowledge of Liberation, or Storehouse of the Past, or Jewel Light, or Detached from the World, or State of Nonobstruction, or Treasury of Pure Faith, or Imperturbable Mind; there are a million billion such names, letting sentient beings know and see in various ways.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'di dang 'dabs chags su byang shar gyi phyogs mtshams logs na 'jig rten gyi khams 'pho bar byed pa zhes bya ba yod de/ de na de bzhin gshegs pa la sdug bsngal dang bral ba zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / thams cad las grol ba zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / rgyu dang ldan pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / grol zhing mkhas pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so; ; 'das pa'i gter zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / rin po che'i 'od ces bya bar rab tu shes so/ / 'jig rten ston pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / gnas med pa'i sa thugs su chud pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / dad pa'i snying po zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / thugs mi sgul ba zhes bya bar rab tu shes te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ de dag la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi khams 'pho bar byed pa na mtshan bye ba brgya stong phrag bcur de bzhin gshegs pa sems can rnams kyis rab tu shes so/ /

“Northeast of this world Endurance is a world called Joy: there the Buddha may be called Mass of Beautiful Flowers, or Sandalwood Canopy, or Lotus Treasury, or Transcendent beyond All Things, or Jewel of Truth, or Reborn, or Pure Exquisite Canopy, or Immense Eye, or Possessor of Good Qualities, or Concentrated on the Truth, or Network Treasury; there are a million billion such names, letting beings know and see in various ways.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'di dang 'dabs chags su shar lho'i phyogs mtshams na 'jig rten gyi khams phan pa zhes bya ba yod de/ de na de bzhin gshegs pa la rab tu 'joms pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / byang ba thugs su chud pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / gsung snyan pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / rtsa ba khyad du 'phags pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / rgyun gyi gdugs zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / rgyu shin tu sbyangs pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / rnam par phye ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / dam pa'i bsam gtan mnga' ba zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / ran par gsung ba zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / blo rgya mtsho zhes bya bar rab tu shes te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ de dag la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi khams phan pa na mtshan bye ba brgya stong phrag bcur de bzhin gshegs pa sems can rnams kyis rab tu shes so/ /

“Southeast of this world Endurance is a world called Beneficial: there the Buddha may be called Manifesting Light, or Knowledge of Extinction, or Beautiful Sound, or Supreme Faculties, or Ornamental Canopy, or Energetic Faculties, or Arrived at the Other Shore beyond Discrimination, or Supreme Stability, or Simple Speech, or Ocean of Wisdom; there are a million such diverse names, letting beings know and see in various ways.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'di dang 'dabs chags su lho nub kyi phyogs mtshams na 'jig rten gyi khams kun tu song ba zhes bya ba yod de/ de na de bzhin gshegs pa la thub pa'i dbang po zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / mngon par sel ba zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / dus las shin tu grol ba zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / ngo bo nyid yongs su mkhyen pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / bka' nyams pa med pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / skal pa mnyam pa med par gzigs pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / dbang phyug gi dam pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / drang srong ston pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / 'phrin las brtsams pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / rdo rje'i seng+ge zhes bya bar rab tu shes te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ de dag la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi khams kun tu song ba na mtshan bye ba brgya stong phrag bcur de bzhin gshegs pa sems can rnams kyis rab tu shes so/ /

“Southwest of this world Endurance is a world called Rarefied: there the Buddha may be called Master among Sages, or Possessor of All Treasures, or Liberated from the World, or Faculty of Universal Knowledge, or Excellent Speech, or Clear Sight, or Freedom of the Senses, or Great Immortal Teacher, or Guiding Work, or Adamantine Lion; there are a million billion such names, letting beings know and see in various ways.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'di dang 'dabs chags su nub byang gi phyogs mtshams na 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su dga' ba zhes bya ba yod de/ de na de bzhin gshegs pa la me tog yang dag par brtsegs pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / tsan+dan gyi gdugs zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / pad+mo'i snying po zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / shin tu 'das pa'i chos zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / chos kyi ldum bu zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / shin tu 'phags pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / shin tu sbyangs pa'i gdugs zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / spyan shin tu yangs pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / tshul bzang po dang ldan pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / chos rtse gcig ces bya bar rab tu shes so/ / dra ba'i snying po zhes bya bar rab tu shes te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ de dag la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su dga' ba na mtshan bye ba brgya stong phrag bcur de bzhin gshegs pa sems can rnams kyis rab tu shes so/ /

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'di dang 'dabs chags su 'og gi phyogs na 'jig rten gyi khams mi che ba zhes bya ba yod de; de na de bzhin gshegs pa la 'od 'phro 'gyed pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / shin tu 'dul ba zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / dbang po'i mtshon cha zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / mi rtag pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / rtsa ba thugs su chud pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / 'phro ba med pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / rlung dang mnyam pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / gtong ba la mos pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / lam shin tu brtags pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / 'joms pa'i rgyal mtshan zhes bya bar rab tu shes te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ de dag la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi khams mi che ba na mtshan bye ba brgya stong phrag bcur de bzhin gshegs pa sems can rnams kyis rab tu shes so/ /

“Below this world Endurance is a world called Door Bolt: there the Buddha may be called Producing Flames, or Poison Queller, or Bow of the King of Gods, or No Constant Location, or Aware of the Fundamental, or Stopping Increase, or Great Speed, or Always Gladly Giving, or Discerning the Way, or Banner of Victory; there are a million billion such names, letting beings know and see in various ways.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'di dang 'dabs chags su steng gi phyogs na 'jig rten gyi khams dbyangs sgrog pa zhes bya ba yod de/ de na de bzhin gshegs pa la dpa' ba'i rgyal mtshan zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / rin po che tshad med pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / mchod sbyin la brtson pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / lha'i 'od ces bya bar rab tu shes so/ / dpal 'byung pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / 'khor las 'phags pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / thams cad kyi bdag po zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / 'khor lo mi ldog pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / bya ba dang bzhud pa med pa zhes bya bar rab tu shes so/ / thams cad mkhyen pas shin tu grol ba zhes bya bar rab tu shes te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /de dag la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi khams dbyangs sgrog pa na mtshan bye ba brgya stong phrag bcur de bzhin gshegs pa sems can rnams kyis rab tu shes so/ /

“Above this world Endurance is a world called Shaking Sound: there the Buddha may be called Banner of Courage, or Infinite Treasure, or Glad Magnanimity, or Celestial Light, or Appearance of Good Omen, or Transcending Objects, or Master of All, or Nonregressing Wheel, or Beyond All Evil, or Omniscient; there are a million billion such names, letting beings know and see in various ways.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ ji ltar 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'di na de bzhin gshegs pa sems can rnams kyis rab tu shes pa de bzhin du shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams bye ba brgya stong tshad med pa/ grangs med pa/ dpag tu med pa/ bsam gyis mi khyab pa/ mtshungs pa med pa/ kun tu mtha' yas pa/ mu med pa/ sa mtshams med pa/ brjod du med pa/ chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa/ nam mkha'i dbyings kyi mthas gtugs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na yang de bzhin gshegs pa sems can rnams kyis rab tu shes so/ / gzhung de ltar lho phyogs dang / de bzhin du nub phyogs dang / de bzhin du byang phyogs dang / de bzhin du byang shar gyi phyogs mtshams dang / de bzhin du shar lho'i phyogs mtshams dang / de bzhin du lho nub kyi phyogs mtshams dang / de bzhin du nub byang gi phyogs mtshams dang / de bzhin du 'og gi phyogs dang / de bzhin du steng gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams bye ba brgya stong tshad med pa/ grangs med pa/ dpag tu med pa; bsam gyis mi khyab pa/ mtshungs pa med pa/ kun tu mtha' yas pa/ mu med pa/ sa mtshams med pa/ brjod du med pa/ chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa/ nam mkha'i dbyings kyi mthas gtugs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na yang de bzhin gshegs pa sems can rnams kyis rab tu shes te/ sngon bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpar gyur pa'i tshe yongs su smin par mdzad pa de dag gis ni/ spyod pa rnam pa tha dad pa dang / gsung gi rnam pa tha dad pa dang / nga ro rnam pa tha dad pa dang / 'phrin las rnam pa tha dad pa dang / rnam par smin pa rnam pa tha dad pa dang / skye mched rnam pa tha dad pa dang / sbyor ba rnam pa tha dad pa dang / dbang po rnam pa tha dad pa dang / mos pa rnam pa tha dad pa dang / skye mched rab tu thob pa gzhan dang gzhan gyis sems can rnams la chos yongs su bstan pa'ang rab tu shes so/ /

“As in this world Endurance, so in the eastern direction, in hundreds of thousands of billions, countlessly, innumerably, boundlessly, incomparably, incalculably, unrecountably, unthinkably, immeasurably, unspeakably many worlds, throughout the entire space of the cosmos, the names and epithets of the Buddhas are variously different; the same is true of the South, West, and North, the four intermediate directions, and the zenith and the nadir. Just as when the Buddha was an enlightening being, by means of various discussions, various speeches, various words, various actions, various consequences, various situations, various techniques, various faculties, various beliefs, and various stations, attained maturity, so he causes sentient beings to perceive in this way, teaching them thus.”
shin tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo/ sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba las/ sangs rgyas kyi mtshan shin tu bstan pa zhes bya ba'i le'u ste/ bcu gnyis pa'o// //
[13. 'phags pa'i bden pa'i le'u]
BOOK EIGHT. The Four Holy Truths
bam po bcu drug pa/
de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jam dpal gyis byang chub sems dpa' de dag la 'di skad ces smras so/ /
THEN THE GREAT ENLIGHTENING BEING Manjushri said to the enlightening beings,

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ 'di na sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba de la 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'di nyid na yang byung ba zhes bya'o/ / gnod pa zhes bya'o/ / skal pa mi mnyam pa zhes bya'o/ / dmigs pa zhes bya'o/ / kun tu 'byung ba zhes bya'o/ / gsal shing gi rang bzhin zhes bya'o/ / gnas kyi rtsa ba zhes bya'o/ / gdon mi za ba zhes bya'o/ / shu ba'i gzeb zhes bya'o/ / byis pa'i spyod pa zhes bya'o/ /

“Children of Buddhas, the holy truth of suffering, in this world Endurance, is sometimes called wrongdoing, or oppression, or change, or clinging to objects, or accumulation, or thorns stabbing, or dependence on the senses, or deceit, or the place of cancer, or ignorant action.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /gang 'di na kun 'byung ba 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba de yang 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'di nyid na yang yongs su 'brel ba zhes bya'o/ / chud za ba zhes bya'o/ / tshor bar gcen pa zhes bya'o/ / myong bar byed pa zhes bya'o/ / sbyor ba las byung ba zhes bya'o/ / nges pa zhes bya'o/ / dran pa can zhes bya'o/ / brjod pa zhes bya'o/ / sems can gyi phyi bzhin snyegs pa zhes bya'o/ / phyin ci log gi rtsa ba zhes bya'o/ /

“The holy truth of the (cause of) the accumulation of suffering, in this world Endurance, may be called bondage, or disintegration, or attachment to goods, or false consciousness, or pursuit and involvement, or conviction, or the web, or fancified conceptualizing, or following, or awry faculties.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ gang sdug bsngal 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba de yang 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'di nyid na yang 'dzud pa zhes bya'o/ / rdul dang bral ba zhes bya'o/ / zhi ba zhes bya'o/ / mtshan nyid med pa zhes bya'o// ma nyams pa zhes bya'o/ / rang bzhin med pa zhes bya'o/ / so sor ldan pa zhes bya'o/ / nub par 'gro ba zhes bya'o/ / rang bzhin du gyur pa zhes bya'o/ / rang bzhin la gnas pa zhes bya'o/ /

“The holy truth of the extinction of suffering, in this world Endurance, may be called noncontention, or freedom from defilement, or tranquility and dispassion, or signlessness, or deathlessness, or absence of inherent nature, or absence of hindrance, or extinction, or essential reality, or abiding in one’s own essence.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ gang yang sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba de yang 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'di nyid na theg pa gcig ces bya'o/ / zhi bar 'gro ba zhes bya'o/ / dgra dang bral ba zhes bya'o/ / yongs su rtog pa zad pa zhes bya'o/ / shin tu mnyam par bzhag pa zhes bya'o/ / khur 'dor ba zhes bya'o/ / 'gro ba med par 'gro ba zhes bya'o/ / 'phags pa'i rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya'o/ / drang srong gi spyod pa zhes bya'o/ / gter bcu zhes bya ste;

“The holy truth of the path to the extinction of suffering, in this world Endurance, may be called the one vehicle, or progress toward serenity, or guidance, or ultimate freedom from discrimination, or equanimity, or putting down the burden, or having no object of pursuit, or following the intent of the saint, or the practice of sages, or ten treasuries.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ de ltar de dag la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'di nyid na'ang 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams la ming bye ba brgya phrag bzhi bcu yod de/ de dag gis sems can rnams bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'dul lo/ /
“In this world there are four quadrillion such names to express the four holy truths in accord with the mentalities of sentient beings, to cause them all to be harmonized and pacified.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ gang 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'di nyid na sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba de la 'jig rten gyi khams khebs pa yod pa na tshol ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya'o/ / mi 'byung ba zhes bya'o/ / rtsa ba mi brtan pa zhes bya'o/ / bya ba ma byas pa zhes bya'o/ / rtsod pa thams cad ces bya'o/ / rnam par phye ba nyam chung ba zhes bya'o/ / kun gzhi dang ldan pa zhes bya'o/ / gsod pa'i mchog ces bya'o/ / 'gul zhing g.yo ba zhes bya'o; ; dngos po'i gzugs brnyan zhes bya'o/ /
kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ gang sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba de yang 'jig rten gyi khams khebs pa yod pa na las su rung ba zhes bya'o/ / ldan pa zhes bya'o/ / sreg pa zhes bya'o/ / 'jigs pa zhes bya'o/ / 'jigs pa'i rtsa ba zhes bya'o/ / mtshams dang ldan pa zhes bya'o/ / sdig pa la spyod pa zhes bya'o/ / 'dod pa zhes bya'o/ / klad pa na ba zhes bya'o/ / sgal pa zhes bya'o/ /
kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ gang sdug bsngal 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba de yang 'jig rten gyi khams khebs pa yod pa na don ces bya'o/ / 'jigs pa sel ba zhes bya'o/ / yon tan thob par byed pa zhes bya'o/ / dbugs 'byin pa zhes bya'o/ / tshul bzang po zhes bya'o/ / 'dul ba zhes bya'o/ / yan lag gcig pu zhes bya'o/ / sdig pa med pa zhes bya'o/ / 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya'o/ / rtogs pa zhes bya'o/ /
kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ gang sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba de la'ang 'jig rten gyi khams khebs pa dang ldan pa na sde'i dbang po zhes bya'o/ / gyen du 'gro ba zhes bya'o/ / 'byung ba zhes bya'o/ / sbyor ba dang ldan pa zhes bya'o/ / lta ba mnyam pa zhes bya'o/ / mtha' las grol ba zhes bya'o/ / rtogs par byed pa zhes bya'o/ / rjes su brtul ba zhes bya'o/ / mig dam pa zhes bya'o/ / phyogs su snang ba zhes bya'o/ /
kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ de ltar de dag la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi khams khebs pa dang ldan pa na 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams kyi ming bye ba brgya stong phrag bzhi bcu yod de/ de dag gis sems can rnams bsam ba ji lta ba bzhin du 'dul lo/ /

“What in this world is called the holy truth of suffering is, in that world Secret Teaching, called the sense of striving and seeking, or not being emancipated, or the root of bondage, or doing what shouldn’t be done, or contending and struggling in all manner of situations, or total lack of power to analyze, or being depended on, or extreme pain, or hyperactivity, or things with form. What is called the holy truth of the accumulation of suffering is, in that world Secret Teaching, called following birth and death, or habitual attachment, or burning, or continuous revolving, or corrupt senses, or continuing existences, or evil behavior, or emotional attachment, or the source of illness or categorization. What is called the holy truth of the extinction of suffering is, in that world Secret Teaching, also called the ultimate truth, or emancipation, or praiseworthy, or peace, or the place good to enter, or docility, or singleness, or faultlessness, or freedom from greed, or resolution. What is called the holy truth of the path to extinction of suffering is, in that world Secret Teaching, also called bold generalship, or superior action, or transcendence, or having skill in means, or impartial eye, or detachment from extremes, or comprehensive understanding, or inclusion, or supreme eye, or contemplating the four truths. In the world Secret Teaching, there are four quadrillion such names to explain the four holy truths, to cause sentient beings to be harmonized and pacified according to their mentalities.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ gang 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'di na sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba de yang 'jig rten gyi khams lhag pa na 'jig pa zhes bya'o/ / skal pa gcod pa zhes bya'o/ / smad pa'i gnas zhes bya'o/ / nye bar bsrabs pa zhes bya'o/ / rnam par sreg pa zhes bya'o/ / 'khon du 'gyur ba zhes bya'o/ / nad dang ma bral ba zhes bya'o/ / rgyud 'khrugs pa zhes bya'o/ / dka' ba bsgrubs pa zhes bya'o/ / rab tu brtags pa zhes bya'o/ / mos pa dang ldan pa zhes bya'o/ /
kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ gang sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba de yang 'jig rten gyi khams lhag pa na rab tu 'jig pa zhes bya'o; ; gti mug gi rtsa ba zhes bya'o/ / dgra dam pa zhes bya'o/ / bkres pa'i yan lag ces bya'o/ / ro med pa zhes bya'o/ / kun skyed pa zhes bya'o/ / rang bzhin ma yin pa zhes bya'o// bkur bar bya ba zhes bya'o/ / mun pa khyer ba zhes bya'o/ / blo gros bcom pa zhes bya'o/ /
kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ gang sdug bsngal 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba de yang 'jig rten gyi khams lhag pa na don chen po zhes bya'o/ / phan pa'i yan lag ces bya'o/ / don gyi don ces bya'o/ / tshad med pa zhes bya'o/ / mthong ba zhes bya'o/ / rtog pa med pa zhes bya'o/ / mchog tu dul ba zhes bya'o/ / rtag tu mnyam pa zhes bya'o/ / gnas par byed pa zhes bya'o/ / yan lag byas pa med pa zhes bya'o/ /
kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /gang sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba de yang 'jig rten gyi khams lhag pa na me'i tsha ba zhes bya'o/ / yan lag dang po zhes bya'o/ / rnam par gdon mi za ba zhes bya'o/ / mi 'phrog pa zhes bya'o/ / tshul zab mo zhes bya'o/ / 'byung ba zhes bya'o/ / mi dma' ba zhes bya'o/ / rtogs par khong du chud pa zhes bya'o/ / grol ba'i rang bzhin zhes bya'o/ / rab tu 'grel ba zhes bya'o/ /
kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ de ltar de dag la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi khams lhag pa na 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams kyi ming bye ba brgya stong phrag bzhi bcu yod de/ de dag gis sems can rnams bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'dul lo/ /

“What is, in this world Endurance, called the holy truth of suffering, is, in the world Abundance, also called fear, or individual mortality, or disgusting, or what should be worked on, or change, or ensnaring enemy, or deceptive usurper, or hard to work with, or false discrimination, or possessor of power.
