lam du zhugs pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad phyi na ma lus par 'gro zhing sangs rgyas kyi lam du zhugs par gyur cig /ces sems bskyed do/ /
Setting out on a road, They should wish that all beings Go where the Buddha goes, Into the realm of nonreliance.

'gro ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos bsgribs pa med pa grub par gyur pas chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang dbus med pa khong du chud par gyur cig /ces sems bskyed do/ /
lam mtho ba mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad shin tu zhum pa med de khams gsum las gyen du 'phags par gyur cig /ces sems bskyed do/ /
lam dma' ba mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad dge ba'i rtsa bas shin tu brtan cing sangs rgyas thams cad la shin tu 'dud par gyur cig /ces sems bskyed do/ /
lam nyam nga ba mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad lta ba yo zhing mi drang ba dang bral te nyam nga ba yongs su spangs par gyur cig /ces sems bskyed do/ /
lam drang po mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad g.yo med cing sgyu med de sems drang po dang ldan par gyur cig /ces sems bskyed do/ /

When on the road, They should wish that all beings Tread the pure realm of reality, Their minds without obstruction.
Seeing a road uphill, They should wish that all beings Forever leave the world, Their minds free from weakness.
Seeing a road downhill, They should wish that all beings Be humble in mind And develop enlightened bases of virtue.
Seeing a winding road, They should wish that all beings Abandon false paths And forever purge wrong views.
Seeing a straight road, They should wish that all beings Be straight and true in mind, Without flattery or deceit.

lam rdul chen po mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad shin tu rdul med pa'i chos yang dag par thob ste 'dod chags par gyur pa'i chos las rnam par grol bar gyur cig /ces sems bskyed do/ /
rdul med pa'i lam mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad snying rje chen po yongs su bsgoms pa dang ldan zhing sems 'jam par gyur cig /ces sems bskyed do; ;
g.yang sa mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad bsgribs pa med pa rtogs par khong du chud cing sdig pa'i chos thams cad bsal te dge ba'i chos la rab tu gzhol bar gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
'khor mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad dus gsum du gtogs pa'i chos zab mo bstan pa dang mthun par gyur cig / ces sems bskyed do/ /
ka ba mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad khro zhing 'khon du 'dzin pa dang bral te khengs pa dang / 'khrug pa dang rnam par bral bar gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /

Seeing a dusty road, They should wish that all beings Get rid of dust and dirt And attain the state of purity.
Seeing a dust-free road, They should wish that all beings Always practice great compassion, Their hearts refreshing and nourishing.
Seeing a dangerous road, They should wish that all beings Abide in the realm of truth And avoid the troubles of wrongdoing.
Seeing a group of people, They should wish that all beings Expound the most profound teaching, That all be harmoniously united.
If they see a big tree, They should wish that all beings Divorce egotistic contentiousness And be free of anger and resentment.

nags tshal mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad lha dang 'jig rten du bcas pas phyag bya ba'i gnas su gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
ri mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad thob par dka' ba dang / thibs po med pa rab tu thob cing / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyis mngon par 'phags par gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
shing tsher ma can mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug med cing tsher ma dang bral bar gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
shing lo ma can mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dag gis rab tu g.yogs par gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
me tog mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad chos thams cad mngon par shes pa'i me tog rgyas pas me tog lta bur gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /

If they see a grove, The should wish that all beings Be worthy of the respect Of celestials and humans.
If they see high mountains, They should wish that all beings’ Roots of goodness stand out, Their peak beyond anyone’s reach.
If they see thorny trees, They should wish that all beings May quickly cut away The thorns of the three poisons.
Seeing trees with luxuriant foliage, They should wish that all beings Make a canopy of light With stability and liberation.
If they see flowers blooming, They should wish that all beings’ Mystic spiritual powers Be like blossoming flowers.

me tog gi shing mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi me tog shin tu rgyas par gyur cig /ces sems bskyed do/ /
shing tog mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad snying po byang chub tu gzhol zhing / sangs rgyas kyi chos btsal ba thams cad 'bras bu yod de/ 'bras bu'i dam pa rab tu thob par gyur cig /ces sems bskyed do/ /
chu klung mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi ye shes nyams su myong ste chos kyi rgyun la mnyam par gzhag par gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
lu ma mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ro gcig pa'i phyir se gol gtogs pa tsam gyis khong du chud par gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
rdzing bu mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad chos thams cad kyi tshig shin tu bstan pa la mkhas shing chos thams cad kyis rgyas pa'i tshig gi las dang ldan par gyur cig /ces sems bskyed do/ /

If they see blossoms on trees, They should wish that all beings’ Features be like flowers, With all marks of distinction.
If they see fruits, They should wish that all beings Attain the supreme teaching And realize the way of enlightenment.
If they see a big river, They should wish that all beings Gain entry into the stream of truth And enter the ocean of Buddha-knowledge.
If they see a reservoir, They should wish that all beings Quickly awaken to The truth of the oneness of the Buddhas.
If they see a pond, They should wish that all beings Be fully accomplished in speech And be skillful in preaching.

khron pa mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad chos thams cad 'byor pa dang ldan zhing spobs pa mang bar gyur cig /ces sems bskyed do/ /
mtsho mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad gong nas gong du dmigs pa la rab tu brtson zhing / dge ba'i rtsa ba mi zad par gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
zam pa mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad skye pa thams cad yongs su bsgral ba la zam par red par gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
yur ba mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad 'gro ba kun gyi sems dang bsam pa la mkhas shing / bag la nyal ba dang / kun nas 'khor ba med par gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
ra ba mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya la sred pa rab tu byang bar gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /

If they see a well, They should wish that all beings Have full powers of elucidation To explain all things.
If they see a spring, They should wish that all beings’ Skill in means increases And their good roots be inexhaustible.
If they see a bridge, They should wish that all beings Carry all across to freedom Like a bridge.
If they see flowing water, They should wish that all beings Develop wholesome will And wash away the stains of delusion.
Seeing a garden cultivated They should wish that all beings In the garden of sense desires Clear away the weeds of craving.

mya ngan med pa'i nags tshal mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad sred pa shin tu med cing mya ngan med pa rab tu thob par gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
bza' shing gi ra ba mthong pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi byang chub yongs su mi gtang ba la shin tu brtson par gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
sems can rgyan gyis brgyan pa mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis brgyan par gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
rgyan med pa'i sems can mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad sbyangs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa thob pas rgyan med par gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
dga' ba mang ba'i sems can mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad chos la dga' zhing mos pa dang / spro bas dga' ba mang bar gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /

Seeing a forest of “sorrowless” trees They should wish that all beings Forever divorce greed and lust And not produce anxiety and fear.
If they see a park, They should wish that all beings Diligently cultivate the practices Leading to Buddhas’ enlightenment.
Seeing people wearing ornaments They should wish that all beings Be adorned with a Buddha’s Thirty-two marks of distinction.
Seeing the unadorned They should wish that all beings Give up decorations And practice austerity.
Seeing people attached to pleasure They should wish that all beings Delight themselves with truth, Not abandoning love for it.

mi dga' ba mang ba'i sems can mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad 'dus byas kyi dngos po thams cad la mi dga' ba mang bar gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
sems can bde ba mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi bde ba'i yo byed thams cad rab tu thob pas shin tu bde bar gyur cig /ces sems bskyed do/ /
sems can sdug bsngal ba mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad ye shes kyi rtsa ba rab tu thob ste sdug bsngal zhi bar byed par gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
nad med pa ma yin pa'i sems can mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad shin tu mya ngan med pa'i chos can du gyur te tha dad pa med pa khong du chud par gyur cig / ces sems bskyed do/ /

Seeing the unattached They should wish that all beings Have no care in their minds For fabricated things.
Seeing happy people They should wish that all beings Always be peaceful and happy, Gladly supporting the Buddhas.
Seeing people suffer They should wish that all beings Attain fundamental knowledge And eliminate all misery.
Seeing people with no maladies They should wish that all beings Enter true wisdom And never have sickness or afflictions.
Seeing people sick They should wish that all beings Know the body is empty and null And divorce opposition and conflict.

sems can sdug gu mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la mos pa mang bar gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
mi sdug pa'i sems can mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi bya ba la mos pa chung bar gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
drin gzo ba'i sems can mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis mdzad pa shes par gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
drin gzo ba med pa'i sems can mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad mi dge ba'i lta ba la drin du gzo ba med par gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
dge sbyong mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad ma lus pa'i mthar thug par bya ba la brtson zhing zhi ba dang / dul ba la gzhol bar gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /

Seeing handsome people They should wish that all beings Always have pure faith In the enlightened and enlightening ones.
Seeing ugly people They should wish that all beings Not become attached To anything not good.
Seeing grateful people They should wish that all beings Be able to know the blessings Of the Buddhas and enlightening beings.
Seeing ungrateful people They should wish that all beings Not increase the punishment Of those who are bad.
If they see mendicants, They should wish that all beings Be harmonious and tranquil, Ultimately conquering themselves.

bram ze mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad tshangs pa'i dam par gyur te sdig pa spangs par gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
dka' thub can mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad ma lus pa'i mthar thug par bya ba la brtson zhing dka' thub la shin tu gzhol bar gyur cig /ces sems bskyed do/ /
brtul zhugs la zhugs pa mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi byang chub yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir brtul zhugs dam por gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
go gyon pa'i sems can mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad rang byung gi chos yongs su btsal ba la go cha bzang po shin tu bgos par gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
go ma gyon pa'i sems can mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad mi dge ba'i las bya ba thams cad la go gyon pa med par gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /

Seeing brahmins They should wish that all beings Always maintain pure conduct, Getting rid of all evil.
Seeing ascetics They should wish that all beings By austere practices Reach the ultimate state.
Seeing self-disciplined people They should wish that all beings Strongly maintain their will in practice And not give up the Buddhas’ path.
Seeing people wearing armor They should wish that all beings Always wear the armor of virtue, Heading for the teacherless state.
Seeing the unarmed They should wish that all beings Be forever rid of all Doings that are not good.

rgol ba'i sems can mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad phas kyi rgol ba thams cad shin tu tshar gcod par gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
'tsho ba'i sems can mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad spyod lam bcos pa med cing 'tsho ba dag par gyur cig / ces sems bskyed do/ /
rgyal po mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad thogs pa med pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i chos kyi rgyal por gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
rgyal po'i bu mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi sras chos las skyes pa'i chos kyi sprul par gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
khyim bdag mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad rnam par gdon mi za ba'i blo can du gyur te grong gi chos spangs par gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /

Seeing people debate They should wish that all beings Be able to refute All erroneous doctrines.
Seeing people of proper livelihood They should wish that all beings Succeed in pure livelihood Without improper behavior.
If they see a king, They should wish that all beings Become kings of truth, Always expounding the right teaching.
If they see a prince, They should wish that all beings Be reborn from the truth And be children of Buddha.
If they see an elder, They should wish that all beings Be able to clearly cut off And not practice evil ways.

blon po mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad mi dge ba'i chos kyi spyod pa thams cad la bzang po yid la byed par gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
grong khyer mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad gdul dka' ba'i sems dang ldan par gyur te/ mthu bo che'i lus dang 'dra bar gyur cig /ces sems bskyed do/ /
rgyal po'i gnas mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad yon tan gyi rjes su 'brang bar mthun pa la mos pa'i sems dang ldan par gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
nags tshal gyi 'dabs mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi bsngags par 'os par gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
slong du 'gro ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad bsgribs pa med pa'i tshul gyis chos kyi dbyings su chud par gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /

If they see a great minister, They should wish that all beings Always maintain right mindfulness And practice all virtues.
If they see a castle, They should wish that all beings Gain strong and firm bodies And indefatigable minds.
If they see a capital, They should wish that all beings Collect all virtuous qualities And always be joyful and blissful.
Seeing someone in a forest, They should wish that all beings Be worthy of praise and honor Of celestials and humans
Entering a village to beg, They should wish that all beings Enter the profound realm of truth, Their minds without impediment.

sgor phyin pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi sgor phyin par gyur cig /ces sems bskyed do/ /
nang du phyin pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dus gsum du mnyam pa nyid kyi nang du phyin par gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
mi sbyin no/ / zhes ma byas pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad bsod nams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thob cing spangs pa med par gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
mi sbyin no/ / zhes byas pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten las phyir spangs par gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
lhung bzed stong pa mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis stong par gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /

Coming to someone’s door, They should wish that all beings Enter into all Doors of Buddha’s teaching.
Having entered a house, They should wish that all beings Might enter the vehicle of buddhahood Which is equal in all times.
Seeing someone who doesn’t give They should wish that all beings Never ever give up Supremely virtuous ways.
Seeing those who give They should wish that all beings Forever abandon The three evil paths and their miseries.
If they see an empty bowl, They should wish that all beings Be pure of heart And empty of afflictions.

lhung bzed gang ba mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad chos dkar po thams cad kyis yongs su rgyas par gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
rim gror byas pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi spyod pa thams cad la rim gro byed par gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
rim gror ma byas pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad mi dge ba'i chos mchod pa thams cad la rag ma lus par gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
khrel yod pa'i sems can mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad dbang po dben pa'i spyod pa dang ldan zhing khrel yod par gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
ngo tsha med pa'i sems can mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad byams pa la gnas shing ngo tsha med pa yongs su spangs par gyur cig / ces sems bskyed do/ /

If they see a full bowl, They should wish that all beings Completely fulfill All virtuous ways.
If they receive respect, They should wish that all beings Respectfully practice All the Buddha’s teachings.
If they get no respect, They should wish that all beings Not act in any ways That are not good.
Seeing people with conscience They should wish that all beings Act with discretion And cover their organs.
Seeing the shameless They should wish that all beings Give up shamelessness And abide in the way of kindness.

kha zas bsod pa mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad zang zing med pa'i sems dang ldan zhing smon lam thams cad phun sum tshogs par gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
kha zas mi bsod pa thob pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad ting nge 'dzin nyams su bde ba thams cad thob par gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
kha zas snum bag thob pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad snying rje chen po yongs su bsgoms pa'i sems dang ldan zhing sems 'jam par gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
snum bag med pa'i kha zas thob pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad 'jig rten gyi sred pa dang bral te snum bag med pa'i sems su gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
kha zas za ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad chos la dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' bas yongs su rgyas shing bsam gtan gyi zas za bar gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /

If they get fine food, They should wish that all beings Should fulfill their aspirations And be free from envy and longing.
If they get poor food, They should wish that all beings Should not fail to obtain The taste of all meditations.
Getting soft food They should wish that all beings Be imbued with compassion, Their minds becoming gentle.
Getting coarse, dry food They should wish that all beings Have no attachments And cut off mundane craving.
When they eat, They should wish that all beings Feed on the joy of meditation And be sated by delight in truth.

ro myang ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad bdud rtsi'i ros ngoms par gyur cing skyes bu chen po'i mtshan ro bro ba'i mchog thob par gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
zan zos pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi pha rol tu phyin cing bya ba byas par gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
chos ston pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la yang dag par gzhol zhing spobs pa mi zad pa dang ldan par gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
phyir 'byung ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi ye shes nyams su myong ste khams gsum thams cad nas 'byung bar gyur cig /ces sems bskyed do/ /
chu 'bog pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyi thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la 'bog par gyur cig /ces sems bskyed do/ /

When tasting flavor, They should wish that all beings Attain the supreme savor of buddhahood And be filled with the elixir of immortality.
When the meal is finished, They should wish that all beings Accomplish all their tasks And fulfill the Buddha’s teachings.
When they explain the teaching, They should wish that all beings Attain inexhaustible eloquence And widely expound the essentials of the teaching.
When they leave a place, They should wish that all beings Deeply enter enlightened knowledge, Forever leaving the triple world.
When they enter a bath, They should wish that all beings Enter omniscient knowledge, Knowing past, present, and future are equal.

khrus byed pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad 'od mtha' yas pa dang ldan zhing lus dang / sems dri ma med par gyur cig /ces sems bskyed do/ /
dro ba la spyod pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad mu med par phyin te yongs su gdung ba sel bar gyur cig /ces sems bskyed do/ /
bsil ba la spyod pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad shin tu bsil bar gyur te bla na med pa'i bsil ba'i dngos po kho 'du chud par gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
chos thob par byed pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi gtam gyi rjes su 'gro zhing chos kyi dbyings dang 'dris par gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
sangs rgyas mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad dang 'grogs pa rab tu thob ste bsgribs pa med pa'i mig dang ldan par gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /

While washing their bodies, They should wish that all beings Be undefiled in body and mind, Radiantly pure inside and out.
In the blistering heat of the day They should wish that all beings Cast off myriad afflictions, Putting an end to them all.
When the heat subsides and begins to cool, They should wish that all beings Experience the highest truth And be ultimately cool.
When reciting scripture, They should wish that all beings Accord with the Buddha’s teachings, Remembering without forgetting.
If they get to see a Buddha, They should wish that all beings Be all like Universally Good, Handsome and well adorned.
mig mi 'gebs par blta ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad kun tu mdzes pas kun tu bzang por gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /

mchod rten mthong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad 'gro ba kun gyis mchod par 'os shing mchod rten lta bur gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
blta ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis blta bar gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
spyi bos thug pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis spyi gtsug bltar mi snang bar gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byed pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du don dang mthun par gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
lan gsum du bskor ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi byang chub tu mos pa'i rab dang ldan par gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /

When seeing a Buddha’s tomb, They should wish that all beings Be honored as the shrine And receive the offerings of celestials and humans.
Reverently gazing at the shrine, They should wish that all beings Be looked up to by all Celestials and humans.
Bowing their heads to the shrine, They should wish that all beings Be exalted beyond the view Of gods and men.
Circumabulating the shrine, They should wish that all beings Act without offense And develop omniscience.
Circling the shrine thrice, They should wish that all beings Diligently see the Buddha’s path Without indolence of mind.

sangs rgyas kyi yon tan brjod pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad yon tan gyi pha rol tu phyin pas yon tan mi zad par gyur cig/ ces sems bskyed do/ /
mtshan rnams brjod pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad mtshan nyid med pa'i chos la gzhol zhing yan lag dam pa phun sum tshogs par gyur cing / / ces sems bskyed do/ /
rkang pa 'khru ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad dri ma med pa'i mthar phyin cing rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pas pha rol tu phyin par gyur cig /ces sems bskyed do/ /
lus smyong ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad bsam pa la rnyog pa med cing lus kyi 'du byed shin tu bde bar gyur cig /ces sems bskyed do/ /
gnyid sad pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad phyogs bcu thams cad du mthu chen po thob par gyur te/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la shin tu rnam par sangs rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas su gyur cig /ces sems bskyed do/ /

Praising the Buddha’s virtues, They should wish that all beings Fulfill all virtues Extolled endlessly.
Praising the Buddha’s distinguishing marks, They should wish that all beings Develop the buddha-body And realize formless truth.
When washing their feet, They should wish that all beings Fulfill the bases of spiritual powers, Unhindered wherever they go.
When going to sleep at night, They should wish that all beings Attain physical ease And undisturbed minds.
Awakening from sleep, They should wish that all beings Awaken omniscience, Perceiving in all directions.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems kyi las yid la byed pa'i sbyor ba gang dang ldan pas yon tan gyi khyad par 'di dag dang / gzhan thams cad kyang thob par 'gyur zhing / lha dang 'jig rten du bcas pa dang / bdud du bcas pa dang / tshangs par bcas pa dang / dge sbyong dang / bram ze dang / skye rgur bcas pa dang / lha dang / dri za dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas su bcas pa thams cad kyis mi 'phrog par 'gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i sems kyi las yid la byed pa'i sbyor ba rnams so/ /

“Child of Buddha, if enlightening beings use their minds in this way, they will attain all supremely wonderful qualities, which cannot be dislodged by any gods, demons, monks, brahmins, gandharvas, titans, etc., or by any Buddhist followers or self-enlightened ones.”
shin tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba las/ spyod yul yongs su dag pa'i le'u ste/ bcu drug pa'o// //
[17. bzang po'i dpal gyi le'u]
BOOK TWELVE. Chief in Goodness
bam po bcu dgu pa/
yon tan yangs pa'i spyod yul yongs dag pa/ / de skad smras nas sems can dri med pa/ / 'jam pa'i dbyangs kyis byang chub yon tan rnams/ / sems can dam pa bzang po'i dpal la dris/ /

THEN THE ENLIGHTENING BEING Manjushri, having explained the great virtues of unpolluted, undistorted pure activity, wanted to bring out the virtues of the aspiration for enlightenment, so he asked the enlightening being Chief in Goodness,
spyod yul yongs dag rgyal ba'i spyod pa rnams/ / bdag gis rgyal sras rnams la 'dir bshad do/ / yon tan spyod pa ji snyed gang yod pa/ / rgyal sras rnams la nga ni khyod kyis shod/ /

Now I have, for the sake of the enlightening beings, Explained the purifying practices cultivated by Buddhas in the past; Benevolent One, you too, in this assembly should Expound the supreme virtues of practical application.
Then Chief in Goodness responded in verse:

bzang po'i dpal gyis smras pa rgyal sras nyon/ / yon tan mtha' yas de dag yon tan las/ / mtsho las thigs pa ji bzhin nyung shes shig / mgo smos tsam du chung zad brjod par bya/ /
byang chub don du rang byung 'gyur bya zhes/ / thog mar byang chub sems skyes gyur pa yi/ / yon tan brjod pa'ang mtha' yas dpag tu med/ / dpe zla med pas brjod kyang zad ma gyur/ /
pha rol phyin dang sa yi yon tan la/ / bskal pa mang por spyad pa ci zhig smos/ / de dag yon tan chu bo thams cad ni/ / phyogs bcu'i rgyal bas bstan kyang zad mi 'gyur/ /
yon tan mtha' yas rnams kyi yon tan las/ / dpe tsam cha shas chung tsam brjod par bya/ / mkha' las 'dab chags lam ltar shin tu chung / / sa chen lhun las rdul phran gcig kyang 'dra/ /
byang chub yon tan bsam pa'i sems skye ba/ / rgyu med ma yin rkyen las 'byung ba yin/ / rgyal pa rnams dang bde gshegs chos rnams dang / / dge 'dun rnams la dad pa bskyed pas skye/ /

Very good, Benevolent One—you should listen clearly. Those virtues and merits cannot be measured: I will now tell a little, as well as I can, But it will be but as a drop of the ocean.
When an enlightening being first determines on the Way, Vowing to seek and realize Buddhas’ enlightenment, The virtues therein are boundless, Immeasurable, beyond compare.
How much the more so, through countless, boundless eons, To fully practice the virtues of the stages and transcendent ways; Even all the Buddhas of the ten directions Together could not fully expound them all.
Of such boundless great virtues I will now tell a little bit, Like the space trod by a bird’s feet, Or like a mote of dust of the earth.
When enlightening beings determine to seek enlightenment, This is not without cause, not without conditions; Engendering pure faith in the Buddha, Teaching, and Community, By this they produce a broad, magnanimous mind.

Not seeking objects of desire or positions of authority, Wealth, personal enjoyment, or fame, It is only to forever annihilate creatures’ miseries And to benefit the world that they rouse their will.
Always wanting to profit and gladden all beings, They adorn lands and make offerings to Buddhas. Accepting the right teaching, they cultivate its knowledges; To realize enlightenment they arouse their minds.
Deep faith, belief, and resolution always pure, They honor and respect all Buddhas, As well as their Teachings and Communities; Making offerings with ultimate sincerity, they rouse their will.
Deeply believing in the Buddha and the Buddha’s teaching, They also believe in the Way traversed by buddhas-to-be, And believe in unexcelled great enlightenment: Thereby do enlightening beings first rouse their will.
Faith is the basis of the Path, the mother of virtues, Nourishing and growing all good ways, Cutting away the net of doubt, freeing from the torrent of passion, Revealing the unsurpassed road of ultimate peace.

dad pa sems gsal rnyog pa med pa ste/ / nga rgyal rnam spangs sri zhu'i rtsa ba yin/ / dad pa spyod mchog nor dang gter yin te/ / lag pa lta bur dge sdud rtsa ba yin/ /
yongs su gtong la dad pa dga' bar byed/ / rgyal pa'i chos la dad pa spro ba skyed/ / yon tan ye shes khyad par dad pa byed/ / sangs rgyas lam la ston pa'ang rnyed par byed/ /
dbang po rno zhing rab tu gsal ba dang / / gzhan gyis mi thub dngos la dad pa stobs/ / nyon mongs thub pa med la gnas yin te/ / dad pa rang byung yon tan tshol ba yin/ /
dad pa chags pa'i sgo dang mi 'grogs te/ / mi khom spo zhing 'du 'dzin med par byed/ / dad pa bdud kyi lam las zlog pa ste/ / thar lam dam pa yongs su ston pa yin/ /
yon tan rgyu yin sa bon ma rul bzhin/ / dad pa byang chub shing rab rnam par skyed/ / ye shes khyad par sgo rnams 'phel bar byed/ / dad pa rgyal ba rnams kyi ston pa yin/ /

When faith is undefiled, the mind is pure; Obliterating pride, it is the root of reverence, And the foremost wealth in the treasury of religion, Being a pure hand to receive the practices.
Faith is generous, the mind not begrudging; Faith can joyfully enter the Buddha’s teaching; Faith can increase knowledge and virtue; Faith can assure arrival at enlightenment.
Faith makes the faculties pure, clear and sharp; The power of faith is strong and indestructible. Faith can annihilate the root of affliction, Faith can turn one wholly to the virtues of buddhahood.
Faith has no attachment to objects: Transcending difficulties, it reaches freedom from trouble. Faith can go beyond the pathways of demons, And reveal the unsurpassed road of liberation.
Faith is the unspoiled seed of virtue, Faith can grow the seed of enlightenment. Faith can increase supreme knowledge, Faith can reveal all Buddhas.

de bas dad mos khyad par dga' ba la/ / spyod pa rim gyis rnam par brjod par bya/ / chos tshul 'di 'dra 'jig rten rnams na dkon/ / rin chen seng+ge'i rgyal po ji bzhin no/ /
dad pas sangs rgyas sri zhu gang byed pa/ / de dag tshul khrims slob pa mi gtong ngo/ / tshul khrims slob pa gang rnams mi gtong ba/ / de dag yon tan gnas pas yon tan ldan/ /
tshul khrims byang chub shes rab ston pa ste/ / bslab pas sa yi yon tan legs la brtson/ / tshul khrims bslab pa yongs su ma btang na/ / rgyal ba rnams kyis bstod cing bsngags par 'os/ /
dad pas sangs rgyas sri zhu gang byed pa; ; de dag rgyal ba'i mchod pa yangs pa byed/ / rgyal ba rnams la mchod pa su byed pa/ / de dag sangs rgyas mos pa bsam mi khyab/ /
dad pas chos la phu dud gang byed pa/ / de dag rgyal ba'i chos kyis mi ngoms nyan/ / rgyal ba'i chos kyis mi ngoms su nyan pa/ / de dag bsam gyis mi khyab chos la mos/ /

Therefore I’ll explain in steps practicing in accord: Faith is most powerful, very difficult to have; It’s like in all worlds having The wondrous wish-fulfilling pearl.
If one can always faithfully serve the Buddhas, Then one can keep the precepts and cultivate studies; If one always keeps the precepts and practices what one learns, Then one can embody all virtuous qualities.
Self-control can develop the basis of enlightenment, Study the foundation of cultivating virtues; Always acting in accord with discipline and study, One will be praised for excellence by all enlightened ones.
If one always faithfully serves the Buddhas, Then one can assemble great offerings.
If one can assemble great offerings, One’s faith in Buddha is beyond conception.
If one always faithfully serves the honorable Teaching, Then one will tirelessly listen to the Buddha’s teaching.
If one hears the Buddha’s teaching without tiring of it, One’s faith in the Teaching is inconceivable.

dad pas dge 'dun phu dud su byed pa/ / de dag mi ldog dge 'dun rnams la mos/ / mi ldog dge 'dun rnams la su mos pa/ / de dag dad pa'i stobs kyis phyir mi ldog /
dad pa'i stobs kyis gang rnams mi ldog pa/ / de dag dbang po rab tu gsal zhing rno/ / gang rnams dbang po rab tu gsal rno ba/ / des ni sdig pa'i grogs po rnam par spangs/ /
gang gis sdig pa'i grogs po rnams spangs pa/ / de dag chos kyi bshes gnyen yongs su 'dzin/ / chos kyi bshes gnyen gang gis yongs bzung ba/ / de dag dge ba rgya chen yongs su gsog /
dge ba rgya chen yongs su gang gsog pa; ; bdag nyid che ba de dag rgyu mthu ldan/ / bdag nyid che ba rgyu mthu gang ldan pa/ / de dag mos pa'i khyad par yangs pa 'thob/ /
mos pa yangs pa'i khyad par sus thob pa/ / de dag rtag tu rgyal bas byin gyis brlab/ / rgyal ba'i byin gyis gang rnams brlabs gyur pa/ / de dag byang chub don du sems kyang skye/ /

If one always faithfully serves the pure Community, Then one’s faith will never regress.
If one’s faith never regresses, One’s power of faith is unshakable.
If nothing can shake one’s power of faith, Then one gains purity, clarity, and sharpness of sense.
If one has purity, clarity, and sharpness of sense, One can avoid bad associates.
If one can avoid bad associates, Then one can approach good associates.
If one can be with good associates, Then one can cultivate great goodness.
If one can cultivate great goodness, One can perfect great causal power.
If one perfects great causal power, Then one can attain supremely certain understanding.
If one attains supremely certain understanding, Then one will be protected by the Buddhas.
If one is protected by the Buddhas, Then one can arouse the will for enlightenment.

byang chub don du gang gis sems skyes pa/ / de dag drang srong chen po'i yon tan brtson/ / drang srong chen po'i yon tan su brtson pa/ / de dag sangs rgyas rigs su rigs ldan skyes/ /
sangs rgyas rigs su rigs ldan gang skyes pa; ; de dag 'du dang 'bral ba rnam par spangs/ / 'du dang 'bral ba gang gis rnam spangs pa/ / de dag bsam pa dang zhing rnam par dag /
gang gi bsam pa dang zhing rnam dag pa/ / de dag lhag pa'i bsam pa dam pa'i mchog / lhag bsam dam pa mchog dang su ldan pa/ / de dag rtag tu pha rol phyin la spyod/ /
pha rol phyin la rtag tu su spyod pa/ / de dag theg pa chen po 'di la spyod/ / theg pa chen po 'di la su spyod pa/ / de dag nan tan dam pas sangs rgyas mchod/ /
nan tan dam pas sangs rgyas su mchod pa/ / de dag sangs rgyas rjes dran phyed pa med; ; sangs rgyas rjes dran gang la mi phyed pa/ / de dag rtag tu sangs rgyas bsam yas mthong / /

If one can arouse the will for enlightenment, Then one can diligently cultivate the virtues of buddhahood.
If one can diligently cultivate the virtues of buddhahood, Then he can be born in the family of the enlightened.
If one gets to be born in the family of the enlightened, Then one can practice skillful liberative techniques.
If one can develop skill in means of liberation well, Then one can reach purity of the faithful mind.
If one gains purity of the faithful mind, Then one can increase supreme will.
If one can increase supreme will, Then one can always practice the transcendent ways,
If one always practices the transcendent ways, Then one can fulfill the Great Vehicle.
If one can fulfill the Great Vehicle, Then one can give offerings to Buddhas in the right way.
If one can make offerings to Buddhas in the right way, Then one can remember Buddha with unwavering mind.
If one can remember Buddha with unwavering mind, Then one can always see infinite Buddhas.

rtag tu sangs rgyas bsam yas sus mthong ba/ / de dag rtag tu sangs rgyas mi 'grogs min/ / rtag tu sangs rgyas mi 'grogs su ma yin/ / de la chos nub 'gyur ba nam yang med/ /
gang la chos nub 'gyur ba med gyur pa/ / de dag spobs pa sgrib pa med dang ldan; ; spobs pa sgrib pa med dang su ldan pa/ / de dag chos rab ston pa mtha' yang yas/ /
gang gis chos rab bstan pa mtha' yas pa/ / de dag 'gro la byams pas phan pa tshol/ / 'gro la byams pas phan pa su tshol ba/ / de dag snying rje chen po'i rtsa ba brtan/ /
snying rje chen po'i rtsa ba sus brtan pa/ / de dag chos kyi dga' bas dbang po dga'/ / chos kyi dga' bas dbang po gang dga' ba/ / de dag 'du byed nyes la btang snyoms so/ /
'du byad nyes pa gang gis btang snyoms pa/ / de dag nga rgyal rlom sems bag med spangs/ / nga rgyal rlom sems bag med sus spangs pa/ / de dag rtag tu bdag dang gzhan don brtson/ /

If one always sees infinite Buddhas, Then one sees the essence of the enlightened is eternal.
If one sees the essence of the enlightened is eternal, Then one can know the truth never dies.
If one can know the truth never dies, Then one attains unhindered powers of elucidation.
If one attains unhindered powers of elucidation, Then one can expound boundless teachings.
If one can expound boundless teachings, Then one can compassionately liberate beings.
If one can compassionately liberate beings, Then one can attain a mind of unshakable compassion.
If one can attain a mind of unshakable compassion, Then one can appreciate the most profound truth.
If one can appreciate the most profound truth, Then one can abandon the errors of fabrication.
If one can abandon the errors of fabrication, Then one can divorce conceit and indulgence.
If one can get rid of conceit and indulgence, Then one can benefit all beings together.

bdag dang gzhan don rtag tu sus brtson pa/ / de dag 'khor bas yongs su skyo ba med/ / gang la 'khor bas yongs su skyo med pa/ / de dag brtson 'grus dam pa mchog dang ldan/ /
brtson 'grus dam pa mchog dang su ldan pa/ / de dag mngon shes rnam dag mngon par skye/ / gang gis mngon shes rnam dag mngon skyes pa/ / de dag spyod pa mchog gi dra bar zhugs/ /
spyod mchog dra bar gang rnams bzhugs gyur pa; ; de dag 'gro ba yongs su smin par mkhas/ / 'gro ba yongs su smin par gang mkhas pa/ / de dag 'gro sdud ye shes tshul la mkhas/ /
'gro sdud ye shes tshul la su mkhas pa/ / de dag bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi la brtson/ / bsdu dngos bzhi la gang rnams brtson gyur pa/ / de dag 'gro ba'i don mang mtha' yas byed/ /
'gro ba'i don mang mtha' yas su byed pa; ; de dag shes rab thabs kyi stobs mchog ldan/ / shes rab thabs kyi stobs mchog su ldan pa/ / dpa' bo de dag bla med lam la gnas/ /

If one can benefit all beings, Then one can be in birth-and-death unwearied.
If one can be in birth-and-death unwearied, Then one can be invincibly brave and strong.
If one can be invincibly brave and strong, Then one can bring forth great spiritual powers.
If one can bring forth great spiritual powers, One will know the activities of all sentient beings.
If one knows the activities of all sentient beings, Then one can mature and perfect living beings.
If one can mature and perfect living beings, One will attain the knowledge to save all beings.
If one attains the knowledge to save all beings, Then one can perfect the means of salvation.
If one can perfect the means of salvation, One then will give beings unlimited benefit.
If one gives beings unlimited benefit, One will fulfill the techniques of supreme knowledge.
If one fulfills the techniques of supreme knowledge, One will remain on the heroic unexcelled path.

bla med lam la dpa' bo gang gnas pa/ / de dag bdud kyi dpung gis thub pa min/ / gang rnams bdud kyi dpung gis thub min pa/ / de dag bdud lam bzhi las yongs su 'das/ /
bdud lam bzhi las yongs su su 'das pa/ / de dag phyir mi ldog gi sar yang phyin/ / mi ldog sar ni gang gis phyin gyur pa/ / de dag mi skye'i bzod pa thob pa yin/ /
mi skye'i bzod pa gang gis thob gyur pa/ / 'jig rten sgron de rgyal bas lung yang bstan/ / 'jig rten sgron ma rgyal bas lung bstan pa/ / de dag rgyal ba kun dang mngon du gnas/ /
rgyal ba kun dang mngon du su gnas pa/ / de dag rgyal ba'i 'phrul pa gsang la mkhas/ / rgyal ba'i 'phrul ba gsang la su mkhas pa/ / de dag rgyal ba kun gyis dgongs pa yin/ /
gang rnams rgyal ba kun gyis dgongs gyur pa/ / de dag sangs rgyas yon tan yongs kyis brgyan/ / sangs rgyas yon tan yongs kyis su brgyan pa/ / de dag bsod nams dam pas lus kyang sbyangs/ /

If one remains on the heroic unexcelled path, One can crush the power of all demons.
If one can crush the power of all demons, One can get beyond the realm of the four demons.
If one can get beyond the realm of the four demons, Then one can reach the stage of nonregression.
If one can reach the stage of nonregression, One attains profound acceptance of the nonorigination of things.
If one attains deep acceptance of the nonorigination of things, One will receive the Buddhas’ prediction of enlightenment.
If one’s enlightenment is foretold by the Buddhas, Then all the Buddhas will appear in one’s presence.
If all the Buddhas appear in one’s presence, One will comprehend the profound, mystic use of spiritual powers.
If one comprehends the deep mystic function of spiritual powers, One will be remembered by all the Buddhas.
If one is remembered by the Buddhas, Then one will adorn oneself with the qualities of buddhahood.
If one adorns oneself with the qualities of buddhahood, One will attain a splendid body of felicity.

bsod nams dam pas gang gi lus sbyangs pa/ / de dag gser gyi ri bo 'dra bar 'bar/ / gser gyi ri bo 'dra bar su 'bar ba/ / de dag mtshan rab sum cu gnyis dang ldan/ /
mtshan rab sum cu gnyis dang su ldan pa/ / de dag dpe byad bzang pos lus kyang bris/ / dpe byad bzang pos gang gi lus bris pa/ / de dag lus 'od kun tu mtha' yas so/ /
gang gi lus 'od kun tu mtha' yas pa/ / de dag 'od zer rgyan kyang bsam mi khyab/ / gang la 'od zer bsam yas rgyan yod pa/ / de dag 'od las pad+mo mang po 'byung / /
gang gi 'od las pad+mo mang 'byung ba/ / de dag rgyal ba pad+mo'i gdan bzhugs pa/ / ston cing phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten kun tu yang / / don yod rnam par spyod cing sems can 'dul/ /

If one attains a splendid body of felicity, One’s body will be radiant as a mountain of gold.
If one’s body is radiant as a mountain of gold, It will be adorned with the thirty-two marks of distinction.
If one is adorned with the thirty-two marks, One will be adorned with accompanying refinements.
If one is adorned with the accompanying refinements, The light of one’s aura will be unlimited.
If one’s aura light is infinite, One will be adorned with inconceivable light.
If one is adorned with inconceivable light, That light will produce lotus blossoms.
If the light produces lotus blossoms, Innumerable Buddhas will sit on the blossoms,
Appearing everywhere in the ten directions, Able to pacify all sentient beings.
gang rnams rgyal pa pad+mo'i gdan bzhugs pa/ / ston cing phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten kun tu yang / / don yod rnams spyod sems can 'dul byed pa/ / de dag mngon shes rnam 'phrul mtha' yang yas/ /

* * *
If able to harmonize beings this way, One manifests infinite mystical powers.

gang gi mngon shes rnam 'phrul mtha' yas pa/ / de dag bsam gyis mi khyab chos ston cing / / sems can bsam gyis mi khyab dgar byed pas/ / bsam gyis mi khyab zhi bo'i rnam par spyod/ /
gang rnams bsam gyis mi khyab zos ston cing / / bsam yas sems can dga' bar su byed pa/ / de dag bsam pa ji bzhin 'jig rten na/ / tha dad yang dag shes mthus sems can 'dul/ /
tha dad yang dag shes pa'i ye shes mthus/ / bsam pa ji bzhin sems can su 'dul ba/ / de dag lus dang ngag yid rtag dus su/ / ye shes sngon du 'gro bar shin tu 'byung / /
gang gi lus dang ngag yid rtag dus su/ / ye shes sngon du 'gro bar rab 'byung ba/ / de dag smon lam stobs kyis ci dga' bar/ / sems can rgyud du gzugs mang yongs su ston/ /
smon lam stobs gyis gang rnams ci dga' bar/ / sems can rgyud du gzugs mang ston byed pa/ / de dag tshig du brjod cing ci smra yang / / sgra la dbyangs kyi yan lag bsam mi khyab/ /

If one manifests infinite mystical powers, One dwells in inconceivable lands, Expounding inconceivable teachings, Gladdening inconceivably many beings.
If one explains inconceivable teachings Gladdening inconceivably many beings, Then with wisdom and power of elucidation One guides in accord with being’s minds.
If one uses wisdom and powers of elucidation To guide in accord with beings’ minds, Then one will never lose Action guided by wisdom.
If one never loses Action guided by wisdom, Then one’s will power will be sovereign, And one will appear physically in any state of being.
If one’s will power attains the freedom To manifest a body in any state of being, Then one will be able, when teaching, To accord with any language, inconceivably.

tshig tu brjod cing ci dang ci smra yang / / gang gi sgra dbyangs yan lag bsam yas pa/ / de dag 'gro ba ma lus thams cad kyi/ / bsam pa'i sems rnams yud kyis rnam par shes/ /
gang gi ma lus 'gro ba thams cad kyi/ / bsam pa'i sems rnams yud kyis rnam shes pa/ / de dag skye dang 'chi 'pho nam yang med/ / nyon mongs rgyu ba'ang de bzhin skye ba med/ /
skye dang 'chi 'pho gang la med gyur cing / / nyon mongs rgyud kyang de bzhin skye med pa/ / de dag yon tan chos nyid ye shes lus/ / chos kyis smos par 'jig rten kun tu spyod/ /
yon tan chos nyid ye shes lus ldan zhing / / chos kyis smos par 'jig rten su spyod pa/ / de dag sa bcu rnams dang dbang bcu yi/ / pha rol phyin mchog rnam par thar la spyod/ /
gang rnams bcu dbang rnams bcu po yi/ / pha rol phyin mchog rnam par thar spyod pa/ / de dag mngon shes rgyan gyis rnam par 'phrul/ / ting 'dzin dam pas rnam par spyod pa thob/ /
mngon par shes pa'i rgyan gyis rnam 'phrul zhing / / ting 'dzin mchog gis rnam spyod sus thob pa/ / de dag phyogs bcu'i rgyal ba thams cad las/ / dbang bskur rgyan rnams thams cad yongs su nod/ /

If one can, when teaching, Adopt any language, according to the congregation, Then one will instantly know all The minds of all sentient beings.
If one can instantly know The minds of all sentient beings, One will know afflictions arise from nowhere And will not sink and drown in birth and death.
If one knows afflictions come from nowhere And will never drown in birth and death, Then one attains the body of the essence of truth And appears in the world by the power of truth.
If one attains the virtuous body of the essence of truth And appears in the world by the power of truth, One will attain all the stages and freedoms of enlightenment, Practice the ways of transcendence and be supremely liberated.
If one attains the stages and freedoms of enlightenment, Practices the transcendent ways and is supremely liberated, One will attain the great spiritual powers of the anointed And abide in the most supreme meditations.
If one attains the great spiritual powers of the anointed And abides in the most supreme meditations, Then in the presence of the Buddhas One will be annointed and ascend to that rank;

gang rnams phyogs bcu'i rgyal ba thams cad las/ / dbang bskur rgyan rnams thams cad mod byed pa/ / de dag spyi bor phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyis/ / phyag mthil bdud rtsis mngon par dbang yang bskur/ /
One will be anointed with the elixir of deathlessness By all the Buddhas in the ten directions.

gang gi spyi bor phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyis/ / phyag mthil bdud rtsis mngon par dbang bskur ba/ / de dag ma lus nam mkha' rgyas byas shing / / phyogs rnams kun tu mthu brtan gnas pa byed/ /
gang rnams nam mkha' ma lus rgyas bkang zhing / / phyogs rnams kun tu mthu brtan gnas byed pa/ / dpe med de dag spyod yul shes par ni/ / 'jig rten lha dang bcas pas mi nus so/ /
dpe med gang gi spyod yul shes bya bar/ / 'jig rten lha dang bcas pas mi nus pa/ / de dag brtson 'grus thams cad don kyang yod/ / mthong dang ming thos spobs pa'ang don yod do/ /
gang rnams brtson 'grus thams cad don yod cing / / mthong dang mi thos spobs pa don yod pa/ / skyes chen de dag sbyin bdag gtong ba yi/ / sbyin pa'i gnas te thams cad don kyang yod/ /

If one is anointed with elixir By the Buddhas of the ten directions, One’s body will be all-pervasive as space, Abiding at rest, immovable, filling the ten directions.
If one’s body is pervasive as space, Abiding at rest, immovable, filling all directions, One’s action will be beyond compare, Unknowable to gods and men.
Enlightening beings practice acts of great compassion, Vowing to liberate all successfully; Those who see, hear, listen, accept, or make offerings, They cause all to attain peace and happiness.
* * *

skyes su dam pa de dag byin mthu yis/ / dam chos tshul ni mi 'jig brten par gnas/ / dge ba'i las lam dam pa mchog rnams kyang / / rin chen 'dra mthus kun na rgyu zhing gnas/ /
rdo rje stug po'i rin chen tshogs yod pas/ / de yi mthu yis rgya mtsho'i rin chen rnams/ / mi zad 'phel zhing 'grib pa gang yang med/ / de bzhin yon tan mtha' yas yon tan mtsho/ /
sangs rgyas mi bzhugs zhing rnams gang yod pa/ / de dag kun tu byang chub sangs rgyas ston/ / phyogs rnams gang na dam chos med gyur pa/ / de dag kun tu'ang chos kyi gter ston to/ /
de dag mi rtog rnam par mi rtog ste/ / lhun gyis grub par phyogs rnams thams cad du/ / zla ba lta bur gzugs brnyan ston byed cing / / thabs mang stong gis sems can 'dul ba byed/ /
de dag skad cig re rer byang chub tu/ / rnam par sangs rgyas phyogs bcu kun tu ston/ / 'khor lo bskor dang mya ngan las 'das zhi dang / / sku gdung rgya chen de bzhin dpa' bo ston/ /
mkhas pa de dag nyan thos rang sangs rgyas/ / sangs rgyas rnam 'phrul rgyan rnams mtha' yas pa/ / yongs su ston cing bskal pa bsam yas su/ / theg pa gsum gyi sgo nas sems can 'dul/ /
khye'u dang bu mo de bzhin bud med lus/ / skyes pa lha dang lha min klu rnams dang / / gnod sbyin grul bum lto 'phye chen po'i gzugs/ / mos pa thams cad tshul mkhas yongs su ston/ /
ting 'dzin rgya mtsho'i rgya yi sgo dag nas/ / 'gro ba'i gzugs mang rgyud ni ji snyed dang / / cha byad spyod pa sgra dbyangs tshul gyi rnams/ / thams cad ma lus dpa' bo ston pa byed/ /
de dag zhing rgyan bsam gyis mi khyab ste/ / phyogs bcu'i rgyal ba thams cad mchod pa byed/ / de dag 'od zer mang po bsam mi khyab/ / sems can 'grel ba'i ye shes mtha' yang yas/ /

Those great beings have magnificent spiritual powers; Their eye of reality is always complete, without any lack; The wonderful practices of virtuous ways and other such paths Are supreme jewels which they cause to appear.
Just like clusters of diamonds in the ocean, By their mystic powers they produce many jewels; Without decrease or increase, and inexhaustible: Such is the mass of enlightening beings’ virtues.
Where there are lands with no Buddha, There they appear to attain enlightenment; Where there are lands where the Teaching’s unknown, They expound there the treasury of sublime doctrines.
Without discrimination, without effort, They reach everywhere in a single instant, Like the moonlight extending everywhere, Teaching beings by innumerable techniques.
In the worlds of the ten directions Constantly they show the way of Buddhahood: Turning the wheel of the true teaching and entering extinction, Down to the distribution of their relics.
Sometimes they show the paths of followers or self-enlightened ones; Sometimes they show the universal adornment of full buddhahood; Thus they open up the teachings of the three vehicles, Widely liberating beings for infinite eons.
They may manifest the forms of dragon girls or boys, Or celestial dragons, or titans too, Down to mahoragas and so on: They let everyone see according to desire.
Living beings’ forms and features are unalike, Their behaviors and sounds are also countless; All of these enlightening beings can make appear By the mystic power of the oceanic reflection meditation.
Beautifully purifying inconceivable lands, Making offerings to all enlightened ones, Emanating great light without bound, They liberate sentient beings without limit too.

tshig gi rnam 'phrul ye shes rnam 'phrul dang / / lus kyi rnam 'phrul bsam gyis mi khyab ste/ / sbyin pa tshul khrims rnam par 'phrul ba dang / / bzod pa brtson 'grus rnam 'phrul bsam mi khyab/ / de dag bsam gtan shes rab rnam 'phrul dang / / thabs dang mngon shes rnam 'phrul bsam mi khyab/ / sangs rgyas tshogs kyi ting 'dzin sgo dag nas/ / yon tan kun gyi rnam 'phrul mtha' yang yas/ /

Their knowledge and wisdom is independent and inconceivable, Their speech in explaining truth is unhindered, Their generosity, self-control, tolerance, energy, and meditation, Wisdom, skill in means, spiritual powers, and such, Are all likewise free, By the power of Buddha’s flower garland meditation.

de dag rdul phran kun la mngon par sgrub byed cing / / rdul phran rtse gcig bsam yas zhing rnams la/ / ston pa byed kyang rdul la 'phel ba med/ / rdul gcig rtse la'ang sangs rgyas bzhugs zhing dang / /
rdul gcig rtse la'ang sangs rgyas bzhugs zhing dang / / sangs rgyas mi bzhugs zhing yang de bzhin ston/ / la la nyon mongs rnam dag dog pa dang / / yangs shing phra dang che ba'i zhing yang ston/ /
zhing rnams la la 'jig cing 'du ba dang / / la la spyi'u tshugs rim gyis gnas par ston/ / la la snel zhi smig rgyu lta bu ste/ / de bzhin gzhan rnams mig 'phrul lta bur ston/ /
de dag rdul gcig rtser ston ji bzhin du/ / ma lus rdul rnams kun la de bzhin te/ / drang srong ting 'dzin rnam 'phrul de 'dra'o/ / mtha' yas grags pa'i rnam thar de 'dra'o/ /
rgyal ba mchod pa'i rnam 'phrul ting nge 'dzin/ / rgyal ba kun la mngon par sgrub byed kyang / / lag pa'i mthil gyis stong gsum rgyas bkang zhing / / skyes bu chen po rnams la mchod pa byed/ /
phyogs bcu kun na me tog phreng ba dang / / spos dang byug pa rin chen rin che ba/ / de dag byang chub shing drung bzhugs pa yi/ / rgyal ba mchod phyir lag pa'i mthil nas 'gyed/ /

They enter concentration on one atom And accomplish concentration on all atoms, And yet that particle doesn’t increase: In one are manifest inconceivable lands.
Of the many lands in that one atom, Some have Buddhas, some do not; Some are polluted, some are pure; Some are large, some are small; Some are forming, some disintegrating; Some are upright, some are sideways; Some are like heat-mirages on a vast plain, Some are like Indra’s net in the heavens.
What in one atom is manifest Is also manifest in all atoms; This is the mystic power of concentration and liberation Of these sages of great renown.
If they want to make offerings to all Buddhas, They enter into concentration and produce mystic transformations, Able to reach throughout the universe with one hand To give offerings to all the enlightened ones.
The most beautiful flowers in all realms, Perfumes, incense, and priceless jewels: Such as these all emerge from their hands To present to the Conquerors under the trees of enlightenment.

na bza' phye ma rin chen ji snyed dang / / rgyal mtshan ba dan gdugs dam sna tshogs dang / / gser gyi rgyan dang rin chen bla re dag / lag mthil de nas char du mngon par 'bebs/ /
phyogs rnams mtha' yas kun gyi yo byad rnams/ / drang srong che la mchod par gang 'os pa/ / de dag lag mthil de nas char du 'bebs/ / byang chub shing drung rgyal ba mchod pa byed/ /
rol mo'i rnam pa phyogs na ji snyed pa/ / rnga chen rnga dang pi wang sgra snyan dang / / rol mo brdung dkrol gling bu sgra rab rnams/ / de dag lag mthil de nas sgra yang sgrog /
phyogs bcu'i dpe med ji snyed bzhugs pa yi/ / bde gshegs yon tan legs pa sna tshogs dang / / bstod pa'i tshigs bcad sgrub pa sna tshogs kyang / / lag mthil de nas sgra rab snyan par 'byung / /
de dag 'od zer las dges yongs bsags pa; ; lag pa g.yas nas yongs su 'gyed byed cing / / rgyal ba'i zhing rnams spos chus ma lus par/ / kun tu btab cing 'jig rten sgron ma mchod/ /
'od zer yid 'ong snang zhing rgyan ldan pa; ; lag pa'i mthil bkye pad+mo bsam mi khyab/ / pad+mo rgyan 'phyang mtshan sdug du ma'i gzugs/ / mang po bkye zhing rgyal ba mchod pa byed/ /
'od zer me tog rgyan rnams rab bkye zhing / / me tog rgyan dang me tog bla re dang / / me tog sna tshogs kun tu yongs bkang zhing / / bdag nyid che ba de dag rgyal ba mchod/ /
'od zer spos kyi rgyan rnams rab bkye zhing / / spos kyi rgyan dang spos kyi bla re dang / / sna tshogs spos kyis kun tu yongs bkang zhing / / bdag nyid che ba de dag rgyal ba mchod/ /
'od zer phye ma'i rgyan rnams rab bkye zhing / / phye ma'i rgyan dang phye ma'i bla re dang / / phye ma sna tshogs kun tu yongs su bkang zhing / / bdag nyid che ba de dag rgyal ba mchod/ /
'od zer na bza'i rgyan rnams rab bkye zhing / / na bza'i rgyan dang na bza'i bla re dang / / na bza' sna tshogs kun tu yongs bkang zhing / / bdag nyid che ba de dag rgyal ba mchod/ /
'od zer rin chen rgyan rnams rab bkye zhing / / rin chen rgyan dang rin chen bla re dang / / rin chen sna tshogs kun tu yongs bkang zhing / / bdag nyid che ba de dag rgyal ba mchod/ /

Priceless jewel raiment, with mixed perfumes, Precious banners and canopies, all finely adorned, With flowers of gold and curtains of jewels: All of these rain from their palms.
Whatever wonderful things there be in all realms That may be worthy to offer to the Supreme Honored One, All shower from their palms, all complete, And they bring it to the enlightenment trees to offer to the Buddhas.
All the artful music of the ten directions: Bells and drums, harps and lyres, various different kinds, All played harmoniously, with beautiful tones, All emerges from the enlightening beings’ palms.
All eulogies that be in the ten directions, Praising the virtues of the enlightened ones, All of their various wonderful words Are intoned from within their palms.
The enlightened beings’ right hands radiate pure light: Within the light is fragrant water raining from the sky, Sprinkling the buddha-lands of the ten directions, As offerings to all the Lamps that Light the Worlds.
Also they emit wondrous arrays of light beams Producing countless jewel lotus blossoms; The colors and forms of the flowers are all superb, And these they present to the Buddhas.
They also emit flower garlands of light With all kinds of flowers bunched into drapes, Scattered all over the lands everywhere As presents to all the Honored Ones of great virtue.
They also emit lights adorned with perfumes, Various wonderful scents massed into drapes, Scattered all throughout the lands everywhere As presents to the Honored Ones of great virtue.
They also emit lights adorned with powdered incense, Various incenses collected into drapes, And distribute them throughout all worlds As gifts to the Honored Ones of great virtue.
They also emanate lights adorned with raiment, Various fine robes gathered into drapes, And distribute them throughout all worlds As offerings to the Honored Ones of great virtue.
They also emit lights adorned with jewels, Various beautiful jewels massed into drapes, And distribute them throughout all worlds As presents to the Honored Ones.

'od zer pad+mo'i rgyan rnams rab bkye zhing / / pad+mo'i rgyan dang pad+mo'i bla re dang / / pad+mo sna tshogs kun tu yongs bkang zhing / / bdag nyid che ba de dag rgyal ba mchod/ /
'od zer phreng ba'i rgyan rnams rab bkye zhing / / phreng ba'i rgyan dang phreng ba'i bla re dang / / phreng ba sna tshogs kun tu yongs bkang zhing / / bdag nyid che ba de dag rgyal ba mchod/ /
'od zer rgyal mtshan mchog rgyan rab bkye zhing / / de dag rgyan mtshan dkar dmar ser po dang / / sngo dang sna tshogs rnam mang rgyan can gyis/ / rgyal ba'i zhing rnams kun nas brgyan pa byed/ /
de dag de gshegs dbu la gdugs kyi mchog / rin chen dra ba sna tshogs rgyan ldan pa/ / dar gyi lda ldi ba dan yongs dpyangs shing / / dril phreng rgyal ba'i gsung sgrog 'dzin pa byed/ /
lag pa'i mthil nas bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i/ / mchod pa rgyal ba gcig la byed pa ltar/ / ma lus rgyal ba rnams la'ang de bzhin te/ / drang srong ting 'dzin rnam 'phrul de 'dra'o/ /
de dag 'gro ba yongs sdud ye shes kyis/ / rnam par 'phrul ba'i ting 'dzin mngon bsgrubs shing / / bya ba'i tshul dang yon tan thams cad du/ / thams mang stong gis sems can 'dul ba byed/ /

They also produce lights adorned with lotuses, Various lotuses assembled into drapes, And distribute them throughout all worlds As gifts to the Honored Ones.
They also emit lights necklace adorned; Various fine necklaces gathered into drapes They distribute throughout all worlds To offer to the Honored Ones.
They also emanate lights adorned with pennants Radiant with multicolored patterns, Of all kinds, innumerable, all superbly fine: With these they decorate the buddha-lands.
Canopies adorned with melanges of jewels, Draped with finely embroidered flags, And crystal chimes intoning Buddhas’ voices: These they take to offer the enlightened ones.
Their hands producing such inconceivable gifts, They present them to a Guide, And do the same to all the Buddhas, With their great psychic powers of concentration.
Enlightening beings dwell in concentration, Dealing with beings by various abilities, All of them guiding by innumerable means, By the virtuous principles they practice.

la la de bzhin gshegs pa mchod sgo dang / / sbyin pa bsam gyis mi khyab gtong ba'i sgo/ / sbyangs pa'i yon tan kun gyi tshul khrims sgo/ / bzod pa mi zad mi sgul sgo dag dang / /
la la brtul zhugs dka' thub brtson 'grus sgo/ / bsam gtan rab tu zhi gnas sgo dag dang / / don dam rnam par 'byed pa'i shes rab sgo/ / tshul rnams kun ldan thabs kyi sgo dag dang / /
tshangs pa'i spyod pa dag dang mngon shes sgo/ / bsdu ba'i dngos pos phan tshol sgo dag dang / / bsod nams yongs su bsags dang ye shes sgo/ / bden pa rten pa'i rnam thar sgo dag dang / /
la la stobs dang dbang po lam gyi sgo/ / nyan thos theg pa rnam grol sgo dag dang / / rang rgyal theg pa rnam par dag pa'i sgo/ / theg pa dam pa rnam 'phrul sgo dag dang / /
la la mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal sgo/ / la la bdag med srog med sgo dag dang / / mi sdug 'du shes 'dod chags 'bral ba'i sgo/ / la la zhi 'gog ting 'dzin sgo dag tu/ /
'gro ba'i spyod sgo ji snyed yod rgyu ba/ / de snyed chos kyi sgo la rab tu zhugs te/ / de dag kun gyi chos nyid sgo dag nas/ / bsam pa ji bzhin 'jig rten sems can 'dul; ;
gang rnams kun gyi sgo yi sgo dag nas/ / bsam pa ji bzhin sems can 'dul byed pa/ / de dag mtshan ma gzung bar mi nus te/ / ting 'dzin rnam 'phrul tshul ni de 'dra'o/ /
de dag dga' ba'i rgyan gyi ting 'dzin mchog / 'gro ba thams cad yongs smin byed mthun pa/ / dga' ba de spro ba rab dga' kun ldan pas/ / bsam gyis mi khyab yongs ston sems can 'dul/ /

Some use the approach of offerings to Buddhas, Some use the approach of inconceivable generosity, Some use the approach of austerity and discipline, Some use the approach of unshakable tolerance, Some use the approach of ascetic effort, Some use the approach of tranquil meditation, Some use the approach of certain, thorough knowledge, Some use the teaching of practical expedients, Some use the teachings of the pure abodes and psychic powers, Some use the approach of the benefits of the means of salvation, Some use the approach of the adornments of knowledge and virtue, Some use the teaching of conditioning and liberation, Some use the teachings of faculties, powers, and the right path, Some use the teaching of followers’ liberation, Some use the teaching of purity of self-awakened ones, Some use the teaching of the freedom of the Great Vehicle, Some use the teaching of the miseries of impermanence, Some use the teaching of no self and no life, Some use the teaching of impurity and detachment from desire, Some use the approach of extinctive concentration.
According to the differences in beings’ ailments They all use teaching-medicines to cure them. According to the inclinations of beings’ minds They all use expedients to satisfy them.
According to the differences in sentient beings’ behaviors They all use adaptive skills to perfect them. The characteristics of such spiritual powers of concentration Cannot be fathomed by any gods or men.
Having a wondrous concentration called according to actions, Enlightening beings abide in this and observe everywhere, Appearing as appropriate to liberate sentient beings, Causing them to gladly change according to the truth.

gang tshe lo nyes thams cad dkon gyur pa/ / de tshe 'jig rten bde ba'i yo byad rnams/ / thams cad bsam pa rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir/ / sbyin pa yongs su gtong zhing 'gro don byed; ;
de dag zas mchog skom dang ro mchog dang / / gos dang dgab pa rin chen sna tshogs dang / / rgyal srid nor dang bdag sdug yongs btang bas/ / sbyin la mos pa'i 'gro ba 'dul ba byed; ;
de dag mtshan rab kun gyis lus brgyan cing / / gos dang rgyan mchog yongs su bgos btags te/ / phreng bas rnam brgyan spos kyis bskus byas pa'i/ / gzugs rnams yongs su bstan pas sems can 'dul/ /
mthong bas dga' bde rab tu mos pa la/ / de dag gzugs mchog gzugs bzang cha byad mdzes/ / gzugs kyi dam pa yongs su ston byed cing / / gzugs la mos pa'i sems can 'dul ba byed/ /
de dag ka la ping+ka'i sgra snyan dang / / ko kil kun la ngang pa'i sgra dbyangs dang / / rnga dang tshangs pa mi 'am ci yi sgras/ / mos pa thams cad tshul bzhin chos kyang ston/ /
de dag stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi po/ / gang gis rgyal ba 'gro ba'i don mdzad pa'i/ / chos kyi bye brag sgo mo de dag gis/ / bsam pa ji bzhin 'jig rten sems can 'dul/ /
de dag bde dang sdug bsngal grogs kyang byang / / don dang don med grogs kyang de bzhin te/ / sems can dgos la grogs su 'gyur byas shing / / grogs kyi sgo nas sems can rnam par 'dul/ /

Where there is famine and disaster in the age, They give means of comfort to all in the world, Causing them to be satisfied according to their desires, Creating benefit for all sentient beings. They may give away fine food and drink, Sumptuous clothing, garlands of jewels, And even a royal throne, To cause those who like generosity to accord with the teaching.
Adorned with flower garlands, anointed with perfume, With dignified behavior, they liberate beings, Liked and esteemed by all in the world. Their appearance and their garb They adopt as is appropriate to please And cause those who like form to follow the Path.
With exquisite voices like songs of birds, Wondrous tones in harmony, Complete with all kinds of pure voice, They preach to beings according to their likes.
Eighty-four thousand gates of teaching Do the Buddhas use to liberate beings: And according to the different teachings They use what’s appropriate to liberate.
Sentient beings’ pains and pleasures, gains and losses, etc., Whatever things are done by beings of the world, Enlightening beings can appear to do the same things, Whereby to liberate all living beings.

sdug bsngal rgya mtsho 'dus byas skyon gyi rnams/ / grogs kyi don du de dag bzod par byed/ / 'gro ba kun la phan don bde don du/ / de dag grogs don mi bde nyams su len/ /
gang na 'byung ba med cing chos med de/ / dgon pa'i yon tan thar pa mi dmigs pa/ / de dag kun tu rgyal srid che spangs shing / / zhi ba'i yid kyis gnas med mngon par 'byung / /
de dag khyim gyi btson ra srid gnas pa'i/ / 'gro ba thams cad yongs su dgrol ba'i rgyur/ / 'dod pa'i dga' ba kun la mi gnas par/ / mngon par byung zhing thar pa yongs su brjod/ /
de dag spyod pa bcu rnams spyod byed cing / / skyes chen rnams kyi chos la de dag spyod/ / drang srong spyod pa thams cad ma lus par/ / yongs su sgom zhing 'gro ba'i don kyang byed/ /
gang na sems can tshad med tshe ldan pa/ / bde ba phun ldan nyon mongs chung yod pa/ / de dag kun tu nad gzer na bu can/ / bdag la dbang med tsam gyi dbang sgyur ston/ /
'dod chags 'bar zhing zhe sdang 'bar gyur te/ / gti mug rgyu las 'jig rten mer 'bar zhing / / rga shi nad kyis rab tu 'bar gyur pa'i/ / 'jig rten bstan cing sems can 'dul ba byed; ;

The suffering of all worldly beings Is deep and wide and boundless like the sea; Enlightening beings, sharing their tasks, can tolerate it all, To cause them to benefit and gain peace and happiness.
If any do not know the way to emancipation And do not seek liberation, to leave turmoil behind, Enlightening beings show them relinquishment of nation and wealth, Satisfaction in detachment and peace of mind.
If the home is a place of bondage by attachments, In order to cause sentient beings to all escape trouble They show home-leaving and attainment of liberation, Without craving for any pleasures.
Enlightening beings manifest the practice of ten kinds of action And also practice the ways of great people, Including the practices of seers and sages, Because they want to benefit sentient beings.
If there are beings whose life span is immeasurable, Whose afflictions are slight and pleasures complete, Enlightening beings, being free in their midst, Show the suffering of the ills of age, sickness, and death.
In the cases of those with greed, hatred, and ignorance, The raging fires of these afflictions always blazing, Enlightening beings manifest aging, sickness, and death for them, To cause those sentient beings to all be tamed.

The Buddhas’ ten powers and fearlessness, As well as their eighteen unique qualities, All their countless virtues, Are manifested to liberate beings.
Knowledge of others’ minds, appropriate teaching, and ability to appear anywhere Are all free functions of the enlightened ones; The great enlightening beings manifest them all, Able to cause sentient beings to all be tamed.
Enlightening beings’ various methods and techniques Adapt to worldly conditions to liberate beings: Just like lotus blossoms, to which water does not adhere, In the same way they are in the world, provoking deep faith.
With extraordinary thoughts and profound talent, as cultural kings, Song and dance, and conversation admired by the masses, All the various arts and crafts of the world They manifest, like magicians.
Some become grandees, city chiefs, Some become merchants, caravan leaders; Some become physicians and scientists, Some become kings and ministers.
Some become great trees in the plains, Some become medicines or jewel mines; Some become pearls that fulfill all wishes, Some show the right path to sentient beings.
If they see a world just come into being, Where the creatures don’t yet have the tools for livelihood, Enlightening beings become craftsmen And teach them various skills.
They do not make anything that will oppress or afflict living beings: They only explain things that will be of benefit to the world; Various fields of knowledge, such as incantational arts and medicinal herbs, And all contained therein they can explain.
The excellent practices of all the sages Faithfully looked up to by humans and divines, Such difficult practices and austerities Enlightening beings can perform according to need.
Some become non-Buddhist mendicants, Some practice asceticism alone in the forest; Some go naked, without any clothes, Being teachers and leaders of such groups.

de dag yongs 'tsho chos la spyod pa dang / / bla na yod dang bla na med pa'i rnams/ / ral pa ring dang byis pa'i brtul zhugs can/ / de dag tu yang de dag mkhan por 'gyur/ /
nyi ma'i rjes spyad dka' thub lnga ldan dang / / khyi dang ba lang brtul zhugs ri spyod/ / gle'u can mu stegs bcu gsum spyod pa'i rnams/ / de dag kun na'ang de dag slob dpon 'gyur/ /
lha rnams ye shes tshul la dga' ba dang / / mu stegs khrus byed yul du rgyu ba dang / / rtsa ba 'bras bu chu la spyod pa'i rnams/ / chos sems nang na de dag dam par 'gyur; ;
gnas btegs gnas dang gcig tu spyod pa dang / / tsher ma dang thal ba'i mal can dang / / dbyig pa'i mal can gcig pu spyod pa'i rnams/ / de dag kun tu'ang de dag slob dpon 'gyur/ /
phyi rol mu stegs can rnams ji snyed pa/ / de dag bsam pa mos pa rtogs byas nas/ / sgrub dka' mi bzad drag shul dka' thub kyi/ / mu stegs can gyi sdug bsngal spangs pas 'dul/ /
'jig rten lta bas 'khrugs pa shes byas nas/ / lta ba ngan la zhen pa'i mu stegs can/ / kun la phra ba'i tshig dang thabs tshul gyis/ / bden pa ston pa de dag kun tu byed/ /

Some show various practices of wrong livelihood, Practicing incorrect principles as supreme; Some manifest the postures of brahmin ascetics, Becoming leaders of such groups.
Some expose themselves to the heat of fire and sun, Some practice cults imitating animals, Some put on filthy clothing and worship fire: In order to transform such cultists, they become their teachers.
Some make a show of visiting shrines of various deities, Some make a show of entering the water of the Ganges River, Some eat roots and fruits, all making a show of these practices, While always contemplating the truth that transcends them.
Some show themselves kneeling or standing on one foot, Some lie on thorns or in dust and dirt; Some lie on pounding stones, seeking release, And become teachers and leaders of such groups.
Of such followers of heretical paths They observe the minds and understandings, and do the same things; The ascetic practices they demonstrate, worldlings cannot bear: They cause them to be tamed after seeing them.
Sentient beings are deluded and accept false teachings; Sticking to wrong views, they suffer many pains: For them are expediently taught wonderful principles To cause them to understand the genuine truth.

la lar dra byi la yi sngags tshig tu/ / shin tu gsang ba'i tshig gis bden pa ston/ / la la dag la gsal zhing drang tshig gis/ / la la dag la lha yi gsang tshig gis; ;
la la dag la yi ge dbye tshig dang / / don nges rtogs pa rdo rje'i tshig rnams dang / / rgol ba 'dul ba'i ye shes tshig rnams dang / / brtan pa thub med thar pa'i tshig rnams kyis/ /
la la dag la mi skad tshig rnams dang / / kun la 'jug pa'i tshig nges tshig rnams dang / / la la dag la lha'i tshig nges tshig dang / / klu yi tshig nges gnod sbyin tshig rnams kyis/ /
la la dag la srin po 'byung po dang / / dri za grul bum lto 'phye chen po'i tshig / mi ci lha min nam mkha' lding tshig gis/ / bden pa bstan cing thar par 'dren par byed/ /
de dag bden pa'i nges tshig tshul shes bzhin/ / de ltar rgyal ba'i chos rnams ma lus pa'i/ / chos nyid bsam yas tshig lam shes pas ston/ / de dag ting 'dzin rnam 'phrul de 'dra 'o/ /

The four truths may be explained in local magical language, Or the four truths may be told in skillful esoteric language, Or the four truths may be spoken in direct human speech, Or the four truths may be told in the language of divine mystery; The four truths are explained through analysis of words, The four truths are explained through ascertainment of principles, The four truths are explained skillfully refuting others, The four truths are explained undisturbed by outsiders; The four truths may be explained in several languages, Or they may be explained in all languages. In whatever languages beings understand The four truths are explained for them, to liberate them. All the teachings of all Buddhas Are thus explained exhaustively, Knowing the realm of language is inconceivable: This is called the power of concentration of expounding the truth.

de dag 'gro bde mchog gi ting nge 'dzin/ / 'gro ba kun la mngon par sgrub byed cing / / 'od zer bsam gyis mi khyab rab bkye ste/ / 'od zer bkye nas sems can de dag 'dul/ /
'od zer mthong na legs pa rab bkye zhing / / sems can ji snyed 'od zer de shes pa/ / de dag mthong legs don med ma yin te/ / bla na med pa'i ye shes mchog gi rgyu/ /
sangs rgyas bstan te chos rnams yongs bstan nas/ / dge 'dun bstan nas mi rnams lam bstan te/ / rgyal ba'i sku gzugs mchod rten bstan pas na/ / des ni mthong na legs pa'i 'od zer grub/ /

There is a supreme concentration called peace and bliss Which can universally save and liberate all sentient beings, Radiating a great light, inconceivable, Causing those who see it to all be pacified. This light emanated is called “good manifestation”— If any sentient beings encounter this light, It will cause them to benefit, without fail: By this way they can attain unsurpassed knowledge; It first shows the Buddhas, Shows the Teaching, shows the Community, shows the Right Path, And also shows the Buddhas’ tombs and images— By this the light is formed.

lha yi 'od zer zil gyis gnon pa yi/ / 'od zer 'od byed rab tu bkye byas shing / / mun pa kun dang rdul rnams kun bsal te/ / 'jig rten phan pa'i 'od de rab tu snang / /
'od des sems can ji snyed yongs bskul ba/ / de dag rgyal ba mchod phyir me mar 'dzin/ / rgyal ba mchod phyir me mar bzung byas pas/ / 'jig rten sgron ma mdzad pa'i rgyal bar 'gyur/ /
'bru mar me mar mar gyi me mar dang / / shing dang dang smig ma spa yi sgron/ / spos dang ro mchog rin chen sgron ma dag / rgyal ba rnams gsol 'od byed de thob bo/ /

It also emits a light called “shining” Which outshines the lights of all the gods, Removing all barriers of darkness, Benefiting all living beings. This light awakens all sentient beings, Inducing them to offer lamps to the Buddhas; Because they present lamps to the Buddhas, They can become supreme lamps in the world. Burning oil lamps and butter lamps, As well as various bright torches, And lamps of finest jewels with fragrant herbs, And presenting them to the Buddhas, they attain this light.

'od zer sgrol zhes bya ba rab bkye zhing / / sems can ji snyed 'od zer nges bskul ba/ / de dag sred pa rnam yangs srid pa'i mtshor/ / sems can bsgral don go cha brtan pa gyon/ /
gang rnams sred pa rnam yangs srid pa'i mtshor/ / sems can bsgral phyir go cha brtan gyon pa/ / de dag chu bo bzhi las sgrol bar byed/ / mya ngan med pa bde ba'i grong yang ston/ /
stegs dang zam pa gcig min byas pa dang / / chu klung lam la sgrol ba'i gru byin te/ / 'dus byas sun phyung zhi ba bsngags pas na/ / des ni sgrol ba'i 'od zer de grub bo/ /

It also emits a light called “salvation”: This light can awaken all beings And cause them to develop great determination To liberate the living from the sea of desire.
