If one can universally produce this determination To liberate the living from the sea of desire, Then one can cross over the torrents of afflictions And lead the way to the sorrowless citadel of freedom. By building bridges and rafts Wherever there is water on the roads, Criticizing fabrication and praising dispassionate calm, Thereby is this light attained.

'od zer skom pa sel ba rab bkye zhing / / sems can ji snyed 'od zer des bskul ba/ / 'dod pa'i yon tan sgom pa rab spangs shing / / chos kyi rnam grol ro la don du gnyer/ /
'dod pa'i yon tan skom pa rab spangs te/ / chos kyis grol ba'i ro la don gnyer bas/ / sangs rgyas bdud rtsi char pa 'bebs par 'gyur/ / 'jig rten sred pa'i skom pa rnam par sel/ /
rdzing dang chu klung khron pa lo ma dang / / mtsho rnams byang chub don du byed btsud de/ / 'dod pa rnam smad bsam gtan bsngags pas na/ / skom pa rnam sel de ni des sgrub pa/ /

It also emanates a light called “annihilating attachment”: This light can awaken all beings, Causing them to give up objects of desire And concentrate on the savor of the sublime teaching of liberation. If one can give up objects of desire And concentrate on the subtle true savor of liberation, One can, with the Buddha’s rain of sweet dew, Extinguish all the cravings in the world. By charitably giving ponds, wells, and springs, Only seeking the unsurpassed way of enlightenment, Criticizing desires and praising meditation, It is possible to produce this light.

'od zer dga' bar byed pa rab bkye zhing / / sems can ji snyed 'od zer des bskul ba/ / dga' bas rgyas shing byang chub mchog don du/ / rang byung 'gyur bar bya zhes sems bskyed do/ /
thugs rje mnga' rnams sku gzugs mtshan brgyan pa/ / pad+mo'i gdan la bzhugs pa byas bsgrubs shing / / rtag tu sangs rgyas yon tan brjod pas na/ / dga' ba byed pa'i 'od ni des sgrub bo/ /

It also radiates a light called “joy”: This light can awaken all beings, Causing them to long for perfect enlightenment And determine to realize the teacherless path. Making statues of the Buddha of Great Compassion, Adorned with all distinguishing marks, sitting on a flower, And by always praising Buddha’s supreme virtues Can this light thereby be produced.

'od zer mos par byed pa rab bkye zhing / / sems can ji snyed 'od zer des bskul ba/ / de dag thams cad sangs rgyas mos pas dga'/ / chos la mos dga' dge 'dun mos pas dga'/ /
de dag rtag tu sangs rgyas mos dga' ste/ / chos la mos dga' dag 'dun mos dga' bas/ / sangs rgyas chos dang de bzhin dge 'dun dang / / rtag tu 'grogs 'thob bzod pa bla med 'thob/ /
sangs rgyas rjes dran chos dang tshogs mchog la/ / sems can mang po bskul cing dran byas te/ / byang chub sems kyi yon tan bstan pas na/ / des ni 'od zer mos par byed pa grub/ /

It also emits a light called “appreciation”: This light can awaken all beings, Causing their minds to appreciate the Buddhas As well as their Teaching and Community. If they always appreciate the Buddhas, Their teachings and communities, Then in the congregations of the Buddhas They’ll attain acceptance of the profound truth of the emptiness of things. Enlightening sentient beings without number, Making them always remember the Buddha, Teaching, and Community, Is whereby this light is attained.

'od zer bsod nams bsags pa rab bkye zhing / / sems can ji snyed 'od zer des bskul ba/ / bla na med pa'i byang chub don gnyer cing / / sbyin pa sna tshogs du ma yongs su gtong / /
de dag mchod sbyin lhug pa byed pa'i tshe/ / slong mo ba yi bsam pa rdzogs byas te/ / bsam pa kun tshul sbyin pa byin pas na/ / des na 'od zer bsod nams bsags grub bo/ /

It also emanates a light called “collection of virtues”: This light can awaken all beings, Inducing them to practice unlimited giving in various forms, Aspiring thereby to the unexcelled Path. Establishing great charitable functions without imposing limits, Satisfying the needs of all who come, Not letting their hearts feel any lack, Is whereby this light is made.

'od zer ye shes ldan pa rab bkye zhing / / sems can ji snyed 'od zer des bskul ba/ / chos gcig sgo nas chos gcig min pa yi/ / chos kyi sgo rnams yud kyis rjes dran nas/ /
chos kyi bye brag sems can 'dzin btsud de/ / nges rtogs don gyi ye shes rnam phye zhing / / chos kyi tshig don brjod pa byas pas na/ / des ni ye shes ldan pa'i 'od zer grub/ /

It also emits a light called “full knowledge”: This light can awaken all beings, Causing them to instantly, in one principle, Understand innumerable teachings. Analyzing teachings for sentient beings And determining the real true meaning, Skillfully expounding the meanings of the teachings, without lack, Is how this light is made.

'od zer shes rab sgron ma rab bkye zhing / / sems can ji snyed 'od zer des bskul ba/ / stong pa bdag med ma skyes ma byung ba'i/ / rang bzhin med pa'i chos la rab tu 'jug /
bdag po med chos stong pa byed med pa; ; sprin dang smig rgyu chu zla 'dra ba'i dngos/ / rmi lam lta bu gzugs brnyan rang bzhin rnams/ / bstan pas shes rab sgron ma de grub bo/ /

It also radiates a light called “lamp of wisdom”: This light can awaken all beings And cause them to know sentient beings are inherently empty and at rest, And that all things have no existence. Explaining that all things are empty, with no controller, no self, Like illusions, like flames, like the moon reflected in the water, And also like dreams or reflected images, Is how this light is made.

'od zer chos kyis rnam 'phrul rab bkye zhing / / sems can ji snyed 'od zer des bskul ba/ / mi zad gzungs kyi mdzod rnams rab thob cing / / de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi mdzod kyang 'dzin/ /
chos 'chad rnams la yongs su phan btags te/ / drang srong rnams la chos kyis bsrungs byas shing / / 'gro pa kun la chos bzhin phan btags pas/ / 'od zer chos kyis rnam 'phrul de grub bo/ /

It also emits a light called “mastery of the teachings”: This light can awaken all beings And cause them to attain inexhaustible mnemonic command To retain all the teachings of the Buddhas. Honoring and supporting the holders of the teachings, Serving and protecting the sages and saints, Handing on various teachings to beings, Is how this light is produced.

'od zer gtong dang ldan pa rab bkye zhing / / sems can 'jungs pa ji snyed des bskul ba/ / skyed pa mi brtan mi rtag shes gyur nas/ / de dag rtag tu sbyin mos dga' bar 'gyur/ /
'jungs pa gdul dka'i sems can ma dul dang / / nor rnams rmi lam sprin tshul shes gyur nas/ / dga' ba'i yid kyis sbyin pa rnam spel bas/ / gtong dang ldan pa'i 'od zer des grub bo/ /

It also emanates a light called “able to relinquish”: This light can awaken miserly people, Making them realize all wealth is impermanent, And enjoy giving, without attachment. Able to subdue stubborn stinginess, Understanding wealth is like dreams or floating clouds, Causing the pure mind of generosity to grow, Is how this light is attained.

'od zer yongs su gdung med rab bkye zhing / / tshul ngan sems can ji snyed des bskul ba/ / tshul khrims rnam dag rab tu gnas gyur te/ / rang byung 'gyur bar bya zhes sems skyed do/ /
dge ba'i las lam yongs su dag pa dang / / tshul khrims bzang la sems can mang bskul cing / / byang chub sems la yang dag bskul byas pas/ / yongs su gdung med 'od zer des grub bo/ /

It also radiates a light called “removing heat”: This light can awaken the immoral And cause them to maintain pure precepts And determine to realize the teacherless path. Inducing sentient beings to accept moral precepts And to purify the practice of virtuous actions And causing them to be inspired to seek enlightenment Is how this light is made.

bzod pas rnam brgyan 'od zer rab bkye zhing / / mi bzod sems can ji snyed des bskul ba/ / khro ba'i tha ba nga rgyal yongs spangs shing / / de dag bzod mos rtag tu dga' bar 'gyur/ /
sdig sems ldan la nyes pa bzod byas te/ / byang chub don du 'khrug pa ma byas shing / / bzod pa'i yon tan rtag tu brjod byas pas/ / des ni bzod pas rnam brgyan de grub bo; ;

It also emits a light called “adornment of tolerance”: This light can awaken bad-tempered beings, Causing them to get rid of anger and divorce conceit, And gladly be tolerant and harmonious. When the violence of beings is hard to endure, To be unmoved in mind, for the sake of enlightenment, Always happily extolling the virtues of tolerance, Is how this light’s produced.

'od zer brtson dang ldan pa rab bkye zhing / / le lo'i sems can ji snyed des bskul ba/ / rigs par brtson zhing dkon mchog gsum rnams la/ / sbyor ba skyo med mchod pa 'byed par 'gyur/ /
rigs par brtson pas dkon mchog gsum rnams la/ / sbyor ba skyo ba med pas mchod byas nas/ / de dag bdud bzhi'i lam las yongs 'das te/ / myur du byang chub bla med rab tu thob/ /
sems can mang po brtson 'grus bskul byas te/ / dkon mchog gsum la mchod pa rab byas nas/ / tha ma'i dus su dam chos yongs bzung bas/ / des ni brtson ldan 'od zer de grub bo/ /

It also radiates a light called “intrepitude”: This light can awaken the lazy, Causing them always to respect and support The Buddha, Teaching, and Community, without weariness. If they always support and respect The Buddha, the Teaching, and the Community, They can get beyond the realms of the four demons And quickly attain unsurpassed enlightenment. Exhorting sentient beings to progress, Always diligently supporting the Buddha, Teaching, and Community, Wholeheartedly guarding the Teaching when it’s about to perish, Is how this light can be made.

'od zer zhi bar byed pa rab bkye zhing / / rnam 'khrugs sems can ji snyed des bskul ba/ / de dag 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug rnams/ / nyams su mi gnod mnyam gzhag sems su 'gyur/ /
sdig to'i grogs po nyes ldan spyod can dang / / 'du 'dzi yongs su rnam par spangs byas te/ / bsam gtan zhi ba'i dgon pa rang bsngags pas/ / des ni zhi byed 'od zer de grub bo/ /

It also emanates a light called “tranquility”: This light can awaken the scatter-minded, Causing them to detach from greed, anger, and folly, With their minds unstirring and properly stabilized. Abandoning all bad associates, Meaningless talk and impure action, Praising meditation and solitude: Thus is this light produced.

'od zer shes rab rnam brgyan rab bkye zhing / / shes rab 'chal ba ji snyed des bskul ba/ / bden dang brtan dang rnam thar tshul rnams dang / / dbang po'i rgyus la rtogs par shes gyur cing / /
nyi ma sgron ma'i ting 'dzin thob gyur nas/ / shes rab 'od gsal mdzad pa'i rgyal bar 'gyur/ / rgyal srid nor dang bdag phangs yongs btang ste/ / byang chub don du chos rnams gang btsal ba/ /
de dag rim gror rab tu brjod byas pas/ / shes rab rnam brgyan 'od zer des grub bo/ /

It also radiates a light called “adornment of wisdom”: This light can awaken the ignorant and deluded, Causing them to realize the truth and understand conditional origination, Their faculties, knowledge, and wisdom penetrating thoroughly. If they can realize the truth and understand conditioned origination, Their faculties, knowledge, and wisdom penetrating, They’ll attain the state of “sun-lamp” mental focus With the light of wisdom and perfect the fruit of buddhahood. Being able to give away country and wealth For the sake of enlightenment, seeking the right teaching, Then, having heard it, single-mindedly applying it and explaining to others, Is how this light may be made.

'od zer sangs rgyas ldan pa rab bkye zhing / / sems can ji snyed 'od zer des bskul ba/ /
sangs rgyas bsam gyis mi khyab shin tu mang / / pad+mo mchog la bzhugs par rab tu mthong / / sangs rgyas bdag nyid che dang rnam thar dang / / sangs rgyas rnam 'phrul mtha' yas yongs bstan te/ /
sangs rgyas stobs dang rdzu 'phrul brjod byas pas/ / sangs rgyas ldan pa'i 'od zer des grub bo/ /

It also emits a light called “buddha-wisdom”: This light can awaken all conscious creatures, Causing them to see innumerable, boundless Buddhas, Each sitting on jewel lotus flowers. Praising the Buddhas’ powers and liberation, Telling of the Buddhas’ freedom without bound, Manifesting Buddhas’ powers and mystic abilities, Is how this light may be produced.

It also emanates a light called “fearlessness”: This light shines on those in fear And causes the speedy annihilation Of all inhuman harmful things. Being able to give beings freedom from fear, Exhorting the ceasing of all affliction and injury encountered, Rescuing those in danger, the orphaned and the helpless, Is how this light can be made.

'od zer thams cad bde ba rab bkye zhing / / nad pa na ba ji snyed des reg pa/ /
thams cad nad kyi sdug bsngal rnam par 'grol/ / bsam gtan ting 'dzin bde ba rnams kyang thob/ / nad gsos 'bras bu sman dang rtsa ba dang / / rin chen ro mchog spos dang byug pa dang / /
bu ram sbrang rtsi 'o ma mar dag dang / / 'bru mar zas skom byin pas de grub bo/ /

It also radiates a light called “peace”: This light can illumine those who are ill And cause all pains to be relieved So all can gain the bliss of right concentration. Dispensing medicine to cure afflictions, Anointing with precious life-prolonging perfume, Giving butter, oil, honey, and milk for nourishment, Is how this light can be made.

'od zer sangs rgyas ston pa rab bkye zhing / / tshe zad mthar ni ji snyed des bskul ba/ /
sangs rgyas rjes dran sangs rgyas mthong bar 'gyur/ / de dag shi 'phos sangs rgyas bzhugs zhing 'gro / 'chi ba'i dus su sangs rgyas dran byas te/ / dgar 'gyur rgyal ba'i sku gzugs bstan byas shing / /
'chi khar sangs rgyas skyabs su btang byas pas/ / sangs rgyas ston pa'i 'od zer des thob bo/ /

It also emits a light called “seeing Buddha”: This light can awaken those about to die, Causing them to see any Buddha they think of, So when their life ends they can be born in that Buddha’s pure land. To exhort the dying to remembrance of Buddha, And show them icons for them to behold, Causing them to take refuge in the Buddha, Is how this light can be made.

'od zer chos rab brjod pa rab bkye zhing / / sems can ji snyed 'od zer des bskul ba/ /
chos nyan rjod cing de bzhin 'dri ba byed/ / chos la mos pas rtag tu dga' bar 'gyur/ / chos kyi mu ge'i dus su chos brjod de/ / chos tshol rnams kyi bsam pa rdzogs byas shing / /
mos pa bskyed de chos la brtson gyis zhes/ / brjod pa chos rab rjod pa des thob bo/ /

It also emanates a light called “delight in the Teaching”: This light can awaken all beings, Causing them to always delight in the true teaching, Listening to it, expounding it, writing and copying it. Being able to expound the teaching when it’s about to perish, Causing those who seek the teaching to be fulfilled, Appreciating the teaching and striving to practice it, Is how this light can be made.

sangs rgyas sras rnams yongs su bskul ba'i phyir/ / 'od zer dbyangs dang ldan pa rab bkye zhing / /
khams gsum sgra rgyud ji snyed yod pa dag / kun kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung du thos/ / gsal ba'i dbyangs sgrar drang srong cher brjod de/ / rol mo sgra chen dril gyi sbyin pa rnams/ /
'gro ba kun la rgyal ba'i gsung don du/ / yongs su btang bas 'od zer dbyangs ldan thob/ /

It also radiates a light called “wondrous sound”: This light can awaken enlightening beings And cause all voices heard in the world To be to the hearer the voice of Buddha. Praising the Buddha out loud, And presenting music like bells and chimes, And causing all creatures to hear the sound of Buddha, Is how this light can be made.

'od zer 'chi med sbyin pa rab bkye zhing / / sems can ji snyed 'od zer des bskul ba/ /
bag med spyod pa thams cad rnam spangs te/ / yon tan kun la rnal 'byor nyams su len/ / 'dus byas rtag tu bde ba med pa ste/ / sdug bsngal 'tshe ba mang pos yongs su gang / /
'gog pa rtag tu bde zhing zhi dga' zhes/ / brjod pas 'chi med sbyin pa de thob bo/ /

It also emits a light called “dispensing elixir”: This light can awaken all beings, Causing them to give up all indulgence And fully practice all virtues. Explaining the instability of created things And how they’re filled with countless vexations, Always happily extolling the bliss of dispassionate tranquility Is how this light can be made.

'od zer khyad par ldan pa rab bkye zhing / / sems can ji snyed 'od zer des bskul ba/ /
tshul khrims khyad par ting 'dzin khyad par dang / / shes rab khyad par rgyal ba rnams la nyan/ / tshul khrims 'phags pa ting 'dzin 'phags pa ste/ / shes rab 'phags pa thub pa'i rgyal chen zhes/ /
byang chub don du bsngags shing bstod byas pas/ / des ni 'od zer khyad par ldan pa thob; /

It also emanates a light called “supreme”: This light awakens all beings, Causing them to hear from the Buddhas, The supreme teachings of discipline, concentration, and knowledge. Always gladly praising all Buddhas’ Supreme self-control, concentration, and knowledge, In this way seeking the unexcelled Path, Is how this light is attained.

'od zer rin chen rnam brgyan rab bkye zhing / / sems can ji snyed 'od zer des bskul ba/ /
rin chen gter mang mi zad thob gyur te/ / drang srong che la rin chen dam pas mchod/ / rgyal ba rnams dang rgyal ba'i mchod rten la/ / rin chen phul zhing 'gro ba nyon mongs la/ /
rin chen bsdud de rin chen sbyin btang bas/ / rin chen rnam par brgyan pa'i 'od zer grub/ /

It also radiates a light called “jewel adornment”: This light can awaken all beings, Causing them to attain an inexhaustible treasury of jewels To offer to the enlightened ones. Presenting various excellent jewels To the Buddhas and Buddhas’ shrines, Also giving them generously to the poor, Is how this light can be made.

'od zer spos mchog snang ba rab bkye zhing / / sems can ji snyed 'od zer des bskul ba/ /
mi la med pa'i spos dri tshor gyur nas/ / sangs rgyas yon tan rnams la nges par 'gyur/ / mi dang lha yi spos dang byug pa yis/ / mi yi gtso la mchod pa rab byas te/ /
spos kyis rgyal ba'i sku gzugs mchod rten dag / byas pas 'od zer spos mchog snang ba grub/ /

It also emits a light called “adornment of fragrance”: This light can awaken all beings, Causing those who sense it to be pleased And assured of fulfilling enlightened virtues. Spreading the ground with exquisite incense To offer to the supreme Guides, And also therewith making shrines and icons, Is how this light can be made.

'od zer sna tshogs rnam brgyan rab bkye zhing / / gdugs dang rgyal mtshan ba dan sna tshogs mchog /
rol mo sgra snyan spos dang bdug spos kyis/ / pho brang dam pa yongs brgyan me tog 'gengs/ / sngon chad rgyal ba rol mos bsu byas te/ / me tog byug pa bdug spos phye ma dang / /
gdugs dang rgyal mtshan ba dan mchog dag gis/ / mchod pa byas pas sna tshogs rgyan grub bo/ /

It also emanates a light called “various adornments” With jewel pennants and canopies beyond number, Burning incense, scattering flowers, playing music, Filling cities, inside and out. Having originally presented the Buddhas with various adornments: Wonderful dancing and music, Perfumes, flowers, pennants, canopies, and such, Is how this light was made.
'od zer shin tu dar byed rab bkye zhing / / sa rnams lag mthil bzhin du gnas par byed/ / mchod rten drang srong gnas rnams sbyangs byas pas/ / des ni 'od zer shin tu dang byed grub/ /
It also radiates a light called “purification” Which causes the ground to be flat as a palm. Adorning the Buddhas’ shrines and their surroundings Is how this light can be made.

It also emits a light called “great clouds” Which can produce fragrant clouds and rain fragrant water. Sprinkling the shrines and their precincts Is how this light is made.
It also emanates a light called “adornments” Which can cause the naked to be clothed. Giving fine things to adorn the body Is how this light is made.
It also radiates a light called “excellent savor” Which can cause the hungry to get fine food. Giving various delicacies Is how this light is made.
It also radiates a light called “great wealth” Which causes the poor to gain treasure. Giving unlimited things to the Buddha, Teaching, and Community, Is how this light can be made.
It also emits a light called “clarity of eye” Which can cause the blind to see all forms and colors. Giving lamps to Buddhas or their shrines Is how this light is made.
It also emanates a light called “clarity of ear” Which can cause the deaf to be able to hear. Playing music for Buddhas or at their shrines Is how this light is made.
It also radiates a light called “clarity of nose” By which one can smell scents hitherto unnoticed. Giving incense to the Buddhas and their shrines Is how this light is made.
It also emits a light called “purity of tongue” Able to praise the Buddhas in beautiful tones. Forever getting rid of coarse, unwholesome speech Is how this light is made.
It also emits a light called “purity of body” Which causes the impaired to be fully restored. Prostrating the body to Buddhas and their shrines Is how this light is made.
It also radiates a light called “purity of mind” Causing the absent-minded to gain right mindfulness. Practicing concentration till totally mastered Is how this light is made.

'od zer chen po'i sprin ldan rab bkye zhing / / spos kyi char 'bebs sprin rnams kun nas gnas/ / mchod rten gam yo spos chus yongs btab pas/ / 'od zer sprin dang ldan pa rab tu thob/ /
'od zer lhab lhub rnam brgyan rab bkye zhing / / gos med gos yod rgyan dang ldan par 'gyur; ; gos dang bgo ba phreng ba sna tshogs dag / yongs su btang bas lhab lhub rnam brgyan grub/ /
'od zer bro mchog ldan pa rab bkye zhing / / bkres pa kha zas bro mchog thob par 'gyur/ / zas dang skom dang bro mchog sna tshogs rnams/ / byin pas bro mchog ldan pa'i 'od kyang thob/ /
'od zer nor ston rab tu gyes byas shing / / phongs pa rin chen gter rnams thob par 'gyur/ / gnas dang gter rnams mi zad dkon mchog gsum/ / gsol pas nor ston 'od zer de thob bo/ /
'od zer mig sbyong rab tu gyes byas shing / / long ba de tshe sna tshogs gzugs mthong 'gyur/ / rgyal ba dag dang rgyal ba'i mchod rten la/ / mar me gsol bas mig sbyong 'od zer grub/ /
rna ba rnam sbyong 'od zer rab bkye zhing / / rna ba nyams pa sgra mang thos par 'gyur/ / rgyal ba rnams dang rgyal ba'i mchod rten la/ / sil snyan phul bas rna ba rnam spyod thob/ /
'od zer sna sbyong rab tu gyes byas shing / / sngon chad ma tshor dri zhim tshor bar 'gyur/ / rgyal ba rnams dang rgyal ba'i mchod rten la/ / spos zhim gsol bas sna sbyong 'od zer grub/ /
'od zer lce sbyong rab tu gyes byas shing / / sgra snyan yid du 'ong bas sangs rgyas bstod/ / mi snyan brlang bar smra ba rnams spangs te/ / 'jam par smra bas lce sbyong 'od zer grub/ /
'od zer lus sbyong rab tu gyes byas shing / / dbang po nyams pa dbang po ldan par 'gyur/ / rgyal ba rnams dang rgyal ba'i mchod rten la; ; lus kyis rab btud lus sbyong 'od zer thob/ /
'od zer sems sbyong rab tu gyes byas shing / / smyos pa thams cad rang bzhin sems su 'gyur/ / ting 'dzin rjes su sems 'gro rab byas pas/ / des ni sems sbyong 'od zer de grub bo/ /

'od zer gzugs sbyong rab tu gyes byas shing / / bsam yas sku mnga' mi yi dbang po mthong / / sku gzugs ri mo sna tshogs mang po dang / / mchod rten rgyan byas gzugs sbyong thob par 'gyur/ /
'od zer sgra sbyong rab tu gyes byas shing / / sgra ni sgra min stong par rab tu shes; ; rkyen las byung bas sgra brnyan 'dra 'o zhes/ / sgra rnams bstan pas 'od zer de grub bo/ /
'od zer dri sbyong rab tu gyes byas shing / / dri nga thams cad dri zhim mchog tu 'gyur; ; spos mchog rab chus rgyal ba'i mchod rten dag / khrus byas byang chub shing gi 'od de yin/ /
'od zer bro sbyong rab tu gyes byas shing / / dug can dug med ro yi mchog tu 'gyur; ; sangs rgyas nyan thos bcas dang pha ma la/ / bro mchog thams cad phul ba'i 'od de yin/ /

It also emanates a light called “purity of form” Causing one to see the inconceivable forms of Buddhas. Adorning shrines in various beautiful forms Is how this light is made.
It also emits a light called “purity of sound” Causing knowledge of the basic emptiness of the nature of sound. Contemplating the dependent origination of sound, like echoes in a valley Is how this light is made.
It also radiates a light called “purity of scent” Causing all bad odors to be sweetly purified. Washing the shrines and enlightenment trees with fragrant water Is how this light is made.
It also emits a light called “purity of taste” Which can eliminate all poisons in food. Continued support of the Buddha, Community, and parents Is how this light is made.

'od zer reg sbyong rab tu gyes byas shing / / reg na mi bde thams cad 'jam bder 'gyur/ / tri shul mdung dang ral gri mda' yi char/ / phreng ba yid 'ong ut+pal pad+mor 'gyur/ / gos mang 'jam pa reg na bde ba'i rnams/ / rgyal ba gshegs pa'i lam du bting bkram ste/ / me tog byug pa na bza' 'jam pa dang / / phreng ba bla re gsol ba'i 'od de yin/ /

It also emanates a light called “purity of feeling” Able to soften what’s unpleasant to touch; Though spears and swords rain from the sky, It can change them all to flower garlands. By having in the past spread the roads With perfumes, scattered flowers, and robes For the Buddhas to walk upon Is how such a light was attained.

'od zer chos sbyong rab tu gyes byas shing / / ba spu kun nas 'jig rten phan mdzad pa'i/ / bsam yas chos mang 'byung ba thos par 'gyur/ / mos pa'i lam tshul bzhin du dga' bar byed/ / rkyen las byung bas ma skyes rang bzhin yin/ / rgyal ba'i sku ni chos kyi sku yin te/ / chos nyid nam mkha' bzhin du rtag gnas zhes/ / brjod pas chos sbyong 'od zer de thob bo/ /
'od zer sgo mo de dag la sogs pa/ / drang srong rnams kyi ba spu'i sgo gcig nas/ / gang+gA'i bye ma snyed kyi 'od zer byung / / kun kyang tha dad las kyi tshul can no/ / ji ltar ba spu gcig gi sgo gcig nas/ / 'od zer gang+gA'i bye snyed yongs 'byung ba/ / de bzhin ma lus spu rnams thams cad nas/ / drang srong ting 'dzin rnam 'phrul de 'dra 'o/ / yon tan gang gis 'od zer grub 'gyur ba'i/ / yon tan de la bstad grogs sus byas pa/ / de dag 'od zer de dag nyid kyang 'byung / / drang srong ting 'dzin rnam 'phrul de 'dra 'o/ / de dag bsod nams bstad grogs byas pa la/ / rjes su yi rang smon lam sus btab dang / / gang gis mthong ste dge ba bsags gyur pa/ / de dag kun kyang 'od zer de dag shes/ /

It also radiates a light called “purity of phenomena” Able to cause all hair pores to expound Inconceivable wonderful teachings So all who hear joyfully understand. What originates from causes and conditions has no origination; The reality-body of the Buddhas is not a body; The nature of things is eternally like space: By explaining these meanings is there light like this.
Such incomparable gateways of lights Are innumerable, like sand grains of the Ganges River; All emerge from the Great Sage’s pores, Each performing a distinct function. As the lights emanated from a single pore Are countless, innumerable as the Ganges’ sands, So are those of each and every pore: This is the power of the Sage’s concentration. According to the lights attained by past practice, Those who practice likewise, according to their affinities, Now radiate lights therefore like this: This is the freedom of the Sage’s knowledge. Those who practiced virtuous deeds like the Buddha And had appreciation and rejoiced in accord, Who saw what he did and then did likewise, They are all able to see this light.

gang gis bsod nams byas shing dge bsags te/ / sangs rgyas yang dang yang du mchod byas shing / / sangs rgyas yon tan 'dod cing don gnyer ba/ / de dag kun la 'od zer de dag skul/ /
dmus long rnams kyis nyi ma mi mthong yang / / de med ma yin 'jig rten kun tu 'char/ / mig dang ldan pas shar bar shes gyur nas/ / kun kyang rang rang so so'i las la 'jug / de bzhin skyes chen 'od zer de dag kyang / / med pa ma yin kun tu 'phro ba ste/ / de dag mos med log pas mnar ba yin/ / phal gyis mi mthong blo gros yangs la mos/ /
rgyan dang nor bu gzhon pa gzhal med khang / / rin chen ro mchog spos dang byug pa'i rnams/ / de dag che bar gyur la yod mod kyi/ / nyon mongs phongs pa rnams la yod pa min/ /

If any practice virtuous deeds themselves And make offerings to innumerable Buddhas, Always aspiring to the virtues of buddhahood, They are awakened by this light.
Just as when those born blind don’t see the sun It is not because there’s no sun appearing in the world— All those who have eyes can clearly see it, Each doing their work according to their occupations, So it is with the lights of the Great Being— Those who have wisdom all can see, While ordinary folk with false beliefs and low understanding Cannot perceive these lights at all.
Crystal palaces and chariots Painted with precious ethereal scents Are naturally supplied to those with virtue: They cannot be occupied by the virtueless ones; So it is with the Great Being’s lights: Those of deep knowledge are all illumined, While the ignorant, with false beliefs and poor understanding Are not able to see these lights at all.
gang gis 'od zer bye brag 'di thos te/ / dad pa yid ches mos pa skyes gyur na/ / bdag ni yon tan chen po'i rgyal mtshan du/ / mi 'gyur snyam du nem nur des mi bskyed/ /
If any who hear of the varieties of these lights Can develop pure and profound faith and resolution, They’ll sunder forever the web of all doubts And promptly complete the banner of virtue.

de dag 'khor gyi rgyan du rnam 'phrul bar/ / ting 'dzin dam pa mngon par sgrub byed kyi/ / phyogs bcu kun tu dpe zla med pa yi/ / rgyal sras 'khor rnams yongs su ston pa byed/ / de dag pad+mo mdzes pa stong gsum tsam/ / 'od kyis rnam brgyan byin gyis brlabs byas shing / / lus gcig skyil mo krung gi pad+mo de/ / yongs su rgyas ston ting 'dzin rnam par 'phrul/ / de dag zhing bcu'i rdul snyed pad+mo gzhan/ / 'khor dang bcas pa byin gyis brlabs byas shing / / rgyal sras kun gyis kun nas yongs bskor ba/ / de dag ting 'dzin ting 'dzin med par spyod/ /

There’s a supreme concentration that can produce Arrays of retinues, all free, Incomparable assemblies of Buddha-children Of all buddha-lands in the ten directions: There is a lotus blossom, adorned with lights, Of equal extent to a billion world galaxy, On which the enlightening being sits, completely filling it— This is the mystic power of this concentration. There are also lotus blossoms surrounding, As many as atoms in ten lands, On which the hosts of Buddha-children sit, Abiding in the spiritual power of this concentration.

drang srong des ni yongs su smin byas te/ / rgyal ba'i legs la yongs su gang bsgrubs pa/ / de dag pad+mo chen po'i 'khor byed cing / / kun kyang thal mo sbyar te ngor yang lta/ / skyes bu chen po'i chos nyid de 'dra ste/ / gang rnams ting 'dzin rnams spyod zhugs gyur pa/ / kun kyang rang rang slob mas bskor 'gyur te/ / zla ba skar ma'i tshogs kyis bskor ba bzhin/ / de dag ji ltar phyogs gcig 'jug byed cing / / sangs rgyas sras kyi 'khor rnams ston byed pa/ / de bzhin ma lus phyogs rnams thams cad du; ; ston te ting 'dzin rnam 'phrul de 'dra'o/ /

Having fully developed good causes in the past And fully practiced the virtues of buddhahood, Such people surround the enlightening being, All joining their palms and gazing tirelessly. Like the bright moon among the stars Is the enlightening being in the midst of the congregation. Such is the practice of the great being Entering the spiritual power of this concentration. As manifested in one region Surrounded by hosts of Buddha-children, So it is in all regions, Abiding in this spiritual power of concentration.

de dag ting 'dzin rab rnams mngon sgrub cing / / phyogs kyi dra bar snrel zhir spyod pa byed/ / la la mnyam bzhag la la rnam langs par; ; rang rang lus kyang phyogs rnams kun tu ston/ / de dag shar gyi phyogs su mnyam bzhag cing / / dpa' bo de dag nub kyi phyogs nas ldang / / nub kyi phyogs su de bzhin mnyam bzhag cing / / shar gyi phyogs nas bdag nyid che ba ldang / / de bzhin phyogs bcu kun tu 'jug byed de/ / phyogs rnams gzhan du mnyam par bzhag byas shing / / ye shes yon tan mang po gzhan las ldang / / drang srong ting 'dzin rnam 'phrul de 'dra'o/ /

There’s a supreme concentration called “network of loci”— The enlightening being dwelling in this teaches widely, Appearing bodily in all quarters, Sometimes entering concentration, sometimes emerging: Sometimes entering right concentration in the East And emerging from concentration in the West, Sometimes entering right concentration in the West And emerging from concentration in the East, Sometimes entering right concentration in other directions And emerging from concentration in still others, Sometimes entry and emergence pervade all ten directions: This is called the enlightening being’s concentration power.

shar phyogs zhing grangs ji snyed yod pa rnams/ / ma lus de dag kun gyi rang byung gi / spyan snga zhabs kyi drung na ting 'dzin la/ / zhi bar rnam par spyod par de dag snang / / der ni mnyam bzhag sems can bstan byas nas/ / nub kyi zhing rnams kun nas dpa' bo rnams; ; langs shing rgyal ba kun gyi spyan snga na/ / mchod pa rnam mang du ma byed par snang / / nub kyi zhing grangs ji snyed yod pa rnams/ / ma lus de dag kun gyi sangs rgyas kyi/ / spyan snga zhabs kyi drung na ting 'dzin la/ / zhi bar rnam par spyod par de dag snang / / der ni mnyam bzhag sems can bstan byas nas/ / shar gyi zhing rnams kun nas dpa' bo rnams/ / langs shing rgyal ba kun gyi spyan snga na/ / mchod pa rnam mang du ma byed par snang / / phyogs bcu'i zhing du 'jug pa de 'dra ste/ / phyogs rnams kun tu ma lus dpa' bo rnams/ / la la mnyam bzhag la la rnam par langs/ / 'jig rten sgron ma kun la mchod byed snang / /

Appearing before and associating with All the countless Buddhas In the lands throughout the East While dwelling in this concentration, silent and unmoving, And emerging from concentration In the presence of all the Buddhas Of the worlds in the West, Making unlimited offerings to all of them; Appearing before and associating with All the countless Buddhas In the lands throughout the West While remaining in concentration, silent and unmoving, And emerging from concentration In the presence of all the Buddhas Of the worlds in the East, Making unlimited offerings to all of them, Thus does the enlightening being enter All the worlds of the ten directions, Sometimes manifesting concentration, silent and unmoving, Sometimes manifesting respectful offering to the Buddhas.

de dag mig gi lam la mnyam bzhag cing / / bdag nyid che ba gzugs kyi lam las ldang / / 'jig rten lhar bcas myos par 'gyur ba yi/ / bsam gyis mi khyab gzugs kyang kun tu ston/ / gzugs kyi lam la mnyam par bzhag byas shing / / dran dang ldan pa mig gi lam las ldang / / mig ni ma skyes ma byung rang bzhin te/ / stong pa byed pa med par ston par byed/ /
de dag rna ba'i lam la mnyam bzhag cing / / bdag nyid che ba sgra yi lam las ldang / / sgra dbyangs thams cad sgra brnyan bzhin du shes/ / 'jig rten lhar bcas de la mos par 'gyur/ / sgra yi lam la mnyam par bzhag byas shing / / dran dang ldan pa rna ba'i lam las ldang / / rna ba ma skyes ma byung rang bzhin te/ / stong pa byed pa med par ston par byed/ /
de dag sna yi lam la mnyam bzhag cing / / bdag nyid che ba dri yi lam las ldang / / dri rab mchog la 'jug par rab tu zhugs/ / 'jig rten lhar bcas de la mos par 'gyur/ / dri yi lam la mnyam par bzhag byas shing / / dran dang ldan pa sna yi lam las ldang / / sna ni ma skyes ma byung rang bzhin te; / stong pa byed pa med par ston par byed/ /
de dag lce yi lam la mnyam bzhag cing / / bro mchog kun gyi lam las ldang bar byed/ / bdag nyid che ba de dag bro mchog shes/ / 'jig rten lhar bcas de la mos par 'gyur/ / bro ba'i mchog la mnyam par bzhag byas shing / / dran dang ldan pa lce yi lam las ldang / / lce ni ma skyes ma byung rang bzhin te/ / stong pa byed pa med par ston par byed/ /
de dag lus kyi lam la mnyam bzhag cing / / bdag nyid che ba reg gi lam las ldang / / 'jig rten bde ba skyed pa'i reg la zhugs/ / 'jig rten lhar bcas de la mos par 'gyur/ / reg gi lam la mnyam par bzhag byas cing / / dran dang ldan pa lus kyi lam las ldang / / lus ni ma skyes ma byung rang bzhin te/ / stong pa byed pa med par ston par byed/ /
de dag sems kyi lam la mnyam bzhag cing / / bdag nyid che ba chos kyi lam las ldang / / chos sgrub 'jug par bya la rab tu zhugs/ / 'jig rten lhar bcas de la mos par 'gyur/ / chos kyi lam la mnyam par bzhag byas shing / / dran dang ldan pa sems kyi lam las ldang / / sems ni ma skyes ma byung rang bzhin te; ; stong pa byed pa med par ston par byed/ /

byis pa'i lus su de dag mnyam bzhag cing / / gzhon nu dar la bab pa'i lus su ldang / / gzhon nu dar la bab par mnyam bzhag cing / / rgan zhing 'khogs pa'i lus su rnam par ldang / / rgan zhing 'khogs pa'i lus su mnyam bzhag cing / / dge bsnyen dad ma'i lus su rnam par ldang / / dge bsnyen dad ma'i lus su mnyam bzhag cing / / dge bsnyen dad pa'i lus su rnam par ldang / / dge bsnyen dad pa'i lus su mnyam bzhag cing / / dge slong ma yi lus su rnam par ldang / / dge slong ma yi lus su mnyam bzhag cing / / dge slong mang du thos pa'i lus su ldang / / dge slong mang thos lus su mnyam bzhag cing / / slob dang mi slob lus su rnam par ldang / / slob dang mi slob lus su mnyam bzhag cing / / rang rgyal lus las de dag rnam par ldang / / rang rgyal lus la de dag mnyam bzhag cing / / sangs rgyas sku mchog phul du rnam par ldang / / sangs rgyas sku mchog phul la mnyam bzhag cing / / lha yi lus su de dag rnam par ldang / / lha yi lus su de dag mnyam bzhag cing / / 'phrul chen klu yi lus su rnam par ldang / / 'phrul chen klu yi lus su mnyam bzhag cing / / 'phrul chen gnod sbyin lus su rnam par ldang / / 'phrul chen gnod sbyin lus su mnyam bzhag cing / / 'byung po kun gyi lus su rnam par ldang / / 'byung po kun gyi lus su mnyam bzhag cing / / spu rtse gcig gi sgo nas rnam par ldang / / spu rtse gcig gi sgo la mnyam bzhag cing / / spu rtse kun gyi sgo nas rnam par ldang / / spu rtse kun gyi sgo nas mnyam bzhag cing / / skra rtse gcig gi sgo nas rnam par ldang / / skra rtse gcig gi sgor ni mnyam bzhag cing / / skra rtse kun gyi sgo nas rnam par ldang / / skra rtse kun gyi sgor ni mnyam bzhag cing / / rdul phran gcig las de dag rnam par ldang / / rdul phran gcig la de dag mnyam bzhag cing / / rdul phran ma lus kun las rnam par ldang / / rdul phran kun la de dag mnyam bzhag cing / / rgya mtsho rdo rje gzhi las rnam par ldang / / rgya mtsho rdo rje gzhi la mnyam bzhag cing / / rin chen shing gi 'bras las rnam par ldang / / rin chen shing gi 'bras la mnyam bzhag cing / / rgyal ba'i 'od zer rnams las rnam par ldang / / rgyal ba'i 'od zer sgor ni mnyam bzhag cing / / rgya mtsho'i chu dang chu klung kun nas ldang / / rgya mtsho chu klung kun la mnyam bzhag cing / / bdag nyid che ba me yi lam las ldang / / me yi lam la de dag mnyam bzhag cing / / dran dang ldan pa rlung gi lam las ldang / / rlung gi lam la de dag mnyam bzhag cing / / bdag nyid che ba sa yi gzhi las ldang / / sa yi gzhi la mnyam par bzhag byas shing / / lha yi gzhal med khang nas rnam par ldang / / lha yi gzhal med khang du mnyam bzhag cing / / dran dang ldan pa klu yi gnas nas ldang / / yon tan mtha' yas bsags pa de dag gi / ting 'dzin rnam thar de dag bsam mi khyab/ / rgyal ba kun gyis bskal pa bsam yas su/ / bsten par mdzad kyang zad par mi rung ngo/ /

Entering right concentration in the body of a youth, Emerging from concentration in the body of an adult, Entering right concentration in the body of an adult, Emerging from concentration in the body of one aged, Entering right concentration in the body of one aged, Emerging from concentration in the body of a devout woman, Entering right concentration in the body of a devout woman, Emerging from concentration in the body of a devout man, Entering right concentration in the body of a devout man, Emerging from concentration in the body of a nun, Entering right concentration in the body of a nun, Emerging from concentration in the body of a monk, Entering right concentration in the body of a monk, Emerging from concentration in the body of a learner or nonlearner, Entering right concentration in the body of a learner or nonlearner, Emerging from concentration in the body of a self-enlightened one, Entering right concentration in the body of a self-enlightened one, Emerging from concentration in the body of a fully enlightened one, Entering right concentration in the body of an enlightened one, Emerging from concentration in the body of a celestial being, Entering right concentration in the body of a celestial being, Emerging from concentration in the body of a dragon, Entering right concentration in the body of a dragon, Emerging from concentration in the body of a yaksha, Entering right concentration in the body of a yaksha, Emerging from concentration in the body of a ghost, Entering right concentration in the body of a ghost, Emerging from concentration in a hair pore, Entering right concentration in one hair pore, Emerging from concentration in all hair pores, Entering right concentration in all pores, Emerging from concentration on a hairtip, Entering right concentration on a hairtip, Emerging from concentration in an atom, Entering right concentration in an atom, Emerging from right concentration in all atoms, Entering right concentration in all atoms, Emerging from concentration in diamond ground, Entering right concentration in diamond ground, Emerging from concentration on a crystal tree, Entering right concentration on a crystal tree, Emerging from concentration in Buddha’s aura, Entering right concentration in Buddha’s aura, Emerging from concentration in rivers and seas, Entering right concentration in rivers and seas, Emerging from concentration in the element fire, Entering right concentration in the element fire, Emerging from concentration in the wind, mind undisturbed, Entering right concentration in the element wind, Emerging from concentration in the element earth, Entering right concentration in the element earth, Emerging from concentration in the mansion of heaven, Entering right concentration in the mansion of heaven, Emerging from concentration in space, mind undisturbed: This is called the inconceivable freedom of concentration Of the one with infinite virtues, Which all the Buddhas of the ten directions Could not thoroughly expound even in countless eons.

rgyal ba kun gyis de skad ma gsungs min/ / 'gro ba'i las kyi rnam smin bsam mi khyab/ / klu yi rnam 'phrul sangs rgyas rnam 'phrul dang / / bsam gtan pa yi rnam 'phrul bsam mi khyab/ / de dag la yang dpe bstan brjod par bya/ / de la 'dra ba'i dpe lta yod min te/ / mkhas shing gsal ba'i skye bo dpe rnams kyis/ / bsten na myur du rnam par don shes 'gyur/ /

All the enlightened ones together explain That the consequences of beings’ actions are unthinkably many. The metamorphic emanations of the dragons, the masteries of the Buddhas, And the spiritual powers of enlightening beings are also inconceivable. Though one try to illustrate this by metaphor, After all there is no metaphor that can be likened to this; However, people of wisdom and intelligence Understand their meaning by means of similitudes.

sems kyi lam la rnam thar brgyad gnas pa'i/ / nyan thos gcig tu gyur cing mang por 'gyur/ / mang por gyur cing de bzhin gcig gyur te/ / nam mkha' 'di la bsam gtan 'cha' zhing 'bar/ / 'og nas me 'bar steng nas chu yi rgyun/ / steng nas me 'bar 'og nas chu yi rgyun/ / 'gro 'dug nyal zhing 'greng ba de bzhin te/ / skad cig gcig la lus 'phrul bsam mi khyab/ / de ni snying rje chen po ldan ma yin/ / byang chub mi tshol 'jig rten yal bar gzhog ; 'on kyang lus 'phrul bsam gyis mi khyab ston/ / 'jig rten phan tshol ci phyir de mi ston/ / nyi zla mkha' las rnam par rgyu 'dong zhing / / phyogs rnams kun gyi mtsho dang lu ma dang / / lteng ka khron pa rin chen rgya mtsho'i snod/ / chu klung kun tu gzugs brnyan ston par byed/ / de bzhin bsam gyis mi khyab gzugs kun kyang / / skyes bu dpa' bo de dag phyogs bcur ston/ / ting 'dzin rnam thar kun gyi tshul la mkhas/ / de la de bzhin gshegs pa rang byung dpal/ / mtsho gsal dang bar yan lag bzhi yi dpung / / so sor rang rang gzugs brnyan tshul bzhin mthong / / ral gri shang lang sog ka mde'u thung mda'/ / bzhon pa theg pa go cha bcas pa mthong / / gang gi gzugs dang cha byad ci 'dra ba/ / chu gsal de la de bzhin ma nor mthong / / chu la zhe sdang byams pa rtog pa med/ / drang srong ting 'dzin rnam 'phrul de 'dra 'o/ /

Buddha’s followers’ minds dwell in the eight liberations And the transformations they display are all freely done: They can manifest many bodies by one body And can make one body of many bodies. They can enter fire-concentration in space, Walking, standing, sitting, and lying, all in the sky, Producing water from the upper body and fire from the lower, Or fire from the upper body and water from the lower. In this way, in the moment of one thought, They can transform freely in innumerable ways. They do not fully have great compassion And do not seek buddhahood for the sake of all beings, Yet still they can manifest such inconceivable things— How much more is the power of the great benefactors, enlightening beings: Like sun and moon traveling through space, Their lights’ reflections appearing in all places, In springs, ponds, reservoirs, and water in vessels, In jewellike rivers and seas—they reflect everywhere: So it is with the forms of enlightening beings— They appear everywhere, inconceivably; This is all the freedom of concentration, Which only the enlightened can completely realize. Like the images of four armies in the ocean water, Each distinct, not merging or mixing, Their swords, spears, bows and arrows, are many and diverse, Their armor, helmets, and chariots are not the same: Whatever the differences in the forms they have, All are reflected in the water, Yet the water itself does not discriminate— The concentration of enlightening beings is also like this.

rgya mtsho'i lha mo sgra dang ldan yod pa/ / sems can rgya mtshor ji snyed skyes pa rnams/ / de dag sgra yi yan lag dbyings tshul shes/ / sgra skad kun tu rang rang skad du brjod/ / dbyangs ldan de ni 'dod chags zhe sdang can/ / 'on kyang sgra kun dbyangs kyi tshul la mkhas/ / gzugs dang chos kyi stobs la dbang thob rnams/ / 'jig rten lhar bcas ci phyir mgur mi byed/ /

In the ocean are spirits called “good at sound” Whose voices universally adapt to all creatures of the sea, And who completely understand all their languages And make them all joyful and happy: Those spirits have greed, malice, and folly, Yet they can still understand all sounds— How much more the enlightening beings’ power of mental command— Can they not cause all beings joy?

dga' byed chung ma sgra snyan ldan pa mo/ / tshangs pa'i bu mo sems las byung ba ste/ / dam tshig bden sgrub mi tshe dga' ba yin/ / sems yid ngag rnams byin gyis rlob pa byed/ / sgra snyan ldan pa 'dod chags zhe sdang can/ / brtul zhugs grub la dbyangs kyi rjes su 'brang / / 'jig rten yid 'ong sgras kyang tshim par byed/ / ye shes yon tan mang ba cir mi ston/ /
sngags kyi tshul mkhas sgyu ma'i mkhan po yang / / sna tshogs mtha' yas gzugs mang ston pa byed/ / nyin mtshan yud dang zla ba lo brgya dang / / khyim bzang rgyas pa shin tu mdzes pa ston/ / 'dod chags sdang ldan sgyu ma'i mkhan po yang / / sgyu ma'i 'phrul gyis 'jig rten dga' bar byed/ / bsam gtan mngon shes rnam 'phrul rab byang ba; ; spyod pa'i tshul mkhas ci phyir dga' mi byed/ /
lha dang lha min dbang po 'thab pa'i tshe/ / lha min lha yang rung ste gang pham pa/ / de dag bzhon pa theg pa gdugs bcas par/ / go cha gyon bzhin 'jigs pas kun tu byer/ / lha dbang de dag 'dod chags sdang ldan yang / / lus kyi rnam 'phrul bsam gyis mi khyab ston/ / dbang phyug rdzu 'phrul dbang gnas dbang po rnams/ / lus kyi rnam 'phrul ci phyir ston mi byed/ /

There is a woman named Explanatory Ability Who was born through her parents’ supplication to heaven: If one can divorce evil and delight in truth, One can enter her body and engender wondrous eloquence. She still has desire, aversion, and ignorance, Yet can bestow elucidating powers in accord with practice— How much the more so can enlightening beings full of wisdom Bestow benefits on sentient beings.
Like a magician who knows the ways of magic Can produce any number of various things, Make an instant seem a day, a month, a year, Produce a city rich and very happy; The magician has greed, anger, and ignorance still, Yet can delight the world with magic ability— How much the more so can the power of meditation and liberation Bring all creatures joy.
When the gods and titans fought, The titans lost and ran away; Their armaments, chariots, and soldiers They hid at once where none could see. They have greed, malice, and folly, Yet are still capable of inconceivable transformations; How much the more can dwelling in fearlessness of supernormal powers Now manifest independent freedom.

rdo rje 'dzin pa'i glang po shugs ldan pa/ / 'phrul chen glang chen dbang po'i 'khor gyur pas/ / mgo mang sum cu rtsa gnyis sprul pa byed; ; mgo rnams kun la'ang mche ba drug drug ste/ / so rnams re re kun la'ang rdzing gi rnams/ / bdun bdun chus rgyas yongs su sprul pa byed/ / rdzing rnams re re kun tu pad+mo rnams/ / bdun bdun rgyan gyis rnam brgyan sprul pa byed/ / pad+mo re re lha yi bu mo dag / sgyu rtsal kun mkhas bdun bdun sprul pa byed/ / de dag rtsed mo glu gar tshul la mkhas/ / sum cu rtsa gsum dbang po de dang rtse; ; glang po de yang klu yi lus btang zhing / / lha rnams kun dang mnyam zhing 'dra bar rdzu/ / spyod pa'i tshul dang ldongs spyod kun dang mthun/ / glang po mchog gi rnam 'phrul ci 'dra ltos/ / de ni 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug can/ / 'on kyang de 'dra'i rdzu 'phrul ston byed na/ / shes rab thabs kyi stobs la byang 'gyur rnams/ / ting 'dzin brgyas kyang ci rab 'phrul mi byed/ /
sgra gcan ci dga'i tshul du lus rdzu na/ / rdo rje'i gzhi la rkang pa'i mthil bor zhing / / rgya mtsho'i zab ring lte bar phyin tsam byed/ / ri rab rtse dang nyid kyi mgo yang snyoms/ / de ni 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug can/ / 'on kyang de 'dra'i rdzu 'phrul ston byed na/ / 'jig rten sgron ma bdun rnams yongs 'dul ba/ / rdzu 'phrul mtha' yas ci rob ston mi byed/ /
bsam yas brgya byin 'phrul yang ltos shig dang / / lha dang lha dbang 'thab par gyur pa'i tshe/ / lha min bye ba 'byed pa ji snyed pa/ / de snyed brgya byin rang gi lus 'phrul byed/ / lha min dbang po lha min phal kun gyis/ / brgya byin rang rang mdun na 'dug par shes/ / de ni rdo rje 'chang bas bzung gyur ces/ / lha min dbang po kun kyang mgo myos so/ / 'jigs pa'i gzugs kyis mig stong rab bstan te/ / rdo rje me lce 'bar bar rab gzas shing / / lus la go bgos gzi brjid thub dka' ba'i/ / brgya byin mthong nas lha min dbang po 'byor/ / de ni bsod nams phal gyi stobs dang mthus/ / lha rgyal don du rnam par 'phrul byed na/ / 'gro ba ma lus kun gyi mgon gyur ba'i/ / bsod nams mi bzad rnams ko cir mi 'phrul/ /

Indra, king of gods, has a royal elephant— When it knows the king wants to go somewhere, It transforms itself, creating thirty-three heads, Each head having six tusks, With the waters of seven ponds on each tusk, Clean and fragrant, pure, still and full; In the water of each pure pond Are seven lotuses in beautiful array; On each of those adorning lotus blossoms Are seven celestial jadelike maidens Skillfully dancing and playing music Entertaining Indra, king of gods. That elephant can also lose its original form And transform its body to be like that of the gods, Completely the same in bearing and action— It has this miraculous power of transformation. It still has greed, anger, and ignorance, Yet nonetheless can manifest such miraculous powers— How much the more is one replete with skill and knowledge Free in all states of concentration.
Like the metamorphosed phantom body of a titan Walking on the diamond stratum, standing in the ocean, The water at the deepest part of the ocean only reaching its midriff While its head is level with the soaring polar mountain— It has greed, anger, and ignorance, Yet still can display such great wonders— How much the more does the demon-quelling Lamp that Lights the World Have awesome mystic powers at his command.
When the gods and the titans warred King Indra’s magic power was inconceivable— However many the troops of titans were, Indra manifested as many bodies to oppose them. The titans had the idea “Indra is coming at us And will surely capture and bind us,” So they were all anxious and scared. Indra manifested a body with a thousand eyes, Holding thunderbolts, throwing flames, Armored, armed, and awesomely majestic; The titans, seeing this, all retreated. Indra, with the power of a little virtue Still could defeat a great enemy— How much more is the savior of all Replete with virtues, all at his command.

lha rnams bskul ba'i lha rdzas lnga yod pa/ / lha yi las rnams rnam par smin pas byung / / lha rnams bag med spyod par shes gyur nas/ / mkha' las rnga yi dbyangs kyang rab tu sgrog / 'dod pa thams cad mi rtag mi brtan te/ / 'jig cing mi gnas dbu ba'i rang bzhin 'dra/ / sgyu ma smig rgyu chu yi zla ba bzhin/ / srid pa kun kyang rmi lam sprin gyi dngos/ / bag med thams cad gcugs can mya ngan ldan/ / chems kyi lam yin 'chi med lam ma yin/ / ji snyed bag med rnam par spyod pa rnams/ / bdud kyi chu srin chen pos zos pa yin/ / yongs su 'dzin pa thams cad sdug bsngal rtsa/ / skye ba thams cad 'phags pa kun gyis smad/ / 'dod pa'i yon tan mthar zad rang bzhin gyis/ / chos la mos pas rtag tu dga' bar gyis/ / brgya byin lhar bcas rnga yis bskul byas nas/ / kun kyang chos bzang mdun sar dong phyung te/ / lha mang kun la chos gtam zhi ba'i rnams/ / 'dod chags bral dang rjes su mthun pa brjod/ / rnga rab de ni gzugs med mi mthong yang / / don chen rnga yi sgra ni sgrog byed na/ / bsam pa'i tshul bzhin gzugs mang ston byed pa/ / 'gro ba kun gyi don chen cir mi byed/ /

In the heaven of happiness is a celestial drum Produced as a consequence of deeds of the gods; It knows when the gods are indulging themselves, And spontaneously produces this sound in the sky: “All objects of desire are transient, Like bubbles, foam—empty, unreal; All existents are like dreams, like mirages, Like floating clouds, the moon in the water. Indulgence is an enemy, a torment and a pain— It’s not the immortal way, but the path of birth and death. Any who act indulgently Will enter the mouth of the shark of death. As the root of all the miseries in the world, All wise people shun it. The qualities of objects of desire are perishable— You should take pleasure in what’s real and true.” When the gods of the thirty-three heavens hear this sound, They all go up into the hall of good teaching And Indra preaches for them the subtle teaching, Making them docile and tranquil, removing greed and craving. That sound is formless and cannot be seen, Yet it can benefit the celestial beings— How much the more, manifesting bodies adapting to inclinations, Can enlightening beings rescue and liberate the living.

lha dang lha min 'thab par gyur pa'i tshe/ / lha yi bsod nams khyad par mthu stobs kyis/ / lha rnams bskul ba'i lha rdzas rnga yi mchog / lha rnams 'jigs sa re zhes sgra yang sgrog / rngas bskul lha rnams yongs su dga' ba skyed/ / 'jigs med stobs dang shin tu ldan par 'gyur/ / lha min dbang po 'jigs shing dngang gyur nas/ / de ma thag tu 'jigs shing kun tu 'byin/ / de bzhin rnga 'dra 'jigs med stobs pa'i rnams/ / 'gro ba kun gyi mgon dang dpung 'gyur te/ / bdud dang nyon mongs bcom pa'i snying rje can/ / zhi ba'i sgra sgrogs nyon mongs rab tu sel/ /
dbang ba'i lha mo dgu bcu rtsa gnyis te/ / dbang po sprul pas kun kyang dga' bar 'gyur/ / gcig kyang bdag dang brgya byin brtse bar shes/ / gcig ltar lha mo kun kyang de bzhin no/ / lha mo kun kyang dga' bar gnas snang yang / / chos bzang mdun sa kun na'ang de bzhin 'dug / lha rnams kun la chos rab ston par yang / / brgya byin skad cig gcig gis rnam par 'phrul/ /
brgya byin 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug can; ; sprul pas rang gi 'khor rnams dga' byed na/ / 'gro don mi skyo spyod pa ci yi phyir/ / rdzu 'phrul stobs kyis 'jig rten dgar mi byed/ /

When the gods and titans warred, By the superior power of the gods’ virtue The celestial drum sounded, telling the hosts, “You should not worry or fear,” And the gods, hearing this declaration, Were rid of fear and increased in strength. Then the titans’ hearts trembled with fright And their troops all retreated and fled. The wonderful ambrosial concentration is like that heavenly drum: It always produces the sound of dispassion, conquering demons; Great compassion mercifully rescues all, Causing all beings to end their afflictions.
Indra has intercourse with all the goddesses, Ninety-two trillion in number, Causing each to think to herself That the king is amusing her alone. As he responds to all the goddesses’ bodies, So it is in the hall of good teaching— He can instantly manifest supernatural powers And go to everyone to preach to them.
Indra, who has greed, anger, and ignorance, Can cause all in his retinue to be happy— How much the more is skillful spiritual power Able to cause all to rejoice.

bdud kyi dkrugs ma 'gro ba'i dbang sgyur ba/ / de yi dbang du sems can 'di kun 'dod/ / las dang nyon mongs kun tu 'khri zhags kyis/ / so so'i skye bo bdud 'khrug des kyang bcings/ / de ni 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug can/ / 'gro ba mang po bdud kyi dbang byed na/ / dbang bcu'i dbang thob gyur pa ci rab ste/ / 'gro ba thams cad rang gi phyogs mi gzhog /

The king of the heaven of access to others’ enjoyments Has sovereignty in the realm of desire; With habitual confusion for a snare, He captures and binds all ordinary folk. He has greed, anger, and ignorance, Yet has mastery over sentient beings— How much the more is the possessor of the ten independent powers Able to cause beings to act in accord.

stong gsum bdag po tshangs pa chen po yang / / stong gsum kun gyi tshangs pa'i gnas rnams na/ / ma lus kun tu 'dug par rab tu snang / / tshangs pa'i sgra dbyangs yid 'ong rnams kyang sgrog / de ni 'jig rten pa yi lam gyis ni/ / bsam gtan mngon par shes pas rnam par 'phrul/ / 'jig rten yongs 'das bla na med pa yi/ / bsam gtan rnam thar gnas pa cir mi 'phrul/ /
dbang phyug chen po'i ye shes rnam 'phrul ltos/ / rgya mtsho'i sprin gyis char rnams rab bkye ba/ / skad cig gcig gis thams cad 'grang ba byed/ / thigs 'ga'i zer kyang ma lus des shes na/ / bskal pa bsam gyis mi khyab tshul bslab ste/ / sangs rgyas ye shes bla na med thob rnams/ / ci rob 'gro ba ma lus thams cad kyi/ / skad cig gcig la sems bsam shes mi 'gyur/ /
sems can las smin bsam gyis mi khyab pas/ / rlung las 'jig rten thams cad yongs su byung / / rgya mtsho ri dang lha yi gzhal med dang / / sa bon rnam mang kun kyang de las byung / / rlung las sprin 'byung char pa kun tu 'bab/ / sprin mang zhi bar 'gyur ba'ang rlung gis 'gyur/ / lo rtog rnam par 'phel ba'ang rlung gis te/ / 'jig rten kun la rlung ni bde ba skyed; ; de ni pha rol phyin la ma bslab ste/ / sangs rgyas yon tan rlung gis bslab min na'ang / / 'jig rten rnam grub bsam yas ston byed na/ / rang nyams thob pa ci ro ba ston mi byed/ /

The great brahma king of the billion world galaxy Can appear in all the abodes Of the brahma gods and sit with them, Speaking in the subtle, pure brahma voice. He abides in the worldly brahma path, Yet still commands concentration and supernatural powers— How much the more so does the transcender of the world, unexcelled, Have mastery of meditation and liberation.
The god Maheshavara’s knowledge is sovereign: When the dragons of the sea shower rain, He can count distinctly every drop, Discerning them all in a single instant: If one has diligently practiced and learned for countless eons And attained the supreme knowledge of enlightenment, How would such a one not be able To instantly know the minds of all beings?
The consequences of sentient beings’ actions are inconceivably many, Being as a great wind power, producing the worlds: Vast oceans, mountains, celestial palaces, Radiance of jewels, and all sorts of things; They also can produce clouds and bring rain, And can disperse and dissolve all cloudiness, And can ripen all grains, And comfort the living. The wind cannot learn transcendent wisdom, Or learn the qualities of buddhahood, Yet still can perform inconceivable deeds— How much the more so one who fulfills all vows.

rgya mtsho'i 'brug sgra'i sprin gyi chu tshogs ni/ / bya skad rnams dang ji snyed ri skad/ / khye'u dang bu mo bud med skyes pa'i skad/ / thams cad skad bzhin 'gro la rnam par sgrog / de bzhin sgra snyan rang bzhin sgra shes nas/ / sgrib pa med pa'i spobs pa rab ldan pas/ / 'gro ba kun tu sgra snyan brjod byas shing / / 'jig rten thams cad yid 'ong sgras tshim byed/ /
rgya mtsho 'di la ngo mtshar rmad kyi chos/ / 'gro ba thams cad rgya dang mnyam snang zhing / / chu dang 'byung po rin chen yongs mi zad/ / chu rnams bzung bas yongs su ngoms pa med/ / de bzhin de dag 'gro kun rgyar stsal te/ / bsod nams bsam gtan rnam thar zad mi shes/ / shes rab ye shes yon tan de bzhin kun/ / bsod nams yon tan tshogs kyis ngoms pa med/ / rgya mtsho'i klu ni rnam par rtse byed na/ / sa yi gzhi nas dbang sgyur gnas kyi bar/ / gling bzhi bcas par sprin chen rgyas par 'gengs/ / de dag kun kyang rgyan mang sna tshogs ldan; ; de ni dbang sgyur gnas su 'dzam bu chu klung gi / gser gyi mdog tu sprin mang rnam par sgrub/ / 'phrul dga' mu tig dmar po'i mdog lta bu/ / dga' ldan gnas su kha ba ba mo'i mdog / mtsher mar mthon mthing bai DUr+ya yi mdog / sum cu gsum du asma gar+b+ha 'dra/ / rgyal chen gnas su shel gyi mdog lta bu/ / rdo rje mi phyed sra mdog rgya mtshor ro/ / mi ci gnas su spos mchog 'dres par te/ / klu yi gnas su pad+mo'i mdog lta bu/ / gnod sbyin gnas su ngang pa chu skyar mdog / ri yi mdog tu lha min gnas su 'o/ / byang du gser gyi kha dog 'od ston te/ / gling rnams gzhan du'ang sna tshogs rgyan du ston/ / 'dzam bu'i gling du ri gnag 'dra bar te/ / sprin rnams gang rnams ji ltar grub pa bzhin/ /
dbang sgyur gnas su gser gyi sprin bstan nas/ / nyi ma'i mdog 'dra klog kyang rab tu 'gyed/ / dbang sgyur gnas su zla 'od bzang 'dra dang / / dga' ldan gnas su 'dzam bu'i gser mdog ston/ / kha ba ba mo'i mdog tu mtshe mar te/ / sum cu rtsa gsum gnas su gser mdog tu/ / rgyal chen gnas su dpal gyi snying po'i mdog / mu tig dmar po'i mdog tu rgya mtshor ro/ / mi ci gnas su mthon mthing bai DUr+ya/ / klu yi gnas su dpal gyi snying po'i mdog / gnod sbyin gnas su shel gyi kha dog ste/ / a.asma'i mdog tu lha min gnas su 'o/ / byang du ngang gis snang ba'i rin chen mdog / gling rnams gzhan du'ang rnam phye gzhan dang gzhan/ / 'dzam bu'i gling du 'od 'phro an+d+ha rnyil/ / sprin gyi mtshan nyid tshul 'thun glog kyang 'gyed/ /

de ni tshangs pa'i dbang sgyur gnas su tshangs dbyangs su/ / 'brug sgra sgrog byed 'phrul dga' rnga yi dbyangs/ / rol mo'i sgrar yang dga' ldan gnas su ste/ / lha mo'i dbyangs su mtshe ma dag tu 'o/ / sum cu gsum du mi'am ci'i skad du ste/ / rgyal chen gnas su dri za'i skad du 'o/ / ri 'thab dbyangs su rgya mtsho kun tu ste/ / mi'am ci yi gnas su gling bu'i sgra/ / klu yi gnas su thal mo brdabs pa'i sgra; ; gnod sbyin gnas su klu yi bu mo'i sgra/ / lha min gnas su lha rdzas rnga yi sgra/ / rgya mtsho'i shugs sgrar mi yi gnas su 'o/ /

dbang sgyur gnas su lha rdzas gsung zhim pa'i/ / me tog sna tshogs rgyan mang char yang 'bebs/ / zla ba bzang po'i 'od 'dra 'phrul dgar te/ / me tog man+dA ra ba'i phred [*phreng?] char 'bebs/ / dga' ldan gnas su rin chen chen po'i char/ / rgyan gyi dam pa rin chen sna tshogs dang / / gtsug gi rin chen zla ba 'dra ba dang / / gser 'od zer bzang po'i char pa rab tu 'bebs/ / rgyal mtshan gdugs dang ba dan bzang po dang / / phreng ba byug pa rgyan gyi dam pa dang / / mu tig dmar po la ltar btags mdog tu/ / rol mo yid 'ong char pa mtshe mar 'bebs/ / sum cu gsum du rin chen sna tshogs te; ; tsan+dan dam pa'i spos dang a.a ga ru/ / gur gum ge sar lha rdzas ta ma la/ / spos chu'i rgyun dang me tog 'dres par 'bebs/ / nyams su 'gyur ba'i kha zas skom gyi rnams/ / kha dog dri zhim ro dang ldan pa dang / / de min rin chen char 'bab bsam yas kyang / / rgyal chen bzhi yi gnas su klu dbang 'bebs/ / de ni rgya mtsho chen por rgyun du yang / / char rgyud rgyun mi 'chad pa gnya' shing tsam/ / mi zad rin chen shin tu rnam rgyal ba'i/ / rin chen char ni mtha' yas rgyun du 'babs/ / mi ci gnas su phreng ba sna tshogs dang / / pad+mo ut+pal dngos dang rin chen dang / / me tog par shi ma li phye ma spos/ / pi wang rnga dang gling bu snyan par ro/ / klu yi gnas su mu tig dmar po ste/ / gnod sbyin gnas su rin chen snang ba; ; lha min gnas su ral gri mde'u thung mdung / / dgra 'dul gzhu dang ste'u ka'i char 'bebs so/ / byang du de ni phreng ba rin chen dang / / me tog par shi ma li tsam pa ka'i/ / phreng ba bzang po ku ran muk+ta ka / gling rnams gzhan du'ang char pa sna tshogs so/ / 'dzam bu'i gling du chu 'dang rab gsal gyi/ / char rnams sna tshogs shin tu phra bar 'bebs/ / me tog 'bras bu sman dang spos dang shing / / lo las de bzhin 'jig rten bde 'phel byed/ / de ltar sprin rnams bsam gyis mi khyab dang / / glog dang 'brug dang char pa rnam phyed kyang / / khyim nas mi g.yo rnam par rtog pa med/ / klu yi 'phrul yang de ltar bsam mi khyab/ / de ltar chu yi rgya mtshor gnas pa yang / / klu yi rnam 'phrul bsam yas ston byed na/ /

In the heaven of free access to others’ enjoyments rain perfumes With various mixed flowers as embellishments; In the heaven of enjoyment of emanations rain cotton flowers, Mandarava flowers, and rich perfumes; In the heaven of happiness rain crystals Complete with adornments of various jewels; The jewels in the topknots there are like moonlight, The exquisite clothes worn there are the color of gold; In the heaven of time rain banners and canopies, Garlands, perfumes, and beautiful decorations, As well as excellent raiment the color of pearl And various kinds of music; In the heaven of thirty-three realms rain wish-fulfilling jewels, Solid black aloes and sandalwood fragrance, Various perfumes of heavenly flowers Raining down intermingled with each other; In the citadels of the world guardians rain delicacies With color, aroma, and flavor with strengthening power; It also rains inconceivable beautiful jewels, All made by the dragon kings. Also in the oceans It rains increasingly, like a whirl, And rains inexhaustible treasuries of jewels, And rains various jewel ornaments as well. In the world of kinnaras it rains necklaces, Lotuses of many colors, robes, and jewels, Flowers that grow in the rains, and golden colored flowers, With various kinds of music all included therein. In the castles of the dragon kings rain ruddy pearls; Among the titans it rains weapons Conquering all enemies. In the continent Uttara it rains necklaces And also rains innumerable exquisite flowers; In the continents Purvavideha and Aparagodaniya It rains various ornamental articles; In the continent Jambudvipa it rains pure water, Fine, refreshing, always at appropriate times, Nourishing flowers, fruits, and herbs, Ripening all the crops. Innumerable such beautiful adornments, Various clouds, lightning, thunder, and rain, The dragon kings can freely make Without moving their bodies, without discrimination In their world, the ocean, they dwell, Yet can manifest this inconceivable power— How much the more those who enter the ocean of truth and embody virtue Can produce great mystical transformations.

chos kyi rgya mtshor zhugs pa'i yon tan bdag / mtha' yas rnam 'phrul mang po cir mi ston/ / dper bya de dag kun gyis mgo smos tsam/ / skyes bu de dag brjod byas yangs pa ste/ /
dpa' bo de dag dpe dang rnam par bral/ / de dag de 'dra'i rnam thar dbang bsgyur ro/ /
The doors of liberation of the enlightening beings Cannot be revealed by any similes, But I have, with these metaphors, Said something of their free power.

mtha' yas blo gros yangs pa'i blo gros can/ / ma nor blo gros mtha' yas blo gros can/ / ye shes mchog dang khyad par blo ldan pa'i/ / rnam thar dam pa de 'dra'i tshul du bshad/ /
gang gis rnam thar 'di dag thos gyur nas/ / yid ches 'dzin cing 'jig rten sgrog pa ni/ / ngo mtshar rmad kyi chos dang de ldan te/ / mi yul kun na de ni dka' ba byed/ /
'di 'dra'i chos la yid ches dad byed pa/ / so so skye bo'i tshogs na'ang shin tu dkon/ /
dge bsags bsod nams byas pa de dag ni/ / rgyu yi stobs kyis 'di la yid ches 'gyur/ /
gang rnams nyan thos theg la'ang yid ches pa'i/ / mi rnams 'jig rten kun na dkon pa ste/ / de bas rang rgyal theg pa dad pa dkon/ / theg chen dad byed de bas shin tu dkon/ /

Foremost knowledge, vast wisdom, True knowledge, boundless wisdom, Extraordinary wisdom, supreme wisdom— Such a teaching has now been explained.
This teaching is rare and most extraordinary; If people who have heard it can accept, Can believe, absorb, praise, and explain it, This accomplishment is to be considered most difficult.
Of all the ordinary people in the world It’s hard to find one with faith in this teaching.
If any diligently cultivate pure virtues, By the power of past cause they can believe.
Among the creatures of all worlds Are few who want to seek the vehicle of Buddha’s followers; Those who seek solitary enlightenment are even fewer, And those who aim for the Great Vehicle are very hard to find.

theg chen 'di la zhugs pa dkon pa ste/ / 'di 'dra'i chos la dad pa shin tu dkon/ / 'dzin cing spel byed smos kyang ci dgos te/ / yang dag ma nor 'jug pa smos ci dgos/ /
la la stong gsum ri dang rgya mtshor bcas/ / bskal par 'dzin cing mgo la khyer byed na'ang / / 'di 'dra'i chos la dad par byed pa las/ / de 'dra dka' bar brtsi ba ma yin no/ /
la las stong gsum rdul snyed sems can rnams/ / bde ba kun gyis bskal par bsnyen bkur na'ang / / 'di 'dra'i chos la yid ches dad byed pa'i/ / bsod nams ci 'dra thob pa de la min/ /
la la zhing bcu ri dang mtshor bcas pa/ / lag pa'i mthil gyis nam mkha'i dbyings 'dzin kyang / / 'di 'dra'i chos la yid ches dad byed pa'i/ / dka' ba de 'dra de la yod pa min/ /
la la zhing bcu'i rdul snyed sems can rnams/ / bde ba kun gyis bskal par bsnyen bkur kyang / / 'di 'dra'i chos la yid ches dad byed pa'i/ / bsod nams ci 'dra de 'dra de la min/ /

But striving for the Great Vehicle is still easy Compared to the greater difficulty of believing this teaching. Even more difficult it is to retain, recite, and explain it for others, To practice according to the teaching and truly understand it.
To hold a galaxy on one’s head Without moving, for one eon, Is not to be considered difficult Compared to believing this teaching.
To pick up ten buddha-lands in the hand And stand in space through an eon Is not to be considered hard Compared to believing this teaching.
If one provides comforts for an eon To the homes of beings numerous as atoms in ten lands, His merit is not to be considered supreme— One who believes this teaching is most excellent.
Even spending an eon serving Buddhas as many as atoms in ten lands, One’s merit will be greater, supreme, If one can recite and hold this book.

la las zhing bcu'i rdul snyed sangs rgyas rnams/ / bskal par bde ba kun gyis bsnyen bkur te/ / la las le'u 'di yongs su bzung byas na/ / bsod nams 'di ni de las khyad par 'phags/ /
rnam thar de dag yongs su bstan pa'i tshe/ / phyogs bcu'i zhing rnams thams cad g.yos par gyur/ / lha dang bdud kyi gnas rnams zil gyis mnan/ / 'od mang bkye bas ngan song rab tu zhi/ /
phyogs bcu kun gyi mi yi seng+ge rnams/ / thams cad kun gyis mngon par zhal bstan te/ / phyag brkyang mtha' yas yon tan mang bdog pa/ / bzang po'i dpal gyi mgo la bzhag par gyur/ /
phyag gi mthil gyis mgo la byug mdzad de/ / sangs rgyas de dag kun gyis gsung brjod pa/ / rnam thar 'di dag khyod kyis legs bshad kyi/ / legs par bstan la rjes su nged dgyes so/ /

When the enlightening being Chief in Goodness had spoken these verses, the worlds in the ten directions quaked in six ways, the palace of demons was shrouded, the realms of ill ceased; the Buddhas of the ten directions appeared before him and each patted him on the head with his right hand and praised him, saying, “Excellent! You incisively explain this teaching, and we all accordingly rejoice.”
End of the second assembly.
shin tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo/ sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba las/ bzang po'i dpal gyi le'u zhes bya ba ste/ bcu bdun pa'o// //
